en: And it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;
hmr: Chun, Saula a thi hnungin, David chu Amalek mihai rûnnaa inthawkin a hung a, David chu Ziklag khuoa ni hni a um hnung chun,

en: it came to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul, with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.
hmr: a ni thum ni chun, ngai ta, mi pakhat an ṭhanghmuna inthawk Saula kuoma mi chu a puonhai tlêr nengnungin le a lua pilvut kai nung hin a hung a; chun, David kuomah a hung tlung chun hnuoia bawkkhupin chibai a bûk a.

en: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.
hmr: David chun a kuomah, “Khaw laia inthawka hung am i nih a?” a ta; ama chun, “Israel mihai ṭhanghmuna inthawkin ka hung tlân suok a nih,” a ta.

en: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, The people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuomah, “Ieng angin am thil a um a, mi hril ta khai?” a ta. Ama chun a dawn a, “Indonaa inthawk chun mihai chu an tlânseh a, mi tamtak chu an tluh a, an thi tâwl a, chun, Saula le a naupa Jonathan khawm an thi ve a,” a ta.

en: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son are dead?
hmr: Chun, David chun a hriltu tlangvâl kuoma chun, “Iengtin am Saula le a naupa Jonathan chu an thi ti i hriet a?” a ta.

en: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul was leaning upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and the horsemen followed hard after him.
hmr: A hriltu tlangvâl chun, “Iengtin tin amanih Gilboa tlânga chun ka lo um kher a; chun, ngai ta, Saula chu a fei ringsana ngîr ka hmuh a, chun, tawlailîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai chun an hung hnai ta hle el a.

en: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.
hmr: Chun, a hnungtieng a hung ngha chun a mi hei hmuh a, a mi hei ko a. Chun, kei chun, ‘Hitaka hin ka um ie,’ tiin ka dawn a.

en: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka kuomah, ‘Tu am i nih a?’ tiin a mîn dawn a. Chun, kei chun, ‘Amalek mi ka nih,’ tiin ka dawn a.

en: And he said unto me, Stand, I pray thee, beside me, and slay me; for anguish hath taken hold of me, because my life is yet whole in me.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, ‘Ka kâwla hin ngîr la, mi hung that el ta, ka la dam ting a, lunginzîngnain a mi tlâkkhum ta sih a,’ a ta.

en: So I stood beside him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.
hmr: Chuongchun, a kâwla chun ka ngîr a, chuonga tlu dêr ta hnung chu a dam zo ta âwm hrim hrima ka hriet naw leiin ka that ta el a, a lua lallukhum le bânbun chu ka lâk a, ka pu kuomah hitaka hin ka hung lâk a nih,” a ta.

en: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun ama silfênhai chu a chel a, a keithlêr tah a, chuong ang bawk chun a kuoma mi um po pohai chun an thaw veh a;

en: and they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of Jehovah, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.
hmr: chuongchu, Saula le a naupa Jonathan le LALPA mihai le Israel sûnghai chun an sûn a, an ṭah a, zântieng chenin bu an nghei a, kâwlhnâma sukhlum an ni tâk leiin.

en: And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a sojourner, an Amalekite.
hmr: Chun, David chun a hriltu tlangvâl kuoma chun, “Khâwtieng mi am i nih a?” a ta. Ama chun, “Hmêl- mak mi, Amalek mi naupa ka nih,” a tih a, a dawn a.

en: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to put forth thy hand to destroy Jehovah’s anointed?
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuomah, “LALPA hrieknâl sukbohmang dinga a chunga kutthlâk chu iengtiziea ṭi lo am i nih a?” a ta.

en: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him, so that he died.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun tlang- vâlhai laia mi pakhat chu a ko a, “Va hnai la, va that rawh,” a ta. Chun, a va sât a, a thi tah a.

en: And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain Jehovah’s anointed.
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuomah, “I thisen chu nangma lu chung ngeiah um raw se, nangma bâu ngeiin, ‘LALPA hrieknâl chu ka that a nih,’ tiin a phuong si cheh a,” a ta.

en: And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Saula le a naupa Jonathan chu hi ṭaphla hin a ṭah a,

en: (and he bade them teach the children of Judah the song of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jashar):
hmr: chun, thal hla chu Juda thlahai inchûktir dingin a tir tâwl a, ngai ta, Jaser bua chun ziek a nih.

en: Thy glory, O Israel, is slain upon thy high places! How are the mighty fallen!
hmr: Aw Israel, i ropuina chu i bâwlhmunahai that a na, Mi thilthawtheihai an tlu ta hi!

en: Tell it not in Gath, Publish it not in the streets of Ashkelon; Lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, Lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
hmr: Gath-a chun hril naw unla, Askelon kawtthlêrahai chun phuong bawk naw ro; Chuong naw chun Philistin naunuhai lâwm an ta, Sertan lo naunuhai hlimin khêk pal rawi an tih.

en: Ye mountains of Gilboa, Let there be no dew nor rain upon you, neither fields of offerings: For there the shield of the mighty was vilely cast away, The shield of Saul, not anointed with oil.
hmr: Nangni Gilboa tlânghai, In chungah dâidâw le ruo khawm tla naw raw se; thil inhlân ding khawm insuo bawk naw ro. Chutaka chun mi thilthawthei phaw chu tirdakumtakin an pei sih a; Saula phaw, hrieknâl lo mi phaw ang elin.

en: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, The bow of Jonathan turned not back, And the sword of Saul returned not empty.
hmr: Thathai thisena inthawk le, mi thilthawthei thâua inthawk chun, Jonathan thal chu a lêt nawh a; Saula kâwlhnâm chu a thlâwnin a lêt bawk nawh.

en: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, And in their death they were not divided: They were swifter than eagles, They were stronger than lions.
hmr: Saula le Jonathan umdân chu dit a umin a mâwi a, An thi khawma an inṭhe nawh; Mupuihai nêkin an ṭuonrang lem a, Sakeibakneihai nêkin an hrât lem.

en: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, Who clothed you in scarlet delicately, Who put ornaments of gold upon your apparel.
hmr: Nangni Israel naunuhai, Saula chu ṭa ro, Puon sen mawihaia inthuom cheu a, In puonahai rângkachaka cheimawinahai belpêktu cheu chu.

en: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! Jonathan is slain upon thy high places.
hmr: Indo lai taka mi thilthawtheihai an tlûk el chu! I bâwlhmunahai Jonathan chu an that tah.

en: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: Very pleasant hast thou been unto me: Thy love to me was wonderful, Passing the love of women.
hmr: Ka unaupa Jonathan, i chungthua hin ka lunginzîng a nih; Ka chungah i ṭha êm êm hlak a, I mi hmangaina chu a mak a, Nuhmei hmangaina chu a khûm dai a nih.

en: How are the mighty fallen, And the weapons of war perished!
hmr: Mi thilthawtheihai chu an tluh a, Indona thuomhnawhai khawm a bohmang zo tah!

en: And it came to pass after this, that the king of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, chuong hnunga chun Ammon thlahai lal chu a thih a, a naupa Hanun chu a aiawin ân lal a.

en: And David said, I will show kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father showed kindness unto me. So David sent by his servants to comfort him concerning his father. And David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.
hmr: David chun, “A pa chun a mi lo lunginsiet angin kei khawma Nahas naupa Hanun chu lunginsiet vêng ka tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, David chun a pa chungchâng thua thlamuon dingin ama mihai a tir a. Chun, David mihai chun Ammon thlahai ram chu an va tlung a.

en: But the princes of the children of Ammon said unto Hanun their lord, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, in that he hath sent comforters unto thee? hath not David sent his servants unto thee to search the city, and to spy it out, and to overthrow it?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Ammon thlahai lusahairawi chun an lal Hanun kuoma chun, “David hin i pa ân za leiin i kuoma hin thlamuontu a hung tir niin i ring am a ni? David hin khawpui a hne theina dingin a siehlawhai khawpuia hin enthlatu le enfietu dingin a hung tir a ni lem naw am a nih?” an ta.

en: So Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved off the one half of their beards, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hanun chun David mihai chu a man a, an khâkhmul chenve a vâwpêk a; chun, an silfênhai chu a laitakah an mawng tlung chau- in a tanpêk bawk a, ân fetir tah a.

en: When they told it unto David, he sent to meet them; for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.
hmr: Chun, David chu an hang hril chun, a tuok dingin mi a tir a, anni chu an inzak hle el sih a. Chun, lal chun, “In khâkhmulhai a mâwng sei hma po chu Jerikoah um hri unla, chu hnunga chun hung de ti niu,” a ta.

en: And when the children of Ammon saw that they were become odious to David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Beth-rehob, and the Syrians of Zobah, twenty thousand footmen, and the king of Maacah with a thousand men, and the men of Tob twelve thousand men.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai chun David theida zâwng an lo ni tah ti an hung inhriet chun Ammon thlahai chun Beth-rehoba mi Suria mihai le Zobaa mi Suria mihai, sipai sîng hni le, lal Maaka mi sîng khat leh, Topa mihai sîng khat le sâng hni leh an inchah a, an ruoi a.

en: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
hmr: Chun, David chun chu chu a hrietin Joab le sipai huoisenhai po po a tir a.

en: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the entrance of the gate: and the Syrians of Zobah and of Rehob, and the men of Tob and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai chu an hung suok a, khaw lûtna kawtkhâr tienga chun ṭhanghmun an siem a; chun, Zoba mihai le Rehoba mihai Suria mihai le Toba le Maaka mihai ruok chu a tumin phûlah an um a.

en: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians:
hmr: Chuongchun, an hma tieng le an hnungtieng an hung thaw ding a ni ti Joabin a hriet chun Israel mihai laia a ṭha ṭha a thlangsuok a, Suria mihai chu do dingin ṭhanghmun a lo khawh a.

en: and the rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and he put them in array against the children of Ammon.
hmr: Chun, mi dang po po chu a unaupa Abisai kutah a sie vawng a, Ammon thlahai chu thaw dingin ṭhanghmun a khaw bawk a.

en: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will come and help thee.
hmr: “Suria mihai hi ka hne naw ding chun nangin mi ṭhangpui i ta, chun, nangin Ammon thlahai hi i hne naw ding chun hung ṭhangpui ka ti che.

en: Be of good courage, and let us play the man for our people, and for the cities of our God: and Jehovah do that which seemeth him good.
hmr: Huoitakin um unla, ei mihai le ei Pathien khuohai sanin insuk pasal ei tiu; chun, LALPA chun ṭha a ti ang peiin thaw raw se,” a ta.

en: So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh unto the battle against the Syrians: and they fled before him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab le a kuoma mihai chun Suria mihai chu do dingin indona hmun tieng chu an va hnai a; chun, a hmaa chun an tlânsieh a.

en: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai, and entered into the city. Then Joab returned from the children of Ammon, and came to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai chun Suria mihai an tlânsie ti an hriet chun anni khawm chu Abisai hmaa chun an tlânse ve tah a; khuoa chun an lût a. Chun, Joab chun Ammon thlahai chu a kîrsan a, Jerusalemah a fe tah a.

en: And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they gathered themselves together.
hmr: Chun, Suria mihaiin Israelhai hmaa chun an chan a hung chau tah ti an hriet chun an inpun khâwm a.

en: And Hadarezer sent, and brought out the Syrians that were beyond the River: and they came to Helam, with Shobach the captain of the host of Hadarezer at their head.
hmr: Chun, Hadadezer chun mi a tir a, Vadung khêla Suria mihai chu a ṭhuoi suok a, Hadadezer sipai hotu Sobak chun hma a ṭhuoi a; Helamah an hung a.

en: And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel together, and passed over the Jordan, and came to Helam. And the Syrians set themselves in array against David, and fought with him.
hmr: Chun, chu chu David an hril a; chun, ama chun Israel mi po po a ko khâwm a, Jordan vadung an kai a, Helama chun an feh a. Chun, Suria mihai chun David chu do dingin ṭhanghmun an lo siem a, an lo thawh a.

en: And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians the men of seven hundred chariots, and forty thousand horsemen, and smote Shobach the captain of their host, so that he died there.
hmr: Chun, Suria mihai chu Israel- hai hmaa chun an tlânse tah a; chun, David chun Suria mi tawlailîr za sari chunga chuong le sakawr chung chuong mi sîng li a that a; chun, an sipai hotu Sobak khawm a that a, chutaka chun a thi tah a.

en: And when all the kings that were servants to Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with Israel, and served them. So the Syrians feared to help the children of Ammon any more.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hadadezer hnuoia lal siehlawa umhai po po chun Israel- hai hmaah an chan a chau tah ti an lo hriet chun, Israelhai leh inremna an siem a, an siehlawhaiah an um tah a. Chuongchun, Suria mihai chun Ammon thlahai chu an ṭhangpui ngam nâwk ta nawh a.

en: And it came to pass, at the return of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, kum dâm a hung invawi a, lalhai indo dinga an suok hlak lai chun, Davidin Joab chu a tir a, a mihai le Israel mihai po po leh; chun, Ammon thlahai chu an suk- bohmang a, Rabba khuo an inhuol a, David ruok chu Jerusalemah a um a.

en: And it came to pass at eventide, that David arose from off his bed, and walked upon the roof of the king’s house: and from the roof he saw a woman bathing; and the woman was very beautiful to look upon.
hmr: Chun, zântieng nisa innêma chun hieng hi a hung na, David chu a khuma inthawk chun a tho a, lal in inchunga chun a hang lêng a; chun, inchunga inthawk chun nuhmei pakhat insil lai hi a hei hmuh a, chu nuhmei chu hmêl ṭhatak a nih.

en: And David sent and inquired after the woman. And one said, Is not this Bath-sheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?
hmr: Chun, David chun mi a tir a, chu nuhmei chanchin chu ân dawn feltir a. Chun, mi pakhatin, “Eliam naunu, Bathseba, Hit mi Uria nuhmei a ni naw am a nih?” a tih a.

en: And David sent messengers, and took her; and she came in unto him, and he lay with her (for she was purified from her uncleanness); and she returned unto her house.
hmr: Chun, David chun mi a tir a, an va ṭhuoi tah a; chun, a kuoma a va tlung chun a lo zâlpui tah a; (a felnaw zo insukthieng laitak a na) chun, a in tieng a fe nâwk tah a.

en: And the woman conceived; and she sent and told David, and said, I am with child.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei chu a hung inrai tah a, chun, “Nau ka vawn a ni tah,” tiin David chu mi ân hriltir a.

en: And David sent to Joab, saying, Send me Uriah the Hittite. And Joab sent Uriah to David.
hmr: Chun, David chun Joab kuomah, “Hit mi Uria chu ka kuomah inhung- tir rawh,” tiin ân chah a. Chun, Joab chun Uria chu David kuomah ân fetir a.

en: And when Uriah was come unto him, David asked of him how Joab did, and how the people fared, and how the war prospered.
hmr: Chun, Uriain a kuom a hang tlung chun, Joab le mihai chu ieng am an chang a, indonahai ieng am an chang ti ân dawn a.

en: And David said to Uriah, Go down to thy house, and wash thy feet. And Uriah departed out of the king’s house, and there followed him a mess of food from the king.
hmr: Chun, David chun Uria kuomah, “I in tieng fe la, i kehai zu sâwp rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, Uria chu lal ina inthawk chun a suok a, chun, lal chun fâk dinghai leh a hnawtzui a.

en: But Uriah slept at the door of the king’s house with all the servants of his lord, and went not down to his house.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Uria chu a lalpa siehlawhai lai lal in kawtkhâr bula chun a zâl ve ta el a, a in tieng chun a fe ta nawh a.

en: And when they had told David, saying, Uriah went not down unto his house, David said unto Uriah, Art thou not come from a journey? wherefore didst thou not go down unto thy house?
hmr: Chun, David chu, “Uria chu a in tieng a fe nawh,” ti an hril phingleh David chun Uria kuoma chun, “Inzin hung i nih a ni naw am a nih? Ieng- dinga i in tieng i fe naw am?” a ta.

en: And Uriah said unto David, The ark, and Israel, and Judah, abide in booths; and my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open field; shall I then go into my house, to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife? as thou livest, and as thy soul liveth, I will not do this thing.
hmr: Uria chun David kuomah, “Pathien bâwm le Israelhai le Juda- hai chu bûkah an um a, chun, ka pu Joab le ka pu mihai chu ramhnuoiah an inkul bawk a; kei ka ina fein fain dâwnin, ka nuhmei kuomah ka zâl bîk ding maw? I hringna le i thlarau hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, chu chu thaw naw tawp ka tih,” a ta.

en: And David said to Uriah, Tarry here to-day also, and to-morrow I will let thee depart. So Uriah abode in Jerusalem that day, and the morrow.
hmr: Chun, David chun Uria kuom- ah, “Vawisûn chu hitaka hin um la, zîngah fe de ti nih,” a ta. Chuong- chun, Uria chu Jerusalema chun chu ni le a zînga khawm chun a um tah a.

en: And when David had called him, he did eat and drink before him; and he made him drunk: and at even he went out to lie on his bed with the servants of his lord, but went not down to his house.
hmr: Chun, David chun a ko a, a hmaa chun a fâkin a dâwn a, a sukrui ta dêr a; chun, zântieng chun a in tienga fe loin a pu siehlawhai laia zâl ding chun a suok a.

en: And it came to pass in the morning, that David wrote a letter to Joab, and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
hmr: Chun, a zîngah zîngkâr chun David chun Joab chu lekha a thawn a, Uria chu ân chawitir a.

en: And he wrote in the letter, saying, Set ye Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.
hmr: Chun, lekhaa chun, “Uria chu râl zuolna laitaka inhmatâwngtir unla, an thata a thi hlauna dingin thlathlam ro,” tiin a ziek a.

en: And it came to pass, when Joab kept watch upon the city, that he assigned Uriah unto the place where he knew that valiant men were.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun khuo chu ân huol vêl lai chun mi huoi huoi umna nia a hrieta chun Uria chu ân ṭhang- tir a.

en: And the men of the city went out, and fought with Joab: and there fell some of the people, even of the servants of David; and Uriah the Hittite died also.
hmr: Chun, khuoa mihai chu an hung suok a, Joab chu an hung thawh a, mi ṭhenkhat David mihai laia mi ngei khawm chu an thih a; chun, Hit mi Uria khawm chu a thih a.

en: Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war;
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chun mi a tir a, indona chungchâng thu tieng po po chu David chu a hril a;

en: and he charged the messenger, saying, When thou hast made an end of telling all the things concerning the war unto the king,
hmr: chun, a mi tir kuoma chun, “Lal kuoma indona chanchin po po i hril zo hnungin,

en: it shall be that, if the king’s wrath arise, and he say unto thee, Wherefore went ye so nigh unto the city to fight? knew ye not that they would shoot from the wall?
hmr: a lung a sen thuta, ‘Iengdinga thaw dinga khaw bul ela in fe am a na? Kula inthawkin kâp el an ti cheu ti in hriet naw am a nih?

en: who smote Abimelech the son of Jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast an upper millstone upon him from the wall, so that he died at Thebez? why went ye so nigh the wall? then shalt thou say, Thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
hmr: Jerubbeseth naupa Abimelek kha tuin am a that a? Bu râwtnawina lung chunghnung lem nuhmeiin kula inthawkin a chungah a zuk thlâk a, Thebez-a khan a thi a ni naw am a nih? Iengdinga chuong kul bul ela fe am in ni a?’ a ti chun, ‘I siehlaw Uria Hit mi khawm kha a thi annaw,’ ti rawh aw,” tiin a hril a.

en: So the messenger went, and came and showed David all that Joab had sent him for.
hmr: Chuongchun, a mi tir chu a feh a, a va tlung a, Joabin a tirna san po po chu David chu a hril tah a.

en: And the messenger said unto David, The men prevailed against us, and came out unto us into the field, and we were upon them even unto the entrance of the gate.
hmr: Chun, a mi tir chun David kuoma chun, “Mihai chun an mi hung nawr a, phûlah an mi hung thawh a; keini chun an khaw lûtna kawtkhâr tlung rakin kan nawr ve thung a.

en: And the shooters shot at thy servants from off the wall; and some of the king’s servants are dead, and thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
hmr: Chun, kâptuhai chun kula inthawk chun i siehlawhai chu an kâp a, chuongchun, lal siehlaw ṭhenkhat- hai chu an thih a; chun, i siehlaw Hit mi Uria khawm kha a thi annaw,” a ta.

en: Then David said unto the messenger, Thus shalt thou say unto Joab, Let not this thing displease thee, for the sword devoureth one as well as another; make thy battle more strong against the city, and overthrow it: and encourage thou him.
hmr: David chun a mi tir kuoma chun, “Joab kuoma chun hieng ang hin va hril rawh, ‘Hieng hin i lungril chu suklâwm naw chuong naw raw se, kâwlhnâm chun tu tu khawm a thlierbîk si nawh a, nasa nâwkzuolin khuo chu thaw unla, sukse ro,’ tiin infui rawh,” a ta.

en: And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she made lamentation for her husband.
hmr: Chun, Uria nuhmei chun a pasal Uria a thi ti a hriet chun a pasal chu a sûn a.

en: And when the mourning was past, David sent and took her home to his house, and she became his wife, and bare him a son. But the thing that David had done displeased Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, a sûn hunbi a bo hnung chun David chun ama in tieng ân ṭhuoitir a, a nuhmeiah a nei tah a, naupasal a neipêk a. Nisienlakhawm, David thilthaw chun LALPA a suklungni nawh a.

en: And Jehovah sent Nathan unto David. And he came unto him, and said unto him, There were two men in one city; the one rich, and the other poor.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun David kuoma chun Nathan a tir a. A kuoma chun a feh a, “Khaw pakhata hin mi pahni an um a, pakhat chu mi hausa a na, pakhat chu mi pasie a nih.

en: The rich man had exceeding many flocks and herds;
hmr: Mi hausa chun berâm ruol tamtak le ran ruol tamtak a nei a;

en: but the poor man had nothing, save one little ewe lamb, which he had bought and nourished up: and it grew up together with him, and with his children; it did eat of his own morsel, and drank of his own cup, and lay in his bosom, and was unto him as a daughter.
hmr: mi pasie ruok khan chu berâmte alâ chiterek pakhat ân châwk, a ivai pakhat bak naw chu iengkhawm a nei nawh a, a kuoma a nauhai le khawsa an na, a thlêng awtpui le a no in- ṭâwmpui, a ângsûnga um, a naunu- hmei ang chiea a ngai a nih.

en: And there came a traveller unto the rich man, and he spared to take of his own flock and of his own herd, to dress for the wayfaring man that was come unto him, but took the poor man’s lamb, and dressed it for the man that was come to him.
hmr: Chun, mi hausa kuoma chun inzin pakhat hi a va tlung a; chun, a kuoma mikhuol hung tlung chu ama berâm le ran chu that phal loin, mi pasie berâm chu a lâkpêk a, a kuoma hung inzinpa chu a thatpêk a,” a ta.

en: And David’s anger was greatly kindled against the man; and he said to Nathan, As Jehovah liveth, the man that hath done this is worthy to die:
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu chu mi chunga chun a lunginsen ta hle el a; Nathan kuoma chun, “LALPA hring- na sâlin ka hril hi, chu thil thawtu chu sukhlum el tlâk a ni chu,

en: and he shall restore the lamb fourfold, because he did this thing, and because he had no pity.
hmr: chun, hieng ang thil a thaw lei le lunginsietna a nei naw leiin a berâmte chu a lêt liin a thung ding nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And Nathan said to David, Thou art the man. Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, I anointed thee king over Israel, and I delivered thee out of the hand of Saul;
hmr: Chuongchun, Nathan chun David kuomah, “Chu mi chu nang hi i nih, LALPA, Israelhai Pathien chun hieng ang hin a tih, Israelhai lal ni dingin hriek ka nâl cheh a, Saula kuta inthawkin ka sansuok cheh a;

en: and I gave thee thy master’s house, and thy master’s wives into thy bosom, and gave thee the house of Israel and of Judah; and if that had been too little, I would have added unto thee such and such things.
hmr: chun, i pu in ro chu kân hluotir cheh a, i pu nuhmeihai chu i ângsûng- ah ka sieh a, Israel le Juda sûngkuohai ka pêk bawk cheh a, chun, chuong chu tlâwm taluo a ni chun, thil dang khawm ka pêk belsa ding che annâwm.

en: Wherefore hast thou despised the word of Jehovah, to do that which is evil in his sight? thou hast smitten Uriah the Hittite with the sword, and hast taken his wife to be thy wife, and hast slain him with the sword of the children of Ammon.
hmr: Iengtiziea LALPA thu chu ngainêpa, a mithmua thil ṭha naw i thaw el am a ni leh? Hit mi Uria chu kâwlhnâmin i sukhlum a, a nuhmei chu i nuhmei dingin i neipêk a, Ammon thlahai kâwlhnâmin i that a.

en: Now therefore the sword shall never depart from thy house, because thou hast despised me, and hast taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be thy wife.
hmr: Chuleiin, tu hin kâwlhnâm chun i insûng chu inkiensan naw tawp a tih, nang chun mi ngainêpin Hit mi Uria nuhmei chu i nuhmei dingin i lâkpêk ta sih a.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will raise up evil against thee out of thine own house; and I will take thy wives before thine eyes, and give them unto thy neighbor, and he shall lie with thy wives in the sight of this sun.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng ang hin a ti a nih, ‘Ngai ta, nangma sûngkuo laia inthawk ngeiin i chungah thil ṭha naw insuoktir ka ta, i mithmu ngeiah i nuhmeihai chu lâkpêk ka ti cheh a, i vênghai pêng ka ta, sûn khawvarah i nuhmeihai chu zâlpui an tih.

en: For thou didst it secretly: but I will do this thing before all Israel, and before the sun.
hmr: Nang chun chu inrûkin i thawh a, kei ruok chun chu Israel mihai po po mithmuah sûn khawvarah ka thaw ding a nih,’ a tih,” a ta.

en: And David said unto Nathan, I have sinned against Jehovah. And Nathan said unto David, Jehovah also hath put away thy sin; thou shalt not die.
hmr: Chun, David chun Nathan kuomah, “LALPA chungah thil ka lo suksuol tah a nih,” a ta. Chun, Nathan chun David kuomah, “LALPA khawma i suol chu a sie hmang ve tah a; thi naw ti nih.

en: Howbeit, because by this deed thou hast given great occasion to the enemies of Jehovah to blaspheme, the child also that is born unto thee shall surely die.
hmr: Amiruokchu, hi i thilthaw hin Pathien hrilsietna remchângtak LALPA hmêlmahai ta dinga i siem leiin naupang nangmaa inthawka pieng chu thi ngei a tih,” a ta.

en: And Nathan departed unto his house. And Jehovah struck the child that Uriah’s wife bare unto David, and it was very sick.
hmr: Chuongchun, Nathan chun a in tieng a fe san tah a. Chun, Uria nuhmei David a neipêk naupang chunga chun LALPA chun a kut a thlâk a, a na ta hle el a.

en: David therefore besought God for the child; and David fasted, and went in, and lay all night upon the earth.
hmr: David chun naupang ta ding chun Pathien kuomah a ngên rak a; chun, David chun bu dâm a nghei a, a lût a, zân khawvârin hnuoiah a zâl tah a.

en: And the elders of his house arose, and stood beside him, to raise him up from the earth: but he would not, neither did he eat bread with them.
hmr: Chun, a sûnghai laia upahai chu an tho a, hnuoia inthawka keitho ding chun a kâwlah an ngîr a; nisien- lakhawm, a tho nuom nawh a, an kuoma khawm bu khawm a fâk bawk nawh.

en: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that the child died. And the servants of David feared to tell him that the child was dead; for they said, Behold, while the child was yet alive, we spake unto him, and he hearkened not unto our voice: how will he then vex himself, if we tell him that the child is dead!
hmr: Chun, hieng hi a hung na, ni sari ni chun naupang chu a thi tah a. Chun, David siehlawhai chun naupang chu a thi tah ti hril chu an ṭih a, “Ngai ta u, naupang a dam lai khan a kuomah thu ei hril a, ei râwl a ngai si nawh a, naupang chu a thi tah ti iengtin am hril ngam tâng ei ti leh, ieng amanih inlaw el rawi a tih,” an ta.

en: But when David saw that his servants were whispering together, David perceived that the child was dead; and David said unto his servants, Is the child dead? And they said, He is dead.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, David chun chuonga siehlawhai chu an inbiekrûk a hmu chun David chun naupang chu a thi a nih ti a hriet tah a; chun, David chun a siehlawhai kuomah, “Nau- pang chu a thi tah a ni maw?” a ta. Chun, anni chun, “A thi tah,” an ta.

en: Then David arose from the earth, and washed, and anointed himself, and changed his apparel; and he came into the house of Jehovah, and worshipped: then he came to his own house; and when he required, they set bread before him, and he did eat.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu hnuoia inthawk chu a tho a, ân sâwp a, sahriek ân nâl a, a puonhai ân thleng a; chun, LALPA inah a feh a; Pathien chibai a bûk a; chun, a in tieng chun a fe nâwk a; chun, bu a hei lam a, a hmaa chun an hung sieh a, a fâk tah a.

en: Then said his servants unto him, What thing is this that thou hast done? thou didst fast and weep for the child, while it was alive; but when the child was dead, thou didst rise and eat bread.
hmr: Chun, a siehlawhai chun a kuomah, “I thil thawzie hi iengtizie am a ni a? Naupang chu a dam lai khan bu dâm i nghei a, i ṭap a; nisien- lakhawm, naupang chu a thi tah a, i tho a, bu dâm i fâk ta lem a,” an ta.

en: And he said, While the child was yet alive, I fasted and wept: for I said, Who knoweth whether Jehovah will not be gracious to me, that the child may live?
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Naupang kha a la dam lai khan bu dâm ka ngheiin ka ṭap luoh a, ‘Naupang chu a dam theina dingin LALPA chun a mi lung- insiet rawi mawh, tuin am hrieng ei ta?’ ka ti a na.

en: But now he is dead, wherefore should I fast? can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he will not return to me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tuhin chu a thi ta sih a, iengdingin am bu nghei tâng ka ta? Ka ko kîr nâwk thei ding am a nih? A kuomah keima hi la fêng ka ta, nisienlakhawm, ama chu ka kuomah hung kîr nâwk ta naw ni,” a ta.

en: And David comforted Bath-sheba his wife, and went in unto her, and lay with her: and she bare a son, and he called his name Solomon. And Jehovah loved him;
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun a nuhmei Bathseba chu a thlamuon a, a kuomah a lût a, a zâlpui a, chun, naupasal a nei a, a hminga chun Solomon a sak a. Chun, ama chu LALPAIN a hmangai a;

en: and he sent by the hand of Nathan the prophet; and he called his name Jedidiah, for Jehovah’s sake.
hmr: chun, zâwlnei Nathan chu thu ân chawitir a; chun, ama chun LALPA hming chawiin a hminga chun Jedi- dia a sak a.

en: Now Joab fought against Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and took the royal city.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun Ammon thla- hai khawpui Rabba a rûn a, khawpui chu a lâk a.

en: And Joab sent messengers to David, and said, I have fought against Rabbah; yea, I have taken the city of waters.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun David kuomah mi a tir a, “Rabba chu ka rûn a; anih, tuihai khawpui chu ka lâk tah an- naw.

en: Now therefore gather the rest of the people together, and encamp against the city, and take it; lest I take the city, and it be called after my name.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi la umhai po po chu ko khâwm la, khawpui chu do tumin ep la, la rawh, keiin khawpui chu ka lâk chun chu ka hming put el rawi a tih,” a ta.

en: And David gathered all the people together, and went to Rabbah, and fought against it, and took it.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun mi po pohai chu a ko khâwm a, Rabbaa chun an feh a, an va rûn a, an lâk tah a.

en: And he took the crown of their king from off his head; and the weight thereof was a talent of gold, and in it were precious stones; and it was set on David’s head. And he brought forth the spoil of the city, exceeding much.
hmr: Chun, an lal lallukhum khum lai chu a lâkpêk a, a rikzie chu rângkachak talent bûk a na, lung- hluhai khawm a ṭhang a; chun, David chu an inkhumtir a. Chun, khawpuia inthawk chun râllâk sum tamtak a lâk a.

en: And he brought forth the people that were therein, and put them under saws, and under harrows of iron, and under axes of iron, and made them pass through the brickkiln: and thus did he unto all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned unto Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu a kei suok a, thingâtnahai dâm, hnuoi inletna thîrzumhai dâm, thîr hreipuihai dâm hmangin sin an inthawtir a; hnuoi rawchang dâm an insiemtir a. Ammon thlahai khawpuihai po po chu chuong ang chun a thawh a. Chun, David le mi po po chu Jerusa- lema chun an fe nâwk tah a.

en: And it came to pass after this, that Absalom the son of David had a fair sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.
hmr: Chun, David naupa Absalom chun farnu hmêl ṭhatak a nei a, a hming chu Tamar a nih. Chun, David naupa Amnon chun ama chu a hmangai a.

en: And Amnon was so vexed that he fell sick because of his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin; and it seemed hard to Amnon to do anything unto her.
hmr: Chuongchun, Amnon chu a farnu Tamar lei chun a buoi ta hle el a, a damnaw tah a; ama hlak chu nu- nghâk inthieng a ni sih a; a chunga thil ieng amani hang thaw chu Amnon ta ding chun khirtak a nih.

en: But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David’s brother: and Jonadab was a very subtle man.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Amnon chun ruol a nei a, a hming chu Jonadab a na, David unaupa Simea naupa a nih; Jonadab chu mi var vervêktak a nih.

en: And he said unto him, Why, O son of the king, art thou thus lean from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? And Amnon said unto him, I love Tamar, my brother Absalom’s sister.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “Aw, nang lal naupa hi a ni têla iengtiziea chêr tel tel am i nih a? I mi hril nuom naw ding am a nih?” a ta. Chun, Amnonin a kuomah, “Ka unaupa Absalom farnu Tamar hi ka hmangai tlat el a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jonadab said unto him, Lay thee down on thy bed, and feign thyself sick: and when thy father cometh to see thee, say unto him, Let my sister Tamar come, I pray thee, and give me bread to eat, and dress the food in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it from her hand.
hmr: Chun, Jonadab chun a kuomah, “I khumah zâl zing la, damnaw tehlêm thaw la, chun, i pain a hung en pha che a kuomah, ‘Ka hni che a nih, ka farnu Tamar kha ka kuomah hung sienla, bei fâk ding mi hung pe sienla; chun, ka hmu theiah, ka mit- hmu ngeiah fâk ding mi buotsaipêk raw se; a kuta inthawk ngeiin lo fâng ka tih,’ lo ti raw khai,” a ta.

en: So Amnon lay down, and feigned himself sick: and when the king was come to see him, Amnon said unto the king, Let my sister Tamar come, I pray thee, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat from her hand.
hmr: Chuongchun, Amnon chu a zâl a, a damnaw tehlêm tah a; chun, lalin a va en chun Amnon chun lal kuomah, “Ka hni che a nih, ka farnu Tamar kha hung sienla, ka mithmu ngeia hin beiphêk pahni mi siempêk sienla, ama kuta inthawk ngei chun lo fâng ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon’s house, and dress him food.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Tamar kuoma chun, “I ṭapa Amnon in tieng fe la, fâk ding va siempêk raw khai,” tiin a inah mi a tir a.

en: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon’s house; and he was laid down. And she took dough, and kneaded it, and made cakes in his sight, and did bake the cakes.
hmr: Chuongchun, Tamar chu a ṭapa Amnon in tieng chun a feh a; ama chu a lo zâl zing a. Chun, beihlawm chu a lâk a, a hmet a, a mithmuah beiphêk chu a siem a, beiphêkhai chu a em tah a.

en: And she took the pan, and poured them out before him; but he refused to eat. And Amnon said, Have out all men from me. And they went out every man from him.
hmr: Chun, a emna chu a lâk a, a hmaa chun a bun a; nisienlakhawm, a fâk nuom nawh a. Chun, Amnon chun, “Mi po pohai hin mi suoksan vawng raw hai se,” a ta. Chuongchun, ama chu an suoksan ta vawng a.

en: And Amnon said unto Tamar, Bring the food into the chamber, that I may eat from thy hand. And Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.
hmr: Chun, Amnon chun Tamar kuoma chun, “I kuta inthawk ngeia ka fâk theina dingin fâk ding chu pindana hin hung la ta raw le,” a ta. Chun, Tamar chun a beiphêk siemhai chu a lâk a, a ṭapa Amnon kuomah pindana chun a lâk lût a.

en: And when she had brought them near unto him to eat, he took hold of her, and said unto her, Come, lie with me, my sister.
hmr: Infâktir dinga a kâwl hnaia a va fe chun a lo man a, a kuomah, “Ka farnu, hung ta zâl ei tih,” a ta.

en: And she answered him, Nay, my brother, do not force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: do not thou this folly.
hmr: Ama chun a dawn a, “Ni lo ve, ka ṭapa, mi thawlui naw rawh, Israelhai lai hin hieng ang thil hi thaw ding a ni nawh ie, hi thil suol invêtthlâktak hi thaw naw raw khai.

en: And I, whither shall I carry my shame? and as for thee, thou wilt be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.
hmr: Chun, keiin ka muolphona chu khâwlai am fepui ka ta? Chun, nang khawm Israelhai lai hin mi invêta ngai i ni el ding i sawnnaw. Chuleiin, lal be lem raw khai, i mi nei chu sêl chuong naw nih,” a ta.

en: Howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice; but being stronger than she, he forced her, and lay with her.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a râwl chu a ngai nawh a, ama nêkin a hrât lem sih a, a thawlui a, a zâlpui tah a.

en: Then Amnon hated her with exceeding great hatred; for the hatred wherewith he hated her was greater than the love wherewith he had loved her. And Amnon said unto her, Arise, be gone.
hmr: Chuongchun, Amnon chun theida namênin a theida nâwk ta si nawh a, a theidana chu ama a hma- ngai laia a hmangaina nêka nasa lemin a nih a theida chu. Chuong- chun, Amnon chun a kuomah, “Tho la, fe hmang dai rawh,” a ta.

en: And she said unto him, Not so, because this great wrong in putting me forth is worse than the other that thou didst unto me. But he would not hearken unto her.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Chuong ang ding chu a ni nawh, hienga indiknawtaka i mi tirhmang hi ka chunga i thil thaw ta nêk hman khan a ṭha naw lem a nih,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, ama chun a ngai chuong nawh a.

en: Then he called his servant that ministered unto him, and said, Put now this woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.
hmr: Chuongchun, a rawngbâwltu a siehlaw chu a ko a, “Hi nuhmei hi ka kuoma inthawkin insuoktir la, kawt kal tlat rawh,” a tih a.

en: And she had a garment of divers colors upon her; for with such robes were the king’s daughters that were virgins apparelled. Then his servant brought her out, and bolted the door after her.
hmr: Zakawfuol ze tum tuma ṭiel a hâk a, chuong ang zakawfuol chu lal nunghâk inthienghai chun an hâk hlak a. Chuongchun, a siehlaw chun a ṭhuoi suok a, kawt a kal ta tlat a.

en: And Tamar put ashes on her head, and rent her garment of divers colors that was on her; and she laid her hand on her head, and went her way, crying aloud as she went.
hmr: Chun, Tamar chun a lua chun vut a phul a, zakawfuol ze tum tuma ṭiel a hâk chu a keithlêr a, a lusîpah a kut a sui a, inringtaka ṭap malam peiin a fe tah a.

en: And Absalom her brother said unto her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee? but now hold thy peace, my sister: he is thy brother; take not this thing to heart. So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom’s house.
hmr: Chun, a ṭapa Absalom chun a kuomah, “I ṭapa Amnon chu i kuomah a hung lût a ni maw? nisienlakhawm, to el rawh, ka farnu, ama chu i ṭapa a ni annâwm, engto nuom naw rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, Tamar chu a ṭapa Absalom ina chun ngûitakin ân khum ta tlat el a.

en: But when king David heard of all these things, he was very wroth.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal Davidin chuong thil po po a hung hriet chun a lunginsen hle el tah a.

en: And Absalom spake unto Amnon neither good nor bad; for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun Amnon kuoma chun a sie a ṭha, iengkhawm a hril nuom nawh a; Absalom chun a farnu Tamar chu a lo thawlui lei chun Amnon chu a theida hle a nih.

en: And it came to pass after two full years, that Absalom had sheep-shearers in Baal-hazor, which is beside Ephraim: and Absalom invited all the king’s sons.
hmr: Chun, kum hni pumhlûm a bo hnung chun Ephraim kâwla Baal- hazora chun Absalom chun berâm hmul ân vâwtir a; Absalom chun lal naupahai po po chu a fiel a.

en: And Absalom came to the king, and said, Behold now, thy servant hath sheep-shearers; let the king, I pray thee, and his servants go with thy servant.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chu lal kuoma chun a feh a, “Ngai ta, i siehlaw chun berâm hmul ân vâwtir a, lal le a siehlawhai chu a siehlaw kuoma hin fe ve hai sienla,” a ta.

en: And the king said to Absalom, Nay, my son, let us not all go, lest we be burdensome unto thee. And he pressed him: howbeit he would not go, but blessed him.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Absalom kuomah, “Ni lo e, ka naupa, kan rêng chun fe naw ning ung, sukkhaw taluo rawi kan ti che,” a ta. Ama chun a fiel a fiel a, amiruokchu, a fe nuom chuong nawh a, mal ruok chu a sâwm a.

en: Then said Absalom, If not, I pray thee, let my brother Amnon go with us. And the king said unto him, Why should he go with thee?
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom chun, “Annawleh, ka hni che hi, ka unaupa Amnon bêk kan kuomah hung raw se,” a ta. Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Iengdingin am fe bîk a ta?” a ta.

en: But Absalom pressed him, and he let Amnon and all the king’s sons go with him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Absalom chun Amnon le lal naupahai chu an rênga a kuoma fe ve dingin a ngênpêk ṭâl a.

en: And Absalom commanded his servants, saying, Mark ye now, when Amnon’s heart is merry with wine; and when I say unto you, Smite Amnon, then kill him; fear not; have not I commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun a sie- hlawhai chu, “Ngai ta, Amnon chu uoin dâwna a hlim laiin in kuomah, ‘Amnon kha that ro,’ ka ti cheu chun that unla, ṭi naw ro, thu ka pêk ta cheu annâwm; insukhuoi unla, insukpasal ṭha unla,” tiin thu a pêk a.

en: And the servants of Absalom did unto Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king’s sons arose, and every man gat him up upon his mule, and fled.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom siehlaw- hai chun Amnon chunga Absalom thupêk ang chun an thawh a. Chuongchun, lal naupahai po po chu an tho a, an sabengtung lien chi chungah an chuong seng a, an tlân hmang tah a.

en: And it came to pass, while they were in the way, that the tidings came to David, saying, Absalom hath slain all the king’s sons, and there is not one of them left.
hmr: Chun, lampui kâra an la um laiin, “Absalomin lal naupahai po po a that ta vawng el a, pakhat khawm hla a nei nawh,” tiin David kuoma chun chanchin a hung tlung a.

en: Then the king arose, and rent his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu a tho a, a silfênhai a keithlêr a, hnuoiah a zâl tah a; chun, a siehlawhai po po chu an silfênhai keithlêrin a kâwla chun an ngîr a.

en: And Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David’s brother, answered and said, Let not my lord suppose that they have killed all the young men the king’s sons; for Amnon only is dead: for by the appointment of Absalom this hath been determined from the day that he forced his sister Tamar.
hmr: Chun, David unaupa Simea naupa Jonadab chun a dawn a, “Ka pu hin lal naupasal tlangvâlhai po po chu an that vawng ti ring naw raw se, Amnon chau a thi a nih; a farnu Tamar a thawlui chena khan Absalom chun hieng anga thaw hi a tum hrim a nih.

en: Now therefore let not my lord the king take the thing to his heart, to think that all the king’s sons are dead; for Amnon only is dead.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka pu lal chun lal naupahai po po an thi amanih ti ringin, lung inhângpui naw raw se, Amnon chau a thi a nih,” a ta.

en: But Absalom fled. And the young man that kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came much people by the way of the hill-side behind him.
hmr: Absalom ruok chu a tlânhmang tah a. Chun, a râl vêngtu tlangvâl chun a mit a hang inlên a, a hang en a; chun, ngai ta, a hnungtienga tlâng panga lampuia chun mi tamtak an hung a.

en: And Jonadab said unto the king, Behold, the king’s sons are come: as thy servant said, so it is.
hmr: Chun, Jonadab chun lal kuom- ah, “Ngai ta, lal naupahai chu an hung ie, i siehlawin a hril ang chie kha a ni ngei el,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of speaking, that, behold, the king’s sons came, and lifted up their voice, and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept very sore.
hmr: Chun, a hril zo phingle chun, ngai ta, lal naupahai chu an hung tlung a, an râwl insuo meuin an ṭap a; chun, lal khawm chu a siehlawhai le chun an ṭap ta rak rak el a.

en: But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai the son of Ammihur, king of Geshur. And David mourned for his son every day.
hmr: Absalom ruok chu a tlânhmang a; Gesur lal Ammihur naupa Talmai kuomah a feh a. Chun, David chun ni tin hin a naupa chu a sûn hlak.

en: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom chu a tlânhmang a, Gesur rama chun a feh a, chutaka chun kum thum a va um a.

en: And the soul of king David longed to go forth unto Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead.
hmr: Lal David chun Absalom kuoma fe chu ân hâwk êm êm a. Amnon chungchâng thua chun a thlamuong tah a, ama chu a thi ta sih a.

en: Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king’s heart was toward Absalom.
hmr: Zeruia naupa Joab chun lal lungril chu Absalom chungah ân nghat ti a hriet a.

en: And Joab sent to Tekoa, and fetched thence a wise woman, and said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on mourning apparel, I pray thee, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a woman that hath a long time mourned for the dead:
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chun Tekoa khuoah mi a tir a, chutaka nuhmei var pakhat chu a vân ṭhuoitir a, a kuomah, “Lusûn angin insiem la, lusûnna puon sil la, sahriek khawm innâl loin, nuhmei sâwttak mithi sûn ta angin um rawh;

en: and go in to the king, and speak on this manner unto him. So Joab put the words in her mouth.
hmr: chun, lal kuomah fe la, a kuomah hieng ang hin thu va hril rawh aw,” a ta. Chuongchun, Joab chun thu chu a hril tah a.

en: And when the woman of Tekoa spake to the king, she fell on her face to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, Help, O king.
hmr: Chun, Tekoa khuoa nuhmei chun lal kuoma thu hril ding chun hmaia hnuoi sikin chibai a bûk a, a bawkkhup a, “Aw lalpa, mi ṭhangpui rawh,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, Of a truth I am a widow, and my husband is dead.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Ieng am a ni leh?” a ta. Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Hmeithai ka nih a, ka pasal chu a thi tah a.

en: And thy handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and there was none to part them, but the one smote the other, and killed him.
hmr: Chun, i suoknu hin naupasal pahni ka nei a, an pahni chun loah an insuol a, tukhawm a ṭheltu ding an um si nawh a, a pakhat chun pakhat dang chu a vuok a, a sukhlum tah a.

en: And, behold, the whole family is risen against thy handmaid, and they say, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him for the life of his brother whom he slew, and so destroy the heir also. Thus will they quench my coal which is left, and will leave to my husband neither name nor remainder upon the face of the earth.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, an sûngkuo po po chun i suoknu hi an do hrawn a, ‘A unaupa thattu chu, a unaupa a that leia kan that ve theina dingin mi pe raw khai, chuongchun, rohluotu ding khawm sukbohmang nghâl kan tih,’ an ta; chuongchun, ka meiling la um sun chu sukhlum an ta, ka pasal chu hnuoi chunga hming le thla hrim hrim nei loin a um el ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto the woman, Go to thy house, and I will give charge concerning thee.
hmr: Chun, lal chun nuhmei kuoma chun, “I inah fe ta la, i chungchâng thua chun thu pe el ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And the woman of Tekoa said unto the king, My lord, O king, the iniquity be on me, and on my father’s house; and the king and his throne be guiltless.
hmr: Chun, Tekoa khuoa nuhmei chun lal kuoma chun, “Aw lalpa, ka pu, bawsietna maw chu keia chunga le ka pa sûnghai chungah tla el raw se; chun, lal le lalṭhungpha chun maw chu phur naw raw se,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Whosoever saith aught unto thee, bring him to me, and he shall not touch thee any more.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Tukhawm i chunga ieng amanih hril taphawt chu ka kuomah hung ṭhuoi la, tâwk nâwk ta naw tawp an ti che,” a ta.

en: Then said she, I pray thee, let the king remember Jehovah thy God, that the avenger of blood destroy not any more, lest they destroy my son. And he said, As Jehovah liveth, there shall not one hair of thy son fall to the earth.
hmr: Ama chun, “Thisen insuotuhai chunga phuba latuhaiin sukbohmang ta lo dingin lal chun LALPA i Pathien chu hre zing raw se aw; chuong naw chun chu ka naupa hi sukbohmang rawi an tih,” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “LALPA hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, i naupa samzai pakhat khawm hnuoia hin tla naw nih,” a ta.

en: Then the woman said, Let thy handmaid, I pray thee, speak a word unto my lord the king. And he said, Say on.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei chun, “Ka hni che hi, i suoknu hin lalpa ka pu kuoma hin thu bau khat chau hang hril nâwk raw se,” a ta.

en: And the woman said, Wherefore then hast thou devised such a thing against the people of God? for in speaking this word the king is as one that is guilty, in that the king doth not fetch home again his banished one.
hmr: Ama chun, “Hril ta la,” a ta. Chun, nuhmei chun, “Annawleh, ieng leia Pathien mihai dodâla hienga thaw i tum am a nih a? Hieng thua inthawk hin lal chu thiemnaw chang angin ân lang a nih, lal chun a mi tlân hmang chu a ṭhuoikîr nâwk si naw lei hin.

en: For we must needs die, and are as water spilt on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again; neither doth God take away life, but deviseth means, that he that is banished be not an outcast from him.
hmr: Ei thi ngei ngei ding a na; chun, tuisik hnuoia inbaw tahnung rût nâwk thei ta lo ang hi ei na. Pathienin hringna hi a lâk hmang a ni nawh a, a tlân hmang chu amaa inthawka mi hran a ni nawna dingin rem a ruot a ni lem a nih.

en: Now therefore seeing that I am come to speak this word unto my lord the king, it is because the people have made me afraid: and thy handmaid said, I will now speak unto the king; it may be that the king will perform the request of his servant.
hmr: Chuongchun, lalpa, ka pu kuoma hi thu hril dinga ka hung khawm hi mi ka ṭi lei a na, chun, i suoknu chun lal kuoma hin hril phawt ka ta, lal chun a suoknu hnina chu ân hlawtlingtir rawi mawh.

en: For the king will hear, to deliver his servant out of the hand of the man that would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.
hmr: Lal chun kei le ka naupa hi Pathien ro hluo lo dinga mi sukbo- hmang tumtu kuta inthawkin i suok- nu hi sansuok dingin lo ngaisak i tih ka tih a.

en: Then thy handmaid said, Let, I pray thee, the word of my lord the king be comfortable; for as an angel of God, so is my lord the king to discern good and bad: and Jehovah thy God be with thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, i suoknu ta ding hin, lalpa, ka pu thu chu lung- muongumtak ni sienla, ka hni che a nih, a sie a ṭha lo thlier dingin lalpa ka pu chu Pathien vântirko ang el a ni sih a; chun, LALPA Pathien chu i kuomah um raw se, ka ti a nih,” a ta.

en: Then the king answered and said unto the woman, Hide not from me, I pray thee, aught that I shall ask thee. And the woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a dawn a, nu- hmei kuoma chun, “Ka îndawn taphawt che chu ka kuomah ieng- khawm ip naw rawh aw,” a ta. Chun, nuhmei chun, “Lalpa ka pu chun hril raw se chu,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Is the hand of Joab with thee in all this? And the woman answered and said, As thy soul liveth, my lord the king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from aught that my lord the king hath spoken; for thy servant Joab, he bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of thy handmaid;
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Hieng thua hrim hin Joab hin ṭhangna a nei am?” a ta. Chun, nuhmei chun a dawn a, “Lalpa ka pu, i thlarau hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, lalpa ka pu hin a hril taphawt chu tukhawma vawitienga manih, changtienga manih an fe khêl thei âwm nawh a, i siehlaw Joab chun a mi tir a, hieng thuhai po po hi i suoknu hi a hril vawng a nih;

en: to change the face of the matter hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.
hmr: thil umdân sukdanglam dingin i siehlaw Joab chun hieng thil hi a thaw a nih; chun, ka pu chu khawvêla thil um po pohai hre theiin Pathien vântirko ang elin a var a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go therefore, bring the young man Absalom back.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Joab kuomah, “Ngai ta, tuhin hi thil hi ka thaw ve tah a, chuleiin, tuhin fe la, tlangvâl Absalom chu va ṭhuoi nâwk raw le,” a ta.

en: And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and did obeisance, and blessed the king; and Joab said, To-day thy servant knoweth that I have found favor in thy sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath performed the request of his servant.
hmr: Chun, Joab chu hmaia hnuoi sikin a bawkkhup a, chibai a bûk a, lal chun mal a sâwm a; chun, Joab chun, “Aw lalpa, ka pu chun a siehlaw hnina chu ân hlawtlingtir leiin vawisûn hin i siehlaw hin i mit ka tlung a nih ti ka lo hriet tah a,” a ta.

en: So Joab arose and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chu a tho a, Gesura chun a feh a, Absalom chu Jerusalema chun a hung ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And the king said, Let him turn to his own house, but let him not see my face. So Absalom turned to his own house, and saw not the king’s face.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Ama in tieng fe sienla, ka hmêl chu hung hmu naw raw se,” a ta. Chuongchun, Absalom chu ama in tieng chun a feh a, lal hmêl chu a hmu ta nawh a.

en: Now in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Absalom for his beauty: from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him.
hmr: Tuhin Israelhai po po lai Absalom ang hrima hmêl ṭhata inpâk kai tukhawm an um nawh a, a ke lêra inthawka a lusîp chenin sawisêlna hrim hrim a um nawh a.

en: And when he cut the hair of his head (now it was at every year’s end that he cut it; because it was heavy on him, therefore he cut it); he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, after the king’s weight.
hmr: A lu a vâw chun (kum khat peiah a vâw hlak a, a sam chu a rik êm leiin a vâw hlak a nih) a sam chu a bûk hlak a, lal bûk dâna shekel za hni a tling hlak a nih.

en: And unto Absalom there were born three sons, and one daughter, whose name was Tamar: she was a woman of a fair countenance.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun naupasal pathum le naunuhmei pakhat a nei a, a hming chu Tamar a na, hmêl ṭhatak a nih.

en: And Absalom dwelt two full years in Jerusalem; and he saw not the king’s face.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom chu kum hni pumhlûm Jerusalemah a um a, nisienlakhawm, lal hmêl hrim hrim chu a hmu nawh a.

en: Then Absalom sent for Joab, to send him to the king; but he would not come to him: and he sent again a second time, but he would not come.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom chun lal kuoma tir dingin Joab chu ân chah a; nisienlakhawm, a fe nuom nawh a; chun, ân châ nawn nâwk a, nisien- lakhawm, a fe nuom chuong nawh a.

en: Therefore he said unto his servants, See, Joab’s field is near mine, and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire. And Absalom’s servants set the field on fire.
hmr: Chuongchun, a siehlawhai kuomah, “I aw, Joab lo chu ka lo kâwl a na, buṭei a nei a, va rawpêk vawng ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, Absalom sie- hlawhai chun lo chu an va raw tah a.

en: Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom unto his house, and said unto him, Wherefore have thy servants set my field on fire?
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chu a tho a, Absalom kuomah a ina chun a feh a, a kuomah, “Iengdinga i siehlawhaiin ka lo an raw am?” a ta.

en: And Absalom answered Joab, Behold, I sent unto thee, saying, Come hither, that I may send thee to the king, to say, Wherefore am I come from Geshur? it were better for me to be there still. Now therefore let me see the king’s face; and if there be iniquity in me, let him kill me.
hmr: Absalom chun Joab chu a dawn a, “Ngai ta, ‘Iengdinga Gesura in- thawka hung am ka nih a? Chutaka chun um zing lang ka ta dingin a ṭha lem ding bah,’ tia lal kuoma tir dingin kân cha cheh a, chuleiin, lal hmêl chu mîn hmutir raw khai, chun, bawsiet- na nei ka lo ni chun mi sukhlum el raw se,” a ta.

en: So Joab came to the king, and told him; and when he had called for Absalom, he came to the king, and bowed himself on his face to the ground before the king: and the king kissed Absalom.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chu lal kuoma chun a feh a, a hril a; chun, Absalom chu a ko a, lal kuomah a feh a; chun, lal hmaa chun hmaia hnuoi sikin a bawkkhup a; chun, lalin Absalom chu a fâwp tah a.

en: And it came to pass after this, that Absalom prepared him a chariot and horses, and fifty men to run before him.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun Absalom chun tawlailîr le sakawrhai le mi sâwmnga a hmaa tlân dingin a buotsai a.

en: And Absalom rose up early, and stood beside the way of the gate: and it was so, that, when any man had a suit which should come to the king for judgment, then Absalom called unto him, and said, Of what city art thou? And he said, Thy servant is of one of the tribes of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chu zîngkâr hin a tho a, kul kawtkhâr lampuia chun a lo ngîr hlak a; chun, lal kuoma thupawi hung hril ding taphawt chu Absalom chun a lo ko hlak a, “Khâwlai khuo am in nih a?” a lo ti pei hlak a. Chun, “I siehlaw hi Israel hnam laia hnam pakhat ka nih,” an ti pei hlak a.

en: And Absalom said unto him, See, thy matters are good and right; but there is no man deputed of the king to hear thee.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun, “I aw, i thu chu a ṭhain ân dik a, nisienlakhawm, ngaituotu dingin lalin tukhawm a ruot nawh,” a lo ti hlak a.

en: Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man who hath any suit or cause might come unto me, and I would do him justice!
hmr: Chun, Absalom ma chun, “Mi tin thupawi hril ding nei amanih, hni ding nei amani taphawt chu ka kuoma an hung theina dingin; kei hi hi ram rorêltua hin mi siem sien ka va ti deh aw! chuongchun, feltakin ka rêlpêk hlak ding bah,” dâm a lo ti bawk hlak a.

en: And it was so, that, when any man came nigh to do him obeisance, he put forth his hand, and took hold of him, and kissed him.
hmr: Hieng ang khawm hin a thawh a, tukhawm ama chibai bûk dinga hang hnai taphawthai chu a lo ban a, a chel a, a lo fâwp hlak a.

en: And on this manner did Absalom to all Israel that came to the king for judgment: so Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mi lal kuoma thuhril dinga hung taphawthai chu Absalom chun chuong ang chun a lo thaw pei hlak a. Chuongchun, Absalom chun Israel mihai lungril chu a hlîppêk a.

en: And it came to pass at the end of forty years, that Absalom said unto the king, I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto Jehovah, in Hebron.
hmr: Chun, kum li a hung invawi hnung chun, Absalom chun lal kuoma chun, “Ka hni che a nih, Hebron khuoah LALPA kuoma ka thutiem hlen dingin mîn fetir raw khai.

en: For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Syria, saying, If Jehovah shall indeed bring me again to Jerusalem, then I will serve Jehovah.
hmr: I siehlaw hin Suria rama Gesura ka um lai khan, ‘LALPAIN Jerusa- lema a mi ṭhuoi nâwk phawt chun LALPA rawng bâwl ka tih,’ tiin thu ka lo tiem tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to Hebron.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Lung- muongtakin fe raw khai,” a ta. Chuongchun, a tho a, Hebrona chun a fe tah a.

en: But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, As soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet, then ye shall say, Absalom is king in Hebron.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Absalom chun, “Tawtawrâwt ri in hriet phingleh, ‘Absalom chu Hebronah lal a nih,’ ti ro,” tiin Israel hnam po pohai lai mi a tir rûk ta hlau a.

en: And with Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, that were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they knew not anything.
hmr: Chun, Absalom kuoma chun, a mi fielhai, mi za hni Jerusalema inthawkin an fe veh a, lungril ṭhatak putin an feh a, iengkhawm an hriet ve nawh.

en: And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David’s counsellor, from his city, even from Giloh, while he was offering the sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun inthâwi- nahai chu ân hlân laiin, Gilon mi Ahithophel, David rorêlpui chu, a khuo Gilo a inthawkin ân chah a, an thu phierrûuk chu a nasa hle el a. Absalom tieng chun mipui chu an pung tul tul el sih a.

en: And there came a messenger to David, saying, The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom.
hmr: Chun, David kuoma chun, “Israel mihai lungril chu Absalom tieng a thle hle el,” tiin mitir a hung a.

en: And David said unto all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem, Arise, and let us flee; for else none of us shall escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he overtake us quickly, and bring down evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.
hmr: Chun, David chun Jerusalema a mihai po po kuoma chun, “Tho unla, tlân suok ei tiu, tukhawm Absaloma inthawk hin ei suok thei âwm si nawh a, suok vak ro khai, chuong naw chun mi hung hnawt phâk vak el a tih; ei chunga hin thil ṭha nawtak hung intlun a ta, kâwlhnâmin khuo hi hung thaw rawi a tih,” a ta.

en: And the king’s servants said unto the king, Behold, thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my lord the king shall choose.
hmr: Chun, lal mihai chun lal kuomah, “Ngai ta, i siehlawhai hi lal kan lalin a ruot ang peia thaw dingin kan inzo zing a nih,” an ta.

en: And the king went forth, and all his household after him. And the king left ten women, that were concubines, to keep the house.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a suok a, a sûnghai po po chun an zui a. Chun, lal chun in nghâk dingin nuhmei sâwm thaikêm ruol chu a sieh a.

en: And the king went forth, and all the people after him; and they tarried in Beth-merhak.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a suok a, mipui po pohai chun an zui a, chun, in tâwpna taka chun an châwl hrih a.

en: And all his servants passed on beside him; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men that came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.
hmr: Chun, a mi po pohai chun an fe khêl a, chun, Kerith mi po pohai, Peleth mi po pohai le Git mi za ruk Gath-a inthawka ama hung zuituhai chun lal chu an pêl pei a.

en: Then said the king to Ittai the Gittite, Wherefore goest thou also with us? return, and abide with the king: for thou art a foreigner, and also an exile; return to thine own place.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun Git mi Ittai kuoma chun, “Iengtiziea nang hi i hung ve am? Kîr nâwk la, lal kuomah um rawh, nang chu mikhuol ram danga mi i ni bawk sih a, nangma hmun tieng kîr nâwk raw khai.

en: Whereas thou camest but yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us, seeing I go whither I may? return thou, and take back thy brethren; mercy and truth be with thee.
hmr: Zâni ela hung i na, vawisûn hin a suk a tunga mi zui dingin ka ti ve ding che am a nih? Ka fe theina naah ka fe ding a na, nang chu kîr nâwk la, i unauhai po po hi ṭhuoi kîr rawh, lunginsietna le thutak i kuomah um raw se,” a ta.

en: And Ittai answered the king, and said, As Jehovah liveth, and as my lord the king liveth, surely in what place my lord the king shall be, whether for death or for life, even there also will thy servant be.
hmr: Chun, Ittai chun lal chu a dawn a, “LALPA hringna le lal, ka pu hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, lal ka pu hi i umna taphawta chun thi le thi nîng a ta, dam le dam ning a ta, i siehlaw hi um ve pei a tih,” a ta.

en: And David said to Ittai, Go and pass over. And Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all his men, and all the little ones that were with him.
hmr: Chun, David chun, Ittai kuoma chun, “Fe unla, fe pei ro le,” a ta. Chuongchun, Git mi Itai chu a mihai po po le an nauhai po po le chun an feh a.

en: And all the country wept with a loud voice, and all the people passed over: the king also himself passed over the brook Kidron, and all the people passed over, toward the way of the wilderness.
hmr: Chun, inringtakin a ram phêkin an ṭap tah a, mipui chu an fe vawng a; thlalêr lampui tieng chu panin lal khawm chun Kidron vadung chu a kân a; chun, mipui po po chun an kân bawk a.

en: And, lo, Zadok also came, and all the Levites with him, bearing the ark of the covenant of God; and they set down the ark of God; and Abiathar went up, until all the people had done passing out of the city.
hmr: Chun, Zadok hai, Pathien thu- thlungna bâwm zâwnin Levi mihai po po leh a kuomah an fe veh a; Pathien bâwm chu an innghat a, mipuiin khuo chu an suoksan kim vawng chenin Abiathar chu a hang feh a.

en: And the king said unto Zadok, Carry back the ark of God into the city: if I shall find favor in the eyes of Jehovah, he will bring me again, and show me both it, and his habitation:
hmr: Chun, lal chun Zadok kuomah, “Pathien bâwm kha khawpui sûngah zâwn kîr nâwk ro, LALPA mittlunga ka um chun mi ṭhuoi kîr nâwk a ta; Pathien bâwm le a umna chu mîn hmutir nâwk a ta;

en: but if he say thus, I have no delight in thee; behold, here am I, let him do to me as seemeth good unto him.
hmr: amiruokchu, ‘Nangmaah lâwm- na hrim ka nei nawh,’ a ti chun, ngai ta, hieng el hi ka na, ṭha a ti ang angin ka chunga hin thaw el raw se,” a ta.

en: The king said also unto Zadok the priest, Art thou not a seer? return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you, Ahimaaz thy son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.
hmr: Lal chun thiempu Zadok kuoma chun, “Hmu theitu i ni naw am a nih? I naupasalhai pahni i naupa Ahimaaz le Abiathar naupa Jonathan leh lungmuongtakin khawpuiah fe nâwk ro.

en: See, I will tarry at the fords of the wilderness, until there come word from you to certify me.
hmr: Ngai ta, kei chu chanchin in mi hung inhriettir hmakhat chu thlalêra vadung kaiahai hin lo um ka tih,” a ta.

en: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem: and they abode there.
hmr: Chuongchun, Zadok le Abiathar chun Pathien bâwm chu Jerusalema chun an fepui nâwk a; chun, chutaka chun an um tah a.

en: And David went up by the ascent of the mount of Olives, and wept as he went up; and he had his head covered, and went barefoot: and all the people that were with him covered every man his head, and they went up, weeping as they went up.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu Oliv tlâng hang fenaa chun a hang feh a, fe malam chun a ṭap malam pei a, a lu a khum a, ke ruokin a feh a; chun, a kuoma mi po pohai chun an lu an khum seng a, ṭap pum peiin an hang feh a.

en: And one told David, saying, Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom. And David said, O Jehovah, I pray thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.
hmr: Chun, tuin amanih David chu, “Ahithophel chu Absalom tienga ṭhangin thu phiertuhai lai a ṭhang ve,” tiin a hril a. Chun, David chun, “Aw LALPA, Ahithophel remruot chu invêtnaa inchangtir dingin ka ngên che,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, that, when David was come to the top of the ascent, where God was worshipped, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent, and earth upon his head.
hmr: Chun, David chu Pathien biekna tlâng sîp a hang lâwn kai chun, ngai ta, Ark mi Husai chu a zakaw keithlêr hâka, a lua pilvut kâi luomin ama tuok dingin a hung a.

en: And David said unto him, If thou passest on with me, then thou wilt be a burden unto me:
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuomah, “Ka kuoma i fe ve chun keia ta dinga phurrik i ni el ding a na.

en: but if thou return to the city, and say unto Absalom, I will be thy servant, O king; as I have been thy father’s servant in time past, so will I now be thy servant; then wilt thou defeat for me the counsel of Ahithophel.
hmr: Amiruokchu, khawpui tieng chun i kîr a, Absalom kuomah, ‘Aw lalpa, i siehlawah um ka tih, kha hma tienga i pa siehlawa ka um ang khan tuhin i siehlawah um thung tâng ka tih,’ i va ti chun Ahithophel remruot mi hluopêktu ni lem i tih.

en: And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, that what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the king’s house, thou shalt tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.
hmr: Chutaka chun thiempu Zadok le Abiathar khawm an um ve a ni naw am a nih? Chuongchun, hieng hi hung nîng a ta, lal ina thu suok i hriet taphawt chu thiempu Zadok le Abiathar hril hlak i ta.

en: Behold, they have there with them their two sons, Ahimaaz, Zadok’s son, and Jonathan, Abiathar’s son; and by them ye shall send unto me everything that ye shall hear.
hmr: Ngai ta, an naupasalhai pahni Zadok naupa Ahimaaz le Abiathar naupa Jonathan khawm an kuomah an um kha; chun, i thil hriet taphawt chu mi hril dingin anni chu i hung tir hlak ding annâwm,” a ta.

en: So Hushai, David’s friend, came into the city; and Absalom came into Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuongchun, David ruolpa Husai chu khawpuia chun a lût a; chun, Absalom chu Jerusalema chun a lût tah a.

en: And when David was a little past the top of the ascent, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and a hundred clusters of raisins, and a hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.
hmr: David chun tlâng sîp lâwn suokna a khêl dep chun, ngai ta, Mephiboseth siehlaw Ziba chun a lo tuok a, sabengtung pahni a hmang a, bei tlang zahni le grêp emṭâwl bâwr za le nipui thei za le uoin peng khat ân phurtir a.

en: And the king said unto Ziba, What meanest thou by these? And Ziba said, The asses are for the king’s household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Ziba kuoma chun, “Hieng hi iengtizie am a nih a?” a ta. Ziba chun, “Sabengtunghai hi lal sûnghai chuongna ding nîng a ta, bei le nipui theihai hi tlangvâlhai fâk ding nîng a ta; uoin hi chu thlalêra châu taphawthai dâwn ding nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And the king said, And where is thy master’s son? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he abideth at Jerusalem; for he said, To-day will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.
hmr: Chun, lal chun “Anleh, i pu naupa chu khâwlai am?” a ta. Ziba chun lal kuomah, “Ngai ta, Jerusa- lemah a um, ‘Vawisûn hin Israel- hai chun ka pa ram an mi pêk nâwk ding a nih,’ a ti nghe nghe annâw,” a ta.

en: Then said the king to Ziba, Behold, thine is all that pertaineth unto Mephibosheth. And Ziba said, I do obeisance; let me find favor in thy sight, my lord, O king.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Ziba kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, Mephiboseth thil nei po po chu i ta vawng a ni tah,” a ta. Chun, Ziba chun, “Chibai ka bûk takzet che a nih, aw lalpa ka pu, i mit tlunga um pei tum ka tih,” a ta.

en: And when king David came to Bahurim, behold, there came out thence a man of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the son of Gera; he came out, and cursed still as he came.
hmr: Chun, lal Davidin Bahurim a tlung chun, ngai ta, Saula sûnghai laia mi Gera naupa a hming Simei a hung suok a, ṭawngsie inphur pum peiin a hung suok a.

en: And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David: and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.
hmr: David chu lungin a dêng a, lal David siehlawhai po po khawm chu; chun, mipui po po le sipai huoisenhai po po chu a changtieng le a vawitieng an um a.

en: And thus said Shimei when he cursed, Begone, begone, thou man of blood, and base fellow:
hmr: Chun, Simei chun ṭawngsie ân phur sûng chun hieng hin a hril a, “Fe hmang dai rawh, fe hmang dai rawh, nang thisen insuo hmang le Belial mihriempa,

en: Jehovah hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and Jehovah hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son; and, behold, thou art taken in thine own mischief, because thou art a man of blood.
hmr: a rorêl âi i rêl tah Saula sûnghai thisen chu LALPAIN i chungah a hung inlettir tah a; chun, LALPAIN ram chu i naupa Absalom chu a pêk tah a; chun, ngai ta, thisen insuo- hmang i ni leiin nangma pawi chu nang bawkin i tâwk a nih,” a ta.

en: Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the king, Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off his head.
hmr: Chuongchun, Zeruia naupa Abisai chun lal kuomah, “Iengdinga hi ui thitlaw hin ka lalpa lal chu ṭawngsie ân phur mei mei am a nih a? a lu va tan el ka tih aw?” a ta.

en: And the king said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? Because he curseth, and because Jehovah hath said unto him, Curse David; who then shall say, Wherefore hast thou done so?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal chun, “Nangni Zeruia naupasalhai, nangni mi lo hrietpêk ding ieng am a um a? LALPAIN a kuomah, ‘David chu ṭawngsie inphur rawh,’ a ti si chun inphur el raw se, ‘Iengdinga chuong anga i thaw am a ni leh?’ tuin am ti hlak an ta?” a ta.

en: And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants, Behold, my son, who came forth from my bowels, seeketh my life: how much more may this Benjamite now do it? let him alone, and let him curse; for Jehovah hath bidden him.
hmr: Chun, David chun Abisai le a siehlawhai po po kuoma chun, “Ngai ta u, ka naupa ka rîla ra ngei chun mi that a tum a na, hi Benjamin mi hin a va tum nasa nâwk zuol âwm de! Ieng- khawm law naw unla, ṭawngsie chu inphur el raw se; LALPA inthawtir a ni sih a.

en: It may be that Jehovah will look on the wrong done unto me, and that Jehovah will requite me good for his cursing of me this day.
hmr: LALPA chun ka rimsikzie hi hung hmûng a ta. LALPA chun vawi- sûna hienga ṭawngsie a mîn phur hi a ṭha tiengin a mi hung thung el khawm a ni thei a nih,” a ta.

en: So David and his men went by the way; and Shimei went along on the hill-side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le a mihai chu lampuia chun an fe pei tah a; chun, Simei chu an râla tlâng panga chun a fe ve pei a, a fe malam chun ṭawngsie chu ân phur pei a, lunghai dâmin a dêng a, pilvut dâmin a theh a.

en: And the king, and all the people that were with him, came weary; and he refreshed himself there.
hmr: Chun, lal le a kuoma mi um po pohai chun Aiphim an tlung a, chu- taka chun an châwldam tah a.

en: And Absalom, and all the people, the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.
hmr: Chun, Absalom le mipui po po, Israel mihai chu Jerusalemah an feh a, chun, a kuomah Ahithophel khawm a ṭhang a.

en: And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David’s friend, was come unto Absalom, that Hushai said unto Absalom, Long live the king, Long live the king.
hmr: Ark mi Husai, David ruolpa chun Absalom kuom a tlung chun, Husai chun Absalom kuomah, “Pa- thienin laltak humhim raw se, Pathienin laltak humhim raw se,” a ta.

en: And Absalom said to Hushai, Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun Husai kuomah, “Hieng ang hi a ni maw i ruol i lunginsiet dân chu? Iengdinga i ruolpa kuoma i fe naw am?” a ta.

en: And Hushai said unto Absalom, Nay; but whom Jehovah, and this people, and all the men of Israel have chosen, his will I be, and with him will I abide.
hmr: Chun, Husai chun Absalom kuomah, “Fe naw ning ah, LALPA le hieng mipui le Israelhaiin an ithlang thu thuin um ka ta, a kuomah um lem ka tih.

en: And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in thy father’s presence, so will I be in thy presence.
hmr: Chun, tu rawng am ka bâwl ding a na? Naupa hmaah rawng ka bâwl ding a ni naw am a nih? I pa hmaa rawng ka bâwl ang khan i hmaah bâwl ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then said Absalom to Ahithophel, Give your counsel what we shall do.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom chun Ahithophel kuoma chun, “Iengtin am ka thaw ding a na, i ngaidân hril ta?” a ta.

en: And Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Go in unto thy father’s concubines, that he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel will hear that thou art abhorred of thy father: then will the hands of all that are with thee be strong.
hmr: Chun, Ahithophel chun Absa- lom kuomah, “I pa thaikêm in nghâk- a siea umhai kuoma chun va lût rawh; chun, Israel mi po poin i pain a thîm che ti hrieng an ta, chuong- chun, nanga tienga ṭhang po po- hai kut chu a hung hrât ding a nih,” a ta.

en: So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in unto his father’s concubines in the sight of all Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom ta ding chun in chungah puon in an zar a; chuongchun, Israel mi po pohai mithmuah a pa thâikêmhai kuoma chun a lût a.

en: And the counsel of Ahithophel, which he gave in those days, was as if a man inquired at the oracle of God: so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.
hmr: Chuong laia rem a ruot, Ahithophel remruothai chu, Pathien thu ngai anga ngai a ni hlak a, chuong ang bawk chun, Ahithophelin David le Absalom rem a ruotpuihai po po chu ngai a ni hlak.

en: Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Let me now choose out twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David this night:
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu Absalom kuomah Ahithophel chun, “Tuhin mi sîng khat le sâng hni thlang suok ka ta, chun, vawizân hin David chu hnawt dingin inthawk ka tih;
