en: and I will come upon him while he is weary and weak-handed, and will make him afraid; and all the people that are with him shall flee; and I will smite the king only;
hmr: a châu lai le a hrâtnaw laitak va nangchîng ka ta, va sukṭîng ka tih, chuongchun, a kuoma mi um po pohai chu tlân hmang an ta; chuongchun, lal chau chu va that el ka tih;

en: and I will bring back all the people unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.
hmr: chun, mipuihai chu i kuomah hung ṭhuoi kîr vawng ka ta, i mi zawng chu mi po po hung kîr tluk a nih; chuongchun, mi po po inremin um tâng an tih,” a ta.

en: And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu thu chun Absalom le Israel upahai po po chu a suklâwm ta hleh a.

en: Then said Absalom, Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun, “Tu hin Ark mi Husai chu ko ve phawt unla, a hril ve dân lo ngai phawt ei tih,” a ta.

en: And when Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spake unto him, saying, Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner: shall we do after his saying? if not, speak thou.
hmr: chun, Husaiin Absalom kuom a hung tlung chun, Absalom chun, “Ahithophel chun hieng ang hin a hril a, a hril ang hin kan thaw ding am a nih? Thaw naw ding ni ta ang inla, nangin hang hril ve ta khai,” a ta.

en: And Hushai said unto Absalom, The counsel that Ahithophel hath given this time is not good.
hmr: Chun, Husai chun Absalom kuomah, “Tuta ṭuma Ahithophel remruot hi a ṭha naw a nih,” a ta.

en: Hushai said moreover, Thou knowest thy father and his men, that they are mighty men, and they are chafed in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field; and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.
hmr: Chun, Husai chun, “I pa le a mihai chu i hriet a, sipai huoitak, mi kâwlhrâwngtak, phûla savawm a tê manpêk ang el an na; chun, i pa hi indo mi a na, mipui lai chun riek khawm riek kher naw ni.

en: Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some other place: and it will come to pass, when some of them are fallen at the first, that whosoever heareth it will say, There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom.
hmr: Ngai ta, tu khawm hin khaw lai khursûnga manih, khawlai hmuna manih ân bi zing a ni ding a na; chun, an inthaw tîra mi ṭhenkhat an tlu nuol chun a hre taphawtin, ‘Absalom zuituhai chu an that ṭeu el ie,’ ti el an ta.

en: And even he that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, will utterly melt; for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man, and they that are with him are valiant men.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi huoisentak, sakeibaknei lungril ang put mi meu khawm lo ṭîng a ta, Israel mi po po hlak chun i pa chu sipai huoitak a ni le a kuoma mi umhai chu mi huoisen- tak tak an ni ti an hriet vawng sih a.

en: But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together unto thee, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou go to battle in thine own person.
hmr: Keia remruot ve dân chu, Israel mi po po chu Dana inthawkin Beer- seba tlung rakin an tamzie tuisuo- rieta phaiphin zât zetin i kuomah ko khâwm la; chun, indonaa khawm chun nang meu khawm fe ve la.

en: So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground; and of him and of all the men that are with him we will not leave so much as one.
hmr: Chuongchun, khâwlai hmuna khawm ei tuok fûkna taphawtah hnuoia dâidâw tla ang elin bâwng ei ta, chun, ama le a kuoma mi umhai po po chu pakhat khawm hla nâwng ei tih.

en: Moreover, if he be gotten into a city, then shall all Israel bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there be not one small stone found there.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm khuoa a lût chun, Israel mi po po, hruihruol chawiin chu khuoa chun va fêng ei ta, lung chiterek khawm um lo khawp rauin vadungah hnûkthla vawng ei tih,” a ti nghâl bawk a.

en: And Absalom and all the men of Israel said, The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel. For Jehovah had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that Jehovah might bring evil upon Absalom.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom le Israel mi po pohai chun, “Ark mi Husai remruot chu Ahithophel remruot nêk chun a ṭha lem,” an ti tah a. LALPA chun Absalom chunga chun thil ṭha naw ân tlungtir theina dingin LALPA chun Ahithophel remruot ṭhatak chu letthla dingin a lo ruot ta hrim a nih.

en: Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counselled.
hmr: Chuongchun, Husai chun thiempu Zadok le Abiathar kuomah, “Chuong ang khâng ang chun Ahithophel chun Absalom le Israel upahai chu rem a ruotpêk a; chun, keiin chuong ang khâng ang chun rem ka ruot bawk a.

en: Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying, Lodge not this night at the fords of the wilderness, but by all means pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people that are with him.
hmr: Chuleiin, ‘Vawizân chu thlalêra vadung kaiahai riek ta loin kân ngei ngei rawh, chuong naw chun lal le a kuoma um po pohai chu sukbohmang vawng rawi an tih,’ tiin David chu inhriltir vak ro khai,” a ta.

en: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz were staying by En-rogel; and a maid-servant used to go and tell them; and they went and told king David: for they might not be seen to come into the city.
hmr: Jonathan le Ahimaaz chu En-rogelah an um a, suoknu pa- khat hin anni chu a va hril hlak a na, chun, anni chun lal David chu an va hril nâwk sâwng hlak a; khawpuia an lût chu tukhawma hmu lo ding a nih.

en: But a lad saw them, and told Absalom: and they went both of them away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim, who had a well in his court; and they went down thither.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, naupangin a lo hmuh a, Absalom chu a hril a; chuongchun, an pahni chun an tlân hmang ta vat a, Bahurima mi pakhat, a tuola tuisunsuo nei mi pakhat kâwlah an va feh a, tuisunsuoa chun an lût tah a.

en: And the woman took and spread the covering over the well’s mouth, and strewed bruised grain thereon; and nothing was known.
hmr: Chun, nuhmeiin tuisunsuo sîn- nain a sîn a, a chunga chun bu a em a, tu hriet thei khawm a ni nawh.

en: And Absalom’s servants came to the woman to the house; and they said, Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan? And the woman said unto them, They are gone over the brook of water. And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Absalom siehlawhai chu chu ina nuhmei kuoma chun an va feh a, “Ahimaaz le Jonathan kha khaw lai am?” an ta. Chun, nuhmei chun an kuomah, “Vadung kai tâng an tih,” a lo tih a. Chun, an va zawng a, an hmu nawh a, Jerusalemah an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told king David; and they said unto David, Arise ye, and pass quickly over the water; for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you.
hmr: Chun, an fe liem hnung chun tuisunsuoa inthawk chun an hung suok a, lal David chu an va hril a, David kuoma chun, “Suok unla, vadung chu kai vak ro, hieng ang hin Ahithophel chun a phier cheu a nih,” an ta.

en: Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they passed over the Jordan: by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over the Jordan.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le a kuoma mi um po pohai chu an suok a, Jordan vadung an kai a, khuo a hung var chun pakhat khawm Jordan vadung kai lo an um nawh.

en: And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and gat him home, unto his city, and set his house in order, and hanged himself; and he died, and was buried in the sepulchre of his father.
hmr: Chun, Ahithophel chun a rem- ruot ang chu an pawm nawh ti a hrietin a sabengtung chu a siem a, a suok a, a khuo tieng a fe tah a, a sûnghai khawsak dân ding a ruotpêk diem a, ân âwkhlum tah a; chuong- chun, a thih a, a pa thlânah an phûm tah a.

en: Then David came to Mahanaim. And Absalom passed over the Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.
hmr: Chun, David chun Mahanaim a va tlung a. Chun, Absalom chun a kuoma Israel mi po pohai leh Jordan vadung an kai a.

en: And Absalom set Amasa over the host instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man, whose name was Ithra the Israelite, that went in to Abigal the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah, Joab’s mother.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun, Joab aiah Amasa chu sipaihai hotuah a sieh a. Amasa chu mi pakhat a hming Ithra, Ismael mi, Joab nu Zeruia zuorpuinu Nahas naunu Abigail pâwltu naupa a nih.

en: And Israel and Absalom encamped in the land of Gilead.
hmr: Chun, Absalom le Israel mihai chun Gilead rama chun ṭhanghmun an va khuor a.

en: And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,
hmr: Chun, Davidin Mahanaim a tlung chun Ammon thla Rabba khuoa mi Nahas naupa Sobi hai, Lodebar khuoa mi Ammiel naupa Makir hai, Rogelim khuoa Gilead mi Barzillai hai chun,

en: brought beds, and basins, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and meal, and parched grain, and beans, and lentils, and parched pulse,
hmr: khumhai dâm, maihûnhai dâm, pil bêlhai dâm, bu dâm, buṭei dâm, beiphit dâm, bu zêu dâm, dailuo dâm, bê dâm,

en: and honey, and butter, and sheep, and cheese of the herd, for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat: for they said, The people are hungry, and weary, and thirsty, in the wilderness.
hmr: khuoizu dâm, bâwng nêne kîng dâm, berâm le bâwng nêne kîng thûm dâm, David le a kuoma mi umhai fâk dingin an hung chawi a, “Mipuihai chu thlalêra chun an phîngṭamin an chauin an dang châr êm êm tah a nih,” ti a ni sih a.

en: And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuoma mi umhai chu a tiem a, sipai sâng chunga hotu dâm, za chunga hotu dâm a siem a.

en: And David sent forth the people, a third part under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.
hmr: Chun, David chun mihai chu a tirsuok a, hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat chu Joab chun ân rawi a, hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat chu Joab unaupa Zeruia naupa, Abisaiin ân rawi a, hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat chu Git mi Ittai chun ân rawi a. Chun, lal chun mipuihai kuomah, “Keima ngei khawm in kuomah fe ve ngei ngei ka tih,” a ta.

en: But the people said, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but thou art worth ten thousand of us; therefore now it is better that thou be ready to succor us out of the city.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mipuihai chun, “Fe ve lo e, keini rawi hi chu tlân hmang ta ang ni inla khawm, pawi ti naw ni hai a; chun, a chenve lai rau khawm hi va thi inla khawm an ûksak bar âwm nawh a, nang chu keinirawi sîng tlukin i hlu sih a, chuleiin, khawpuia inthawka mi ṭhangpui dinga inzosa zinga i lo um chu a ṭha lem a nih,” an ta.

en: And the king said unto them, What seemeth you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate-side, and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands.
hmr: Chun, lal chun an kuomah, “Ṭha in ti ang pei chun thâwng ka tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, lal chu kul kawtkhâr bula chun a ngîr a; chun, mipui po po chu za têl têl le sâng têl têl chun an suok ta zut zut el a.

en: And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Joab le Abisai le Ittai chu, “Keima leiin tlangvâl Absalom chu indawitakin va thaw ro khai,” tiin thu a pêk a. Mipui po poin Absalom chungchâng thuah lalin sipai hotuhai po po thu a pêk lai chu an hriet a.

en: So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the forest of Ephraim.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipuihai chu Israel mihai chu do dingin indona hmun tieng chun an fe tah a; chun, an indona chu Ephraim rampui hnuoiah a nih.

en: And the people of Israel were smitten there before the servants of David, and there was a great slaughter there that day of twenty thousand men.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun David mihai hmaa chun Israel mihai chu an tlâwm tah a; chun, chutaka chun chu ni chun mi sîng hni zet an that a.

en: For the battle was there spread over the face of all the country; and the forest devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
hmr: An indona chun chuong lai ram po po chu a huop vawng el sih a, chu ni chun kâwlhnâm nêk hmanin rampui chun a lem tam lem a nih.

en: And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between heaven and earth; and the mule that was under him went on.
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun David mihai chu a vân tuokpui ta thut a. Chun, Absalom chu a sabengtung lien chi chungah a chuong a; chun, sa- bengtung chu thingsaisuo kau inbuktak hnuoiah a lût a, a lu chu thingsaisuoa chun ân tâng tah a, hnuoi tâwk lo, vân tâwk lo chun ân khai ta zing el a; chun, sabengtung hlak chu a fe pei tah a.

en: And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in an oak.
hmr: Chun, tuin amani hin a hmuh a, Joab a hril a, “Ngai ta, thingsaisuoah Absalom inkhai zingin ka hmu,” a ta.

en: And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest it, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten pieces of silver, and a girdle.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun a hriltu kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, chu chu i hmu sih a, iengdinga i sukhluma hnuoia i suk- thlâk nghâl naw? chuong chun thaw la chu tangka sâwm le kâwngkhi ka pêk ding che bah,” a ta.

en: And the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand pieces of silver in my hand, yet would I not put forth my hand against the king’s son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none touch the young man Absalom.
hmr: Chun, mi chun Joab kuomah, “Tangka sâng khawm hmu ding ni lang lal naupa chungah ka kut thlâk naw hrim hrim ka tih; kan na hriet ngeiah lalin nang le Abisai le Ittai kuomah, ‘Tlangvâl Absalom chu tukhawma tâwk naw raw se,’ tiin thu a pêk si cheu a.

en: Otherwise if I had dealt falsely against his life (and there is no matter hid from the king), then thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against me.
hmr: Ringumlotakin lo that ta ringawt inla, (lal kuoma chun ieng- khawm thup thei a ni âwm si nawh a) nang chu în sukfihlîm nâwk el âwm sih a,” a ta.

en: Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chun, “Hieng hin chu i kuomah ka um zing thei naw tawp el a,” a ta, fei pathum a chawi a, thingsaisuo laia Absalom dama lo la umzing lungkhura chun a sun a.

en: And ten young men that bare Joab’s armor compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.
hmr: Chun, Joab râlthuom chawitu tlangvâl sâwm chun an hung inhuol a, Absalom chu an sun a, an that tah a.

en: And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel; for Joab held back the people.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun tawtawrâwt a hei mût a, Israel hnawttu mipuihai chu an hung kîr tah a, Joab chun mipuihai chu a lo dang tlat el tah a.

en: And they took Absalom, and cast him into the great pit in the forest, and raised over him a very great heap of stones: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.
hmr: Chun, Absalom ruong chu an lâk a, rampui hnuoia khursûng in- thûktaka chun an peilût a, a chunga chun nasatakin lung an dêng khâwm a, chun, Israel mihai po po chu mâni puon in sengah an tlân tah a.

en: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself the pillar, which is in the king’s dale; for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name; and it is called Absalom’s monument, unto this day.
hmr: Absalom chun a dam laiin lal ruoma chun lung intieng a lo intieng diem tah a, “Ka hming a dei nawna dingin, naupasal khawm ka nei si nawh a,” a ta. Chu lung intieng hminga chun ama hming ân puttir a, tu chen hin Absalom hriet zingna ti a nih.

en: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that Jehovah hath avenged him of his enemies.
hmr: Chuongchun, Zadok naupa Ahimaaz chun, “Va tlân ka ta, LALPAIN a hmêlma phuba a lâkpêk dân chanchin hi lal chu va hril ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not be the bearer of tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day; but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king’s son is dead.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun a kuomah, “Vawisûn chu chanchin chu va hril naw rawh, ni dangah chanchin chu la hril lem rawh, lal naupa chu a thi ta leiin, vawisûn chu chanchin ieng- khawm va hril naw rawh,” a ta.

en: Then said Joab to the Cushite, Go, tell the king what thou hast seen. And the Cushite bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chun Kus mi kuoma chun, “Fe la, i thil hmu chu lal va hril raw le,” a ta. Chun, Kus mi chun kûnin Joab chu chibai a bûk a, a tlân tah a.

en: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But come what may, let me, I pray thee, also run after the Cushite. And Joab said, Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou wilt have no reward for the tidings?
hmr: Chuongchun, Zadok naupa Ahimaaz chun Joab kuomah, “Ieng- khawm ni sienla, Kus mi kha va hnawtzui ka tih,” a ti nâwk a. Chun, Joab chun, “Ka naupa, chanchin hril man chu i hmu âwm si nawh a, iengdingin am tlân i ta?” a ta.

en: But come what may, said he, I will run. And he said unto him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the Plain, and outran the Cushite.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun, “Iengkhawm ni sien tlân ka tih,” a ta. Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Tlân el raw le,” a ta. Chuongchun, Ahimaaz chu phaizâwl tieng lampuiah a tlân a, Kus mi chu a lekhêl a.

en: Now David was sitting between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof of the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, a man running alone.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu dai- kawtkhâr pahni inkâra chun a lo ṭhung a; chun râl vêngtu chu kul kawtkhâr tuolpuo lem chung tieng chun a hang lâwn a, a hang ngha vêl a, mi pakhat a khât baka hung tlân a hmu a.

en: And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.
hmr: Chun, râl vêngtu chu a khêk a, lal chu a hril a. Chun, lal chun “Mi pakhat bak a ni chun chanchin hung hril ding ni ngei a tih,” a ta.

en: And the watchman saw another man running; and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold, another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.
hmr: Chun, a hung vat vat a, a hung hnai ta deu deu a. Chun, râl vêngtu chun mi dang hung tlân a hmu nâwk a; chun, râl vêngtu chun kawtkhâr vêngtu chu a ko a, “En ta, mi dang ama khât bakin a hung tlân nâwk,” a ta. Chun, lal chun, “Ama khawm chun chanchin a hung intlun ve ding a ni chu,” a ta.

en: And the watchman said, I think the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.
hmr: Chun, râl vêngtu chun, “A hmasa lem tlân dân chu Zadok naupa Ahimaaz tlân dân ni âwm- takin ka hriet,” a ta. Chun, lal chun, “Ama chu mi ṭhatak a na, chanchin ṭhatak a hung intlun ding nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he bowed himself before the king with his face to the earth, and said, Blessed be Jehovah thy God, who hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.
hmr: Chun, Ahimaaz chun a ko a, lal kuomah, “A ṭha vawng ie,” a ta. Chun, a hmaia hnuoi sikin lal hmaa chun chibai bûkin a kûn a, “Lalpa, ka lalpa thaw tuma kut thlâk tumtuhai lo dangtu LALPA i Pathien chu inpâkin um raw se,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Is it well with the young man Absalom? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king’s servant, even me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Tlangvâl Absa- lom kha a la dam de maw?” a ta. Chun, Ahimaaz chun a dawn a, “Joabin lal siehlaw, kei i siehlaw ngei hi a mi tirsuok laiin an buoi mur mur ka hmuh a; nisienlakhawm, ieng ang char a ni chu ka hriet nawh,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Ka sîra hin la hung ngîr hri ta,” a ta. Chun, a sîra chun a hung ngîr a.

en: And, behold, the Cushite came; and the Cushite said, Tidings for my lord the king; for Jehovah hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Kus mi chu a hung tlung a; chun, Kus mi chun, “Lalpa, ka lalpa ta dingin chan- chin ka hung intlun a nih, i chunga helhai po po phuba chu LALPAIN vawisûn hin a lâkpêk ta che a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto the Cushite, Is it well with the young man Absalom? And the Cushite answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise up against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Kus mi kuoma chun, “Tlangvâl Absalom chu a la dam de maw?” a ta. Chun, Kus mi chun a dawn a, “Lalpa ka lalpa hmêlmahai le i sietna zawngtuhai po po chu chu tlangvâl ang chun um vawng raw hai se,” a ta.

en: And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu a lungin- zîng ta hle el a, kul kawtkhâr chunga pindana chun a hang feh a, a ṭap a; chun, a hang fe malam chun, “Aw, ka naupa Absalom, ka naupa, ka naupa Absalom, i aia chun kei hi hang thi lem lang aw, Aw Absalom, ka naupa, ka naupa!” a ta.

en: And it was told Joab, Behold, the king weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chu an hril a, “Ngai ta, lal chun Absalom chu a ṭah a, a sûn ie,” an ta.

en: And the victory that day was turned into mourning unto all the people; for the people heard say that day, The king grieveth for his son.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu nia an hnena chu mi po po ta dinga sûnna a lo ni ta lem a; “Lal chu a naupa lei chun a lungngai nasa khawp el a,” an ti chu mipui chun chu ni chun an lo hriet ta sih a.

en: And the people gat them by stealth that day into the city, as people that are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu indonaa mi an tlânsieh a, an inzak a, inrûka an fe hmang angin chu ni chun a rûkin khawpuia chun an lût a.

en: And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice, O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son!
hmr: Chun, lal chun a hmai a hup a, “Aw ka naupa Absalom, Aw Absalom, ka naupa, ka naupa,” tiin lal chu a ṭap a ṭap a.

en: And Joab came into the house to the king, and said, Thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants, who this day have saved thy life, and the lives of thy sons and of thy daughters, and the lives of thy wives, and the lives of thy concubines;
hmr: Chun, Joab chu inah lal kuoma chun a lût a, “I hringna dâm, i nau- pahai le i naunuhai hringna dâm, i nuhmeihai le i thaikêmhai sanhim- tuhai chu vawisûn hin inzaktakin i siem ta hi;

en: in that thou lovest them that hate thee, and hatest them that love thee. For thou hast declared this day, that princes and servants are nought unto thee: for this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased thee well.
hmr: nangma hmangaituhai che i theidah a, nangma theidatuhai che chu i hmangai tlata hin. Hotuhai le sipaihai chu i ta dinga iengkhawm ni lo angin vawisûn hin i suklang tah a; Absalom chu dam sienla, keini po po hi vawisûn hin thi ta vawng ni inlang, chu chu i lâwm zâwngtak ni âwmin vawisûn hin ka hriet a nih.

en: Now therefore arise, go forth, and speak comfortably unto thy servants; for I swear by Jehovah, if thou go not forth, there will not tarry a man with thee this night: and that will be worse unto thee than all the evil that hath befallen thee from thy youth until now.
hmr: Chuleiin tho la, suok el rawh, i mihai suklungawi zâwngtakin thu hril rawh, i suok naw chun LALPA sâlin ṭawng kân khâm a nih; mi pakhat khawm vawizân hin i kuoma um um naw ni hai; chun, chu chu i ta dingin i tleirâwla inthawka tu chena i chunga thil ṭha naw hung tlung po pohai nêk hmanin ṭha naw lem a tih,” a ta.

en: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate. And they told unto all the people, saying, Behold, the king is sitting in the gate: and all the people came before the king. Now Israel had fled every man to his tent.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu a tho a, kul kawtkhâra chun a ṭhung a; “Ngai ta u, lal chu kul kawtkhâra chun a ṭhung a,” tiin mipui po po chu an hril a; chun, mipui po po chu lal hmaa chun an va fe tah a.

en: And all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, The king delivered us out of the hand of our enemies, and he saved us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now he is fled out of the land from Absalom.
hmr: Israelhai ruok chu anni puon in sengah an fe tah a. “Lal chun ei hmêlmahai kuta inthawkin a mi sansuok a, Philistin mihai kuta inthawkin a mi sandam tah a; chun, tuhin hi rama inthawk hin Absalom chu a tlân hmangsan a.

en: And Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now therefore why speak ye not a word of bringing the king back?
hmr: Chun, Absalom ei lal dinga hriek ei nâl chu indonaah a thi tah sih a, iengdinga lal chu baukhat bêka a ko kîr zâi in rêl naw am a ni leh?” tiin Israel mi po pohai chu an insêl ta mur mur el a.

en: And king David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying, Speak unto the elders of Judah, saying, Why are ye the last to bring the king back to his house? seeing the speech of all Israel is come to the king, to bring him to his house.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal David chun thiempu Zadok le Abiathar kuoma chun, “Juda upahai kuoma chun, ‘Iengdinga lal chu a in tienga ṭhuoi kîr ding thuah a muongtaka ṭhang am in nih a? Israel mihaiin lal ṭhuoi kîr ding thu an hril chu lal kuom a tlung ta sih a.

en: Ye are my brethren, ye are my bone and my flesh: wherefore then are ye the last to bring back the king?
hmr: Ka unauhai in na, ka ru le ka tisa in ni sih a, iengdinga a muong- taka ṭhang am in ni leh aw?’ tiin hril ro.

en: And say ye to Amasa, Art thou not my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab.
hmr: Chun, Amasa kuomah, ‘Ka ru le ka tisa i ni naw am a nih? Joab aia ka hmaa sipaihai hotua ka siem nawtâk che leh Pathienin a law law mi law el raw se, chu nêka nasa khawmin,’ a tih a, va ti ro,” tiin mi a tir a.

en: And he bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as the heart of one man; so that they sent unto the king, saying, Return thou, and all thy servants.
hmr: Chuongchun, Judahai po po lungril chu mi pakhat lungril ang elin a sukthle ta duol a; chuongchun, lal kuomah, “I mihai po po le khan hung kîr nâwk ro,” ti dingin mi an tir tah a.

en: So the king returned, and came to the Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to bring the king over the Jordan.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu a kîr nâwk a, Jordan a va tlung a. Chun, Judahai chu lal lo tuok a, lal chu Jordan lo ṭhuoikai dingin Gilgala chun an feh a.

en: And Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, who was of Bahurim, hasted and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.
hmr: Chun, Bahurim khuoa mi Ben- jamin mi Gera naupa Simei chu in- hmawtakin lal David tuok ding chun Judahai ruolin a hung thla veh a.

en: And there were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went through the Jordan in the presence of the king.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma chun Benjamin mi sâng le, Saula sûnghai siehlaw, Ziba, a naupasalhai sâwm le panga le, a siehlaw sâwmhnihai leh an ṭhang ve a; chun, lal mithmua chun Jordan chu an kai a.

en: And there went over a ferry-boat to bring over the king’s household, and to do what he thought good. And Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, when he was come over the Jordan.
hmr: Chun, lal sûnghai ṭhuoikaina ding le ṭha a ti ang anga hmang dingin lawng an fepui a. Chun, Jordan vadung a hei kai chun Gera naupa Simei chu lal hmaa chun a bawkkhup a.

en: And he said unto the king, Let not my lord impute iniquity unto me, neither do thou remember that which thy servant did perversely the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.
hmr: Chun, lal kuoma chun, “Ka lalpa chun khawhlona neiah mi ruot naw hrâm sienla, lalpa ka puin Jerusalem a suoksan nia i siehlaw hin indik nawtaka a lo thaw tahai kha hre zing bawk naw la, lal chun lungrilah vawn zing naw raw se.

en: For thy servant doth know that I have sinned: therefore, behold, I am come this day the first of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.
hmr: I siehlaw hin thil ka lo suksuol ti kân hriet a; chuleiin, ngai ta, Josef sûng po pohai laia ka pu lal chu tuok dingin vawisûn hin a hung thla hmasa tak ka hung ni nghe nghe annaw,” a ta.

en: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said, Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed Jehovah’s anointed?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Zeruia naupa Abisai chun a dawn a, “LALPA hriek- nâl chu ṭawngsie ân phur leiin Simei hi sukhlum ding a ni naw ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: And David said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah, that ye should this day be adversaries unto me? shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel?
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Nangni Ze- ruia naupasalhai, nangni hin in mi lo hriet pêk ding ieng am a um a? Vawi- sûn hin a mi dotuhai in ni naw am a nih? Vawisûn hin Israel mihai laia mi hrim hrim sukhlum ding am a nih? Vawisûn hi Israel mihai chunga lal ka ni hi ka hriet naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And the king said unto Shimei, Thou shalt not die. And the king sware unto him.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Simei kuoma chun, “Thi naw tawp i tih,” a ta. Chun, lal chun a kuomah ṭawng ân khâm tah a.

en: And Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king; and he had neither dressed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came home in peace.
hmr: Chun, Saula naupa Mephi- boseth chu lal tuok dingin a hung thlah a; lal a fe suoka râlmuonga a hung kîr nâwk ni chen chun a kehai chu a chei nawh a, a khâkhmul chu a chep ruol bawk nawh a, a puonhai khawm chu a sâwp nawh a.

en: And it came to pass, when he was come to Jerusalem to meet the king, that the king said unto him, Wherefore wentest not thou with me, Mephibosheth?
hmr: Chun, lal tuok dinga Jerusa- lema a fe chun lal chun a kuomah, “Mephiboseth, iengdinga ka kuoma i fe ve naw am?” a ta.

en: And he answered, My lord, O king, my servant deceived me: for thy servant said, I will saddle me an ass, that I may ride thereon, and go with the king; because thy servant is lame.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Aw, lalpa ka pu, ka siehlawin a mi hlêm a nih; i siehlaw hin, ‘Lal kuoma ka fena dingin sabengtung chei ka tih,’ ka tih a, i siehlaw hi ka ke ân bâi sih a.

en: And he hath slandered thy servant unto my lord the king; but my lord the king is as an angel of God: do therefore what is good in thine eyes.
hmr: Chun, lalpa ka pu kuoma hin i siehlaw hi a hêk a, nisienlakhawm, lalpa ka pu chu Pathien vântirko ang a na, chuleiin ṭha i ti ang angin thaw el rawh.

en: For all my father’s house were but dead men before my lord the king; yet didst thou set thy servant among them that did eat at thine own table. What right therefore have I yet that I should cry any more unto the king?
hmr: Ka pa sûnghai po po chu lalpa ka pu hmaa chun sukhlum vawng âwm an na, nisienlakhawm, i siehlaw hi i buthlêng awtpuituhai lai ân ṭhangtir a. Chuleichun, lal kuoma hin thil dang phût ngam âwm khawm am ka ni ta?” a ta.

en: And the king said unto him, Why speakest thou any more of thy matters? I say, Thou and Ziba divide the land.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “I chungchâng thu hi iengdinga i hril nâwk hlak am? Nang le Ziba chun ram chu insem ro ka ti a nih,” a ta.

en: And Mephibosheth said unto the king, yea, let him take all, forasmuch as my lord the king is come in peace unto his own house.
hmr: Chun, Mephiboseth chun lal kuomah, “E, amân nei vawng el raw se, lalpa ka pu chu inah râlmuongin a hung tlung ta sih a,” a ta.

en: And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim; and he went over the Jordan with the king, to conduct him over the Jordan.
hmr: Chun, Gilead mi Barzillai chu Rogelim-a inthawkin a hung thlah a, lal chun Jordana ṭhuoikai dingin a kuomah Jordan a kai veh a.

en: Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even fourscore years old: and he had provided the king with sustenance while he lay at Mahanaim; for he was a very great man.
hmr: Barzillai chu upatak a na, kum sâwmriet mi zet a nih; Mahanaima lal um sûng khan fâk ding dâm a lo tumpêk a, mi neinungtak a nih.

en: And the king said unto Barzillai, Come thou over with me, and I will sustain thee with me in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Barzillai kuoma chun, “Ka kuoma fe ve la, ka kuomah Jerusalemah châwm ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And Barzillai said unto the king, How many are the days of the years of my life, that I should go up with the king unto Jerusalem?
hmr: Chun, Barzillai chun lal kuom- ah, “Ieng chen tak am la damin lal kuoma Jerusalema chun hang fe vêng ka ta?

en: I am this day fourscore years old: can I discern between good and bad? can thy servant taste what I eat or what I drink? can I hear any more the voice of singing men and singing women? wherefore then should thy servant be yet a burden unto my lord the king?
hmr: Tuhin kum sâwmriet mi ka na, a sie le ṭha khawm thlier thei am ka la nih? I siehlaw hin ka thil fâk le dâwn hi ân hnik naw khawm ka hriet hran thei ta am a nih? Nuhmei le pasal hla sak ri khawm ka hriet hran thei ta am a nih? Chuleiin, i siehlaw hi iengdingin am ka pu ta ding hin phurrik ni el ka ta?

en: Thy servant would but just go over the Jordan with the king: and why should the king recompense it me with such a reward?
hmr: I siehlaw hin lal kuoma Jordan râl kai ve chau hi ka tum a nih; iengdingin am lal chun chuong ang chun ṭhat man chu mi thung ve kher a ta?

en: Let thy servant, I pray thee, turn back again, that I may die in mine own city, by the grave of my father and my mother. But behold, thy servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good unto thee.
hmr: Lunginsiettakin i siehlaw hi mîn fetir nâwk el la, ka nu le pa thlân umna keini khuo ngeiah thi de ning. Amiruokchu, en ta, i siehlaw Kim- ham hi, lalpa ka pu kuomah fe ve sienla, a chungah ṭha i ti ang angin thaw rawh,” a ta.

en: And the king answered, Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to him that which shall seem good unto thee: and whatsoever thou shalt require of me, that will I do for thee.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a dawn a, “Kim- ham chu ka kuomah fe vêng a tih, ṭha i ti ang peiin a chungah thâwng ka tih; chun, thil iengkhawm i mi hni ta- phawt chu thawpêk pei ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And all the people went over the Jordan, and the king went over: and the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned unto his own place.
hmr: Chun, mipui po pohai chu Jordan râl an kai a; chun, lal khawm chu a kai veh a; chun, lal chun Barzil- lai chu a fâwp a, mal a sâwm a; chun, ama hmun tieng a fe nâwk tah a.

en: So the king went over to Gilgal, and Chimham went over with him: and all the people of Judah brought the king over, and also half the people of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu Gilgala chun a kai a. Kimham chu a kuoma chun a kai ve a; chun, Juda mi po pohai chun lal chu an ṭhuoi kai a; Israel mi khawm a zâtve an ṭhang.

en: And, behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said unto the king, Why have our brethren the men of Judah stolen thee away, and brought the king, and his household, over the Jordan, and all David’s men with him?
hmr: Chun, Israel mi po po chu lal kuomah an hung a, lal kuoma chun, “Iengdinga kan unau Juda mihai hin an chang bîk cheh a, lal le a sûnghai le David mihai po po khawm Jordan râla an ṭhuoi sa vawng el?” an ta.

en: And all the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, Because the king is near of kin to us: wherefore then are ye angry for this matter? have we eaten at all at the king’s cost? or hath he given us any gift?
hmr: Chun, Juda mi po pohai chun Israel mihai chu an dawn a, “Lal chu keini tieng hnai a ni lei a nih, iengdinga hi thua hin in lunginsen el am? Lal nei ringa um am kan nih? Thilpêk ieng amani khawm a mi nei am a nih?” an ta.

en: And the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more right in David than ye: why then did ye despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king? And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai chun Juda mihai chu an dawn a, “Lala hin chan sâwm kan nei a, Davida hin nangni nêkin chan kan nei lem a nih. Ieng- dinga in mi ngainêp el am a na? Lal ṭhuoikîr thu hi a rawt hmasatu kan ni naw am a nih?” an ta. Chuongchun, Juda mihai thu chu Israel mihai thu nêk chun ân rum ta lem a.

en: And it came to pass after this, that David inquired of Jehovah, saying, Shall I go up into any of the cities of Judah? And Jehovah said unto him, Go up. And David said, Whither shall I go up? And he said, Unto Hebron.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun David chun, “Juda ram khâwlai ama- niah ka hang fe ding?” tiin LALPA a rawn a. Chun, LALPA chun a kuomah, “Hang fe raw khai,” a ta. David chun, “Khâwlai am ka hang fe ding?” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Hebronah,” a ta.

en: So David went up thither, and his two wives also, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu chutaka chun a hang fe tah a, a nuhmeihai pahni Jezreel mi Ahinoam le Kar- mela Nabal nuhmei Abigail le khan.

en: And his men that were with him did David bring up, every man with his household: and they dwelt in the cities of Hebron.
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuoma mi um po pohai chu a ṭhuoi a, mi tin an sûngkuohai seng leh, Hebron khuoa chun an um a.

en: And the men of Judah came, and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. And they told David, saying, The men of Jabesh-gilead were they that buried Saul.
hmr: Chun, Juda rama mihai an va feh a, Juda mihai chunga lal dingin David chu hriek an nâl tah a. Chun, “Saula phûmtuhai chu Jabes-gilead mihai an nih,” tiin David chu an hril a.

en: And David sent messengers unto the men of Jabesh-gilead, and said unto them, Blessed be ye of Jehovah, that ye have showed this kindness unto your lord, even unto Saul, and have buried him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jabes-gilead mihai kuoma chun David chun mi a tir a, an kuomah, “In lalpa Saula chu hi lung- insietna hi suklangin ama chu in lo phûm ta leiin LALPA chun malsâwm raw se cheu.

en: And now Jehovah show lovingkindness and truth unto you: and I also will requite you this kindness, because ye have done this thing.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun in chungah zainêmna le thutak inlang- tir sienla, hieng thil in thaw lei hin kei khawma in lunginsietna man chu thung ka ti cheu.

en: Now therefore let your hands be strong, and be ye valiant; for Saul your lord is dead, and also the house of Judah have anointed me king over them.
hmr: Chuongchun, in kuthai chu hung hrât sienla, huoitakin um ro, in lalpa Saula chu a thi ta sih a; chun, Juda chihai chun an chunga lal dingin hriek an mi nâl ta bawk a,” a ta.

en: Now Abner the son of Ner, captain of Saul’s host, had taken Ish-bosheth the son of Saul, and brought him over to Mahanaim;
hmr: Chun, Nera naupa Abner, Saula sipai hotu chun Saula naupa Is- boseth chu Mahanaimah a ṭhuoi a,

en: and he made him king over Gilead, and over the Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
hmr: Gilead chunga dâm, Asur mihai chunga dâm, Jezreel chunga dâm, Ephraim chunga dâm, Israel chung po poah lalah a siem tah a.

en: Ish-bosheth, Saul’s son, was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and he reigned two years. But the house of Judah followed David.
hmr: (Saula naupa Is-boseth chu Israel chunga ro a rêl ṭan lai chun kum sâwmli mi a na, kum hni ro a rêl a). Nisienlakhawm, Juda mihai chun David chu an pawm lem a.

en: And the time that David was king in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.
hmr: Davidin Hebrona Juda chihai chunga ro a rêlna chu kum sari le thla ruk a ni tah a.

en: And Abner the son of Ner, and the servants of Ish-bosheth the son of Saul, went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.
hmr: Chun, Nera naupa Abner le Saula naupa Is-boseth siehlawhai chu Mahanaima inthawk an suok a, Gibeonah an feh a.

en: And Joab the son of Zeruiah, and the servants of David, went out, and met them by the pool of Gibeon; and they sat down, the one on the one side of the pool, and the other on the other side of the pool.
hmr: Chun, Zeruia naupa Joab le David siehlawhai chu an fe suok a, Gibeon dîla chun an intuok a; chuong- chun, pâwl khat chu dîl râl khing- tieng chun an ṭhung a, pâwl khat dang chu dîl râl khingtieng chun.

en: And Abner said to Joab, Let the young men, I pray thee, arise and play before us. And Joab said, Let them arise.
hmr: Chun, Abner chun Joab kuom- ah, “Tlangvâlhai chu hung inthawk- hai sienla, ei hmaa hin hang inthaw ta hai sienla,” a ta. Chun, Joab chun, “Hung inthawk e â,” a ta.

en: Then they arose and went over by number: twelve for Benjamin, and for Ish-bosheth the son of Saul, and twelve of the servants of David.
hmr: Chuongchun, an inthawk a, an ni zât chin ruot chie chu an kai a, Benjamin chi Saula naupa Is-boseth tienga ṭhang chu sâwm le pahni; chun, David siehlawhai chu sâwm le pahni bawk.

en: And they caught every one his fellow by the head, and thrust his sword in his fellow’s side; so they fell down together: wherefore that place was called Helkath-hazzurim, which is in Gibeon.
hmr: An khingpuihai chu an lu sengah an inman a, mâni bitumhai chu an nâkah kâwlhnâmin an insun seng a; chuongchun, an tlu ta vawng el a; chuleiin, chu hmun chu Helkath-Hazurim an ti tah a; chu chu Gibeona um a nih.

en: And the battle was very sore that day; and Abner was beaten, and the men of Israel, before the servants of David.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu nia an inthaw chu a nasa ta hle a, chun, Abner le Israel mihai chu David siehlawhai hmaa chun an tlâwm tah a.

en: And the three sons of Zeruiah were there, Joab, and Abishai, and Asahel: and Asahel was as light of foot as a wild roe.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun Zeruia naupasalhai pathum Joab le Abisai le Asahel hai chu an um a, Asahel chu sazukpui ang ela ngal hrât a nih.

en: And Asahel pursued after Abner; and in going he turned not to the right hand nor to the left from following Abner.
hmr: Chuongchun, Asahel chun Abner chu a hnawt a, Abner a hnawt chu changtieng le vawitieng khawm pêt hlek loin a hnawt a.

en: Then Abner looked behind him, and said, Is it thou, Asahel? And he answered, It is I.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abner chu a hang nghale a, “Nang i ni maw Asahel?” a hei tih a. Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Kei ka nih ie,” a ta.

en: And Abner said to him, Turn thee aside to thy right hand or to thy left, and lay thee hold on one of the young men, and take thee his armor. But Asahel would not turn aside from following him.
hmr: Chun, Abner chun, a kuomah, “I changtieng amanih, i vawitieng amani khan pêt la, tlangvâl pakhat kha man la, a râlthuom kha lâkpêk rawh,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, Asahel chun ama a hnawt chu a pêtsan nuom chuong nawh a.

en: And Abner said again to Asahel, Turn thee aside from following me: wherefore should I smite thee to the ground? how then should I hold up my face to Joab thy brother?
hmr: Chun, Abner chun Asahel kuomah, “Mi pêtsan rawh, iengdingin am sunthlûng ka ti cheh a? I unaupa Joab hmêl ka hmu ngam ding am a nih?” a ti nâwk a.

en: Howbeit he refused to turn aside: wherefore Abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him in the body, so that the spear came out behind him; and he fell down there, and died in the same place: and it came to pass, that as many as came to the place where Asahel fell down and died stood still.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a pêt nuom chuong nawh a, chuleiin, Abner chun a feiṭhut tiengin a phîngah a sun a, a fei chu a hnungtieng a tlang a, chutaka chun a tlu ta tawp a, chu hmuna chun a thi tah a; chun, Asahel a tlûka a thina hmun hung tlung taphawthai chu chutaka chun an ngîr chawt pei a.

en: But Joab and Abishai pursued after Abner: and the sun went down when they were come to the hill of Ammah, that lieth before Giah by the way of the wilderness of Gibeon.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Joab le Abisai chun Abner chu an hnawt pei a, chun, Gibeon thlalêr lampuia Gia dep Amma tlâng an tlung chun nisa a tla tah a.

en: And the children of Benjamin gathered themselves together after Abner, and became one band, and stood on the top of a hill.
hmr: Chun, Benjamin thlahai chu Abner kuoma chun an pungkhâwm a, pâwl khatah an insiem a, tlâng sîpa chun an va ngîr tah a.

en: Then Abner called to Joab, and said, Shall the sword devour for ever? knowest thou not that it will be bitterness in the latter end? how long shall it be then, ere thou bid the people return from following their brethren?
hmr: Chuongchun, Abner chun Joab chu a ko a, “Kâwlhnâm hin a vât zing ding am a nih? A tâwp tieng chun la lunginzîngum hlêng a tih ti i hriet naw am a nih? Mipuihai chu ieng chen am an unauhai hnawt kîrsan dinga hril loin i um ding a na?” a ta.

en: And Joab said, As God liveth, if thou hadst not spoken, surely then in the morning the people had gone away, nor followed every one his brother.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun, “Pathien hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, ieng- khawm lo hril naw la chu mipuihai chu zîngkâr khan an fe hmang ta ding a na, an unauhai chu an hnawt naw ding bah,” a ta.

en: So Joab blew the trumpet; and all the people stood still, and pursued after Israel no more, neither fought they any more.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chun taw- tawrâwt chu a hei mût a, mipuihai chu an ngîr ta ṭhuop a, Israel mihai chu an hnawt ta nawh a, an thaw nâwk ta nawh a.

en: And Abner and his men went all that night through the Arabah; and they passed over the Jordan, and went through all Bithron, and came to Mahanaim.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abner le a mihai chu chu zân chun zânkhawvârin an feh a, chun, Jordan an kai a, Bithron an fe thleng rak a, Mahanaim an tlung tah a.

en: And Joab returned from following Abner: and when he had gathered all the people together, there lacked of David’s servants nineteen men and Asahel.
hmr: Chun, Joab chu Abner a hnawt chu a kîr tah a; chun, mipuihai po po a hei ko khâwm chun David rawihai sâwmpakuo le Asahel an lo kim ta nawh a.

en: But the servants of David had smitten of Benjamin, and of Abner’s men, so that three hundred and threescore men died.
hmr: David rawihai ruok chun Benjamin mihai le Abner mihai chu za thum le sâwmruk an sukhlum a.

en: And they took up Asahel, and buried him in the sepulchre of his father, which was in Beth-lehem. And Joab and his men went all night, and the day brake upon them at Hebron.
hmr: Chuongchun, Asahel ruong chu an lâk a, Bethlehema a pa thlânah an phûm a. Chun, Joab le a mihai chu zânkhawvârin an feh a, Hebron an tlung chun khuo a var a.

en: And there happened to be there a base fellow, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite: and he blew the trumpet, and said, We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to his tents, O Israel.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun Benjamin mi, Bikri naupa a hming Seba, Belial mi pakhat a lo um hlau el a; tawtawrâwt a mût a, “Davida hin chanvo ei nei ve nawh a, Jesai naupaa hin rohluo ding ei nei bawk nawh, aw Israel mihai, in puon in tieng seng fe ro,” a ta.

en: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah clave unto their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mi po poin David an zui chu an mâksan a, Bikri naupa Seba chu an zui tah a; Juda mihai ruok chun Jordana inthawka Jerusalem chenin an lal chu an inkawppui ta tlat a.

en: And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in ward, and provided them with sustenance, but went not in unto them. So they were shut up unto the day of their death, living in widowhood.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Jeru- salema a in chu a tlung a; chun, lal chun nuhmei sâwm a thaikêmhai in nghâk dinga a siehai chu a ṭhuoi a, a khum a, an fâk ding a pêk a, nisien- lakhawm, an kuomah a lût nawh a. Chuongchun, an thi ni chena khuma umin, hmeithaiin an um tah a.

en: Then said the king to Amasa, Call me the men of Judah together within three days, and be thou here present.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Amasa kuomah, “Ni thum sûngin Juda mihai mi ko khâwmpêk la, chun, nang khawm hung ṭhang ve bawk la,” a ta.

en: So Amasa went to call the men of Judah together; but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Amasa chu Juda mihai ko khâwm dingin a fe tah a; amiruokchu, a hun ruotpêk nêkin a va thang sâwt tah a.

en: And David said to Abishai, Now will Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom: take thou thy lord’s servants, and pursue after him, lest he get him fortified cities, and escape out of our sight.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Abisai kuomah, “Bikri naupa Seba hin Absalom nêk hmanin ei pawi a tâwk ding a nih ie, i pu mihai hi ṭhuoi la, hnawt ro khai; chuong naw chun khaw kul neia dam lût hman a ta, ei hmu phâk nawa hin insuo hlau rawi ei tih,” a ta.

en: And there went out after him Joab’s men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab rawihai, Kereth mihai le, Peleth mihai le an mi hrâthai po po chun ama an zui suok tah a; Jerusalema inthawk chun Bikri naupa Seba chu hnawt dingin an suok tah a.

en: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. And Joab was girded with his apparel of war that he had put on, and thereon was a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out.
hmr: Gibeona lungpui umna an va tlung chun Amasa chun anni chu a lo tuok a. Chun, Joab chu indona thuomhnawin ân chei a; chun, a chunga chun kâwlhnâm a bâwm pumin, kâwngkhia chun a pai a; chun, a fe malam chun a kâwlhnâm chu damtein a phawi a.

en: And Joab said to Amasa, Is it well with thee, my brother? And Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun Amasa kuoma chun, “Unaupa, i ṭha pei de maw?” a ta. Chun, Joab chun Amasa chu fâwp tumin a khâkhmul chu a kut changtiengin a chel a.

en: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab’s hand: so he smote him therewith in the body, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. And Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Amasa chun Joabin kâwlhnâm a chawi chu a ngai- sak nawh a; chuongchun, a phînga chun a sun a, a rîlhai chu a sukthlâk nuoi el a, a sun nawn nâwk ta nawh a; chuongchun, a thi tah a. Chuong- chun, Joab le a unaupa Abisai chun Bikri naupa Seba chu an hnawt tah a.

en: And there stood by him one of Joab’s young men, and said, He that favoreth Joab, and he that is for David, let him follow Joab.
hmr: Chun, a kâwlah Joab rawihai laia tlangvâl pakhat chu a ngir a, “Joab le David tienga ṭhang taphawt chun Joab hi zui pei raw se,” a tih a.

en: And Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.
hmr: Chun, Amasa chu lamlien laitakah a thisenin a lo inchie nuoi el a. Chun, ama chun mi po po ngîr zinga a hmu chun Amasa ruong chu lamliena inthawk chun phûl tienga sawnin puonin ân khum a, a kâwla hung taphawt chu an ngîr peia a hmu leiin.

en: When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.
hmr: Chun, lamliena inthawka sie hmang a ni hnung chun Bikri naupa Seba chu hnawt dingin mi po po chun Joab chu an zui tah a.

en: And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and to Beth-maacah, and all the Berites: and they were gathered together, and went also after him.
hmr: Chun, Abel chen le, Beth-maaka chenin Israel hnam po pohai le Ber mihai po po khawm chu a sir vawng a; chun, an pungkhâwm a, ama an zui ve a.

en: And they came and besieged him in Abel of Beth-maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood against the rampart; and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.
hmr: Chun, Beth-maakaa Abel khuoa chun an inhuol a; chun, a khaw hrûla chun hnuoi an dêng pâwng a, kul hrûla chun a ngîr a, chun, Joab kuoma mi um po pohai chun kul chu sukchim dingin an suk tlut tlut a.

en: Then cried a wise woman out of the city, Hear, hear; say, I pray you, unto Joab, Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei var pa- khat khuoa inthawk chun a hung khêk a, “Khai khai, Joab kuomah, ‘Hung hnâi raw khai, i kuomah thu lo hril ka ti khai,’ a tih, hang ti ro khai,” a tih a.

en: And he came near unto her; and the woman said, Art thou Joab? And he answered, I am. Then she said unto him, Hear the words of thy handmaid. And he answered, I do hear.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma chun a va fe hnai a, chun, nuhmei chun, “Joab i ni maw?” a tih a. “Nih e,” a tih a, a dawn a. Chuongchun, a kuomah, “I suoknu thuhril hi ngai ta,” a tih a. Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Ka lo ngai ie,” a tih a.

en: Then she spake, saying, They were wont to speak in old time, saying, They shall surely ask counsel at Abel: and so they ended the matter.
hmr: Chuongchun, “Tienlai chun, ‘Abel khuoa hin inrawn phawt an ta,’ an ti hlak a, chuong ang chun thu an suktâwp hlak.

en: I am of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel: thou seekest to destroy a city and a mother in Israel: why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of Jehovah?
hmr: Kei hi Israelhai laia inrem nuom le ringum pâwl ka na, nang chun Israel khuo, a khaw bulpui hi suksiet i tum a ni hi, LALPA ro chu iengdinga sukhmang i tum am a na?” tiin a hril a.

en: And Joab answered and said, Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun a dawn a, “Chuong ang chu a ni naw tawp el, sukhmang amanih, suksiet amanih ka tum naw hrim hrim. Chuong ang tieng thu chu a ni nawh;

en: The matter is not so: but a man of the hill-country of Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, hath lifted up his hand against the king, even against David; deliver him only, and I will depart from the city. And the woman said unto Joab, Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.
hmr: Ephraim tlâng rama Bikri naupa Seba chun lal David ngei chu dodâlin a kut ân let a; ama chu mi pe el unla, khuo chu suoksan el kan tih,” a tih a. Chun, nuhmei chun Joab kuomah, “Ngai ta, a lu chu kulah hung pei liempêk kan ti che,” a tih a.

en: Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. And he blew the trumpet, and they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei chu a varna hmang chun mipui po pohai lai chun a feh a. Chun, Bikri naupa Seba lu chu an tan a, Joab kuom tieng chun an thedawk a. Chun, tawtawrâwt a mût a, mâni puon in tieng seng, khuoa inthawk chun an indar tah a. Chun, Joab chu Jerusalemah lal kuoma chun a fe nâwk tah a.

en: Now Joab was over all the host of Israel; and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites;
hmr: Joab chu Israelhai po po sipai hotu a na, chun, Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu Kereth mi le Peleth mihai hotu a nih;

en: and Adoram was over the men subject to taskwork; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder;
hmr: chun, Adoniram chu sinthawa ruoiluihai hotu a nih; chun, Ahilud naupa, Jehosaphat chu chanchin ziektu a na;

en: and Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
hmr: Seva chu lekha ziektu a na, chun, Zadok le Abiathar chu thiempu an nih;

en: and also Ira the Jairite was chief minister unto David.
hmr: chun, Jair mi Ira khawm chu David thiempu a nih.

en: And there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David sought the face of Jehovah. And Jehovah said, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he put to death the Gibeonites.
hmr: Chun, David damlai chun a kum bi sirin kum thum ṭâm a tlah a; chun, David chun LALPA chu a rawn a. Chun, LALPA chun, “Thisen insuotu Saula le a sûnghai lei a nih; Gibeon mihai a that el si a,” a ta.

en: And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah);
hmr: Chun, lal chun Gibeon mihai chu a ko a, an kuomah, (Gibeon mihai chu Israel thlahai an ni nawh a, Amor mi la um sunhai kha an ni lem a; Israel thlahai chun an chunga chun ṭawng an lo inkhâm tah a; Saula chun Juda thlahai le Israel thlahai ta dinga ṭhahnem a ngai leiin that a tum el hlak a nih).

en: and David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of Jehovah?
hmr: David chun Gibeon mihai kuoma chun, “Iengam thawpêk ka ti cheu a? LALPA ro chu mal in sâwm theina dingin ieng ang inremna am siempêk ka ti cheu a?” a ta.

en: And the Gibeonites said unto him, It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or his house; neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that will I do for you.
hmr: Chun, Gibeon mihai chun a kuomah, “Saula le a sûnghai le kan chungthua hin tangka le rângkachak tieng thu a ni nawh a, Israel mihai lai hin mi sukhlum theina kan nei bawk nawh,” an ta. Chun, ama chun, “In hril ang taphawt chu thawpêk ka ti cheu,” a ta.

en: And they said unto the king, The man that consumed us, and that devised against us, that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel,
hmr: Chun, lal kuoma chun, “A mi sukbohmangtu le Israel ram sûng hrim hrima khawm um loa, sukbo- hmang dinga a mi phiertu chu,

en: let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto Jehovah in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of Jehovah. And the king said, I will give them.
hmr: a naupasalhai pasari mi pe la, LALPA mi ruot Saula umna khuo Gibea khuoa chun LALPA hmaah khai kan tih,” an ta. Chun, lal chun, “Pe e â,” a ta.

en: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of Jehovah’s oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal chun LALPA kuomah David le Saula naupa Jonathan kâra, an pahni inkâra ṭawng inkhâmna leiin Saula naupa Jonathan naupa Mephiboseth chu a hum a.

en: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bare to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:
hmr: Lal chun Aia naunu Rizpain Saula naupasal pahni a neipêk Armoni le Mephiboseth chu a ṭhuoi a; chun, Meholath mi Barzillai naupa Adriel, Saula naunu Mikalin nau- pasal panga a neipêkhai leh;

en: and he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the mountain before Jehovah, and they fell all seven together. And they were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.
hmr: chun, Gibeon mihai kuta chun ân hlân a, chun, anni chun LALPA hmaah thingah an khai a, chuong- chun, an pasari chun hmunkhatah an thi seng a, bu sîk hun, buṭei sîk hun vêl laiin an sukhlum a.

en: And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven; and she suffered neither the birds of the heavens to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.
hmr: Chun, Aia naunu Rizpa chun saiip puon a lâk a, bu sîk ṭantira inthawka vâna inthawka tuiin a hung burkhum chena a umna dingin, lungpui chungah ân zar khum a; an chunga sûna chunglêng vatehai fûk le ramsahai um khawm a phal nawh a.

en: And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.
hmr: Chun, Aia naunu Saula thai- kêm Rizpa thilthaw chu David chu an hril a.

en: And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the street of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, in the day that the Philistines slew Saul in Gilboa;
hmr: Chun, David chu a feh a, Philistin mihaiin Gilboaa Saula an that nia Philistin mihaiin Beth-san muol laia an khai inrutu, Jabes- Gilead mihai kuoma inthawkin Saula ru le a naupa Jonathan ruhai chu a lâk a.

en: and he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son: and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.
hmr: Chutaka Saula ru le a naupa Jonathan ruhai chu a lâk a; chuong- chun, an khaihai ru khawm chu an lâk khâwm a.

en: And they buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the sepulchre of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was entreated for the land.
hmr: Chun, Saula ru le a naupa Jonathan ruhai chu Benjamin rama Zela khuoa a pa Kis thlânah an phûm a, chun, lal thupêk ang pei chun an thawh a. Chun, chu hnunga chun chu ram chunga chun Pathien a lungâwi tah a.

en: And the Philistines had war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines. And David waxed faint;
hmr: Philistin mihai chun Israel mihai chu an do nâwk a; chun, David chu a mihai le chun an fe thlah a; Philistin mihai chu an zu do a, chun, David chu a hung chau ta hle el a.

en: and Ishbi-benob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.
hmr: Chun, Isbi-benod, mi lien naupasalhai laia mi, a fei rikzie chu dâr Shekel za thum, kâwlhnâm thar pai chun David chu that a tum a.

en: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succored him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the lamp of Israel.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Zeruia naupa Abisai chun a san a, Philistin mi chu a thawh a, a that tah a. Chun, David mihai chun, “Israelhai khâwnvar hi i sukmit nawna dingin indo dingin kan kuomah suok ve ta dêr naw ti nih,” tiin a chungah ṭawng an inkhâm a.

en: And it came to pass after this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbecai the Hushathite slew Saph, who was of the sons of the giant.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Philistin mihai leh Gob khuoah indona a um nâwk a; chutaka chun Husath mi Sibbekai chun mi lien naupasalhai laia mi Saph a that a.

en: And there was again war with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan the son of Jaare-oregim the Beth-lehemite slew Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai leh Gob khuoah an indo nâwk a; chun, Bethlehem mi Jaare-oregim naupa Elhananin Git mi Goliath a that a, a fei ngul chu puon khâwngtu puon- kawl ang a nih.

en: And there was again war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.
hmr: Chun, Gath khuoah indona a um nâwk a, chutaka chun mi insâng- tak el a kut khingtieng khingtienga kutpâr paruk, a ke khingtieng khingtienga kepâr paruk, a rênga sâwmhni le pali nei hi a um a; ama khawm chu mi liena inthawka pieng a nih.

en: And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimei, David’s brother, slew him.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai chu a va cho a, David unau Simei naupa Jonathan chun a lo that a.

en: These four were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
hmr: Chun, chuong palihai chu Gath khuoa mi liena inthawka pieng an na, chuonghai chu David le a mihai kutah an thih a.

en: And David spake unto Jehovah the words of this song in the day that Jehovah delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul:
hmr: Chun, David chun a hmêl- mahai po po kuta inthawk le Saula kuta inthawk LALPAIN a sansuok ni chun hi hla thu hi LALPA kuomah a hril a;

en: and he said, Jehovah is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer, even mine;
hmr: chuongchun, ama chun: “LALPA chu ka lungpui le ka kulpui le a mi sanhimtu a na, ka ta ngei a nih;

en: God, my rock, in him will I take refuge; My shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge; My saviour, thou savest me from violence.
hmr: Ka lungpui, Pathien ama chu ring ka ta, Ka phaw le ka sandamna ki, ka kulbîng insâng le kân humhimna a nih; Ka sandamtu, nangin inpâwngnêknaa inthawkin i mi sandam hlak.

en: I will call upon Jehovah, who is worthy to be praised: So shall I be saved from mine enemies.
hmr: Inpâktlâk LALPA chu ko ka ta, Chuongchun, a mi dotuhaia inthawka sandamin um ka tih.

en: For the waves of death compassed me; The floods of ungodliness made me afraid:
hmr: Thina hung insawk chun a mîn huol vêl a, Pathien ngaisak nawna tuilien chun a mi suklau a.

en: The cords of Sheol were round about me; The snares of death came upon me.
hmr: Seol hruihruolhai chun a mi khuop vêl a, Thina chânghai chun a mi âwk bawk a.

en: In my distress I called upon Jehovah; Yea, I called unto my God: And he heard my voice out of his temple, And my cry came into his ears.
hmr: Ka lunginzîngin LALPA chu ka ko a, Anih, ka Pathien chu ka ko hlak. Chun, ama chun a biekina inthawk chun ka râwl chu a hriet a, Chun, ka khêkri chu a naa chun a lût tah a.

en: Then the earth shook and trembled, The foundations of heaven quaked And were shaken, because he was wroth.
hmr: Chu phingle chun hnuoi hi ân hning a, ân thin tah a, A lunginsen leiin vân innghatna chenin ân hnîngin ân thin tah a.

en: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, And fire out of his mouth devoured: Coals were kindled by it.
hmr: A hnâra inthawk chun meikhu ân tung ta ngut ngut a, A baua suok mei chun a kâng ta dur dur a; Chu chun meihawl khawm chu a sukchawk ta dur dur a.

en: He bowed the heavens also, and came down; And thick darkness was under his feet.
hmr: Ama chun vânhai khawm a sukkûn a, a ṭum tah a, A ke hnuoiahai chun inthim sâmup hi a hung um a.

en: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly; Yea, he was seen upon the wings of the wind.
hmr: Cherub chungah a chuong a, a vuong tah a, Anih, thli thlaahai chun an hmuh a.

en: And he made darkness pavilions round about him, Gathering of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
hmr: Inthim chu ama inhuol vêlna bûktêah a siem a, Tuihai, vâna sûm sâmuphai chu fâwkkhâwmin,

en: At the brightness before him Coals of fire were kindled.
hmr: A hmaa varna lei chun, Meilinghai chu a chawk a.

en: Jehovah thundered from heaven, And the Most High uttered his voice.
hmr: LALPA chu vâna khin a hung inri dur dur a, Achunghnungtak chun a râwl ân suoh a.

en: And he sent out arrows, and scattered them; Lightning, and discomfited them.
hmr: Chun, thalhai chu a kâp suok a, anni chu a sukdar a, Kâwl dâm ân leptir a, a sukbuoi tah a.

en: Then the channels of the sea appeared, The foundations of the world were laid bare, By the rebuke of Jehovah, At the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
hmr: Chu phingleh LALPA kâwkna leia, A hnâra inthuok suokin a mût rak lei chun, Leihnuoi innghatnahai chu suklangin a um tah a.

en: He sent from on high, he took me; He drew me out of many waters;
hmr: Ama chun chung tienga inthawkin a hung ban a, a mi chel a, Tui tamtaka inthawk chun a mi hnûk dawk a.

en: He delivered me from my strong enemy, From them that hated me; for they were too mighty for me.
hmr: A mi dotu hrâttaka inthawk chun a mi sanhim a, A mi theidatuhaia inthawk leh, keia ta ding chun an hrât talaw sih a.

en: They came upon me in the day of my calamity; But Jehovah was my stay.
hmr: Anni chun ka vângsiet ni chun an mi hung thawh a, Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chu kân nghatna tak a nih.

en: He brought me forth also into a large place; He delivered me, because he delighted in me.
hmr: Ama chun hmun inthâwltakah a mi ṭhuoi suok a, Ka chunga a lâwm leiin a mi lo sanhim tah a nih.

en: Jehovah rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
hmr: LALPA chun ka felzie ang peiin ka chungah a thawh a, Ka kuthai ân thieng ang ngeiin a mi thung a nih.

en: For I have kept the ways of Jehovah, And have not wickedly departed from my God.
hmr: LALPA lampuihai chu ka hrawh a, Ka Pathien kuoma inthawk chun suoltakin ka fe hmang ngai si nawh a.

en: For all his ordinances were before me; And as for his statutes, I did not depart from them.
hmr: A rorêlna po po ka hmaah a um hlak a, A thuruothai hlak chu ka nghatsan ngai si nawh a.

en: I was also perfect toward him; And I kept myself from mine iniquity.
hmr: Ama kuoma chun hrilsietbo ka ni bawk a, Ka rîtlonaa inthawkin kân siekieng hlak a.

en: Therefore hath Jehovah recompensed me according to my righteousness, According to my cleanness in his eyesight.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun ka felzie ang peiin a mi lo thung tah a; A mithmua kân thiengzie ang peiin.

en: With the merciful thou wilt show thyself merciful; With the perfect man thou wilt show thyself perfect;
hmr: Mi lunginsiet theihai kuoma chun lunginsiet theitakin insuklang i ta, Mi ṭha famkimhai kuoma chun ṭha famkimin insuklang i tih.

en: With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure; And with the perverse thou wilt show thyself froward.
hmr: Mi inthieng kuoma chun inthiengin insuklang i ta, Chun, mi kâwmaw kuoma chun kâwmaw angin insuklang i tih.

en: And the afflicted people thou wilt save; But thine eyes are upon the haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.
hmr: Rinum tuor mihai chu sandam i ta, Mi chapohai ruok chu i suktlâwm theina dingin an chungah i mit a fu zing a.

en: For thou art my lamp, O Jehovah; And Jehovah will lighten my darkness.
hmr: Aw LALPA, khâwnvar i ni sih a; LALPA chun kân thimna hi sukvar a tih.

en: For by thee I run upon a troop; By my God do I leap over a wall.
hmr: Nangma ṭhangpuiin râl ka baw sih a, Ka Pathien ṭhangpui bawkin kul kân châwmhlên a nih.

en: As for God, his way is perfect: The word of Jehovah is tried; He is a shield unto all them that take refuge in him.
hmr: Pathien chu a lampui a ṭha famkim a, LALPA thu chu inchien a ni tah. Ama ringtuhai po po ta dingin ama chu phaw a nih.

en: For who is God, save Jehovah? And who is a rock, save our God?
hmr: LALPA naw chu tu am Pathien an um? Ei Pathien naw chu tu am lungpui an um a?

en: God is my strong fortress; And he guideth the perfect in his way.
hmr: Pathien chu ka kulpui nghettak a na, Mi ṭha famkim chu a lampuiah a ṭhuoi hlak.

en: He maketh his feet like hinds’ feet, And setteth me upon my high places.
hmr: Ka kehai chu sazukpui ke angin a siem a, Ka hmun insângahai a mîn umtir hlak.

en: He teacheth my hands to war, So that mine arms do bend a bow of brass.
hmr: Ka kuthai hi râl kâp dingin ân chûktir hlak a, Chuongchun, ka bânhai hin dâr thalngul a kuoi zo hiel a.

en: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation; And thy gentleness hath made me great.
hmr: Nangin i sandamna phaw chu i mi pêk bawk a; I înngaitlâwmna chun i mi siem lien tah.

en: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; And my feet have not slipped.
hmr: Ka hnuoia ka kalchawina chu i suklien a, Chuongchun, ka kehai hi ân tleu nawh a.

en: I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them; Neither did I turn again till they were consumed.
hmr: Ka hmêlmahai chu ka hnawt phâk a,ka sukbohmang a, Sukbohmang dêra an um hmakhat chun ka kîr nawh.

en: And I have consumed them, and smitten them through, so that they cannot arise: Yea, they are fallen under my feet.
hmr: An tho nâwk thei nawna dingin ka sukbohmang dêr a, ka sât fik a; Anih, ka ke hnuoiah an tlu tah a.

en: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle; Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
hmr: Nangin inthawnaa ding chun ka taiah hrâtnain i mi hrên sih a, A mi hung thawtuhai chu ka hnuoiah i tukdawl tah a.

en: Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me, That I might cut off them that hate me.
hmr: A mi theidatuhai chu ka sukbohmang theina dingin, Nangin a mi dotuhai chu mi hnunginnghatin în umtir ta bawk a.

en: They looked, but there was none to save; Even unto Jehovah, but he answered them not.
hmr: An ngha vêl a, nisienlakhawm, sandamtu ding tukhawm an um nawh a; LALPA ngei chu an hang en a, nisienlakhawm, a dawn si nawh.

en: Then did I beat them small as the dust of the earth, I did crush them as the mire of the streets, and did spread them abroad.
hmr: Chu phingle chun hnuoia pilvut ang elin ka vuok phit a, Khawlai chirhak ang elin ka sukhmât a, ka sukdar tah a.

en: Thou also hast delivered me from the strivings of my people; Thou hast kept me to be the head of the nations: A people whom I have not known shall serve me.
hmr: Nangin ka mihai insuolnaa inthawk khawmin i mi sanhim tah a, Hnam tin lu chu ni dingin i mi vawng ṭha a. Ka hriet ngai naw hnam chun ka rawng bâwl tâng an tih.

en: The foreigners shall submit themselves unto me: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me.
hmr: Hnam danghai chu ka kuomah inpêng an ta, Ka chanchin an hriet phingleh ka thu zâwm an tih.

en: The foreigners shall fade away, And shall come trembling out of their close places.
hmr: Hnam danghai chu chul an ta, An kulbînghaia inthawk dâm chun inthin pumin hung suok an tih.

en: Jehovah liveth; And blessed be my rock; And exalted be God, the rock of my salvation,
hmr: LALPA chu a hring zing a, ka lungpui chu inpâkin um raw se; A mi sandamna lungpui, Pathien chu chawimawiin um raw se.

en: Even the God that executeth vengeance for me, And that bringeth down peoples under me,
hmr: Phuba mi lapêktu le, Hnam tin ka hnuoia tukdawltu Pathien ngei chu.

en: And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: Yea, thou liftest me up above them that rise up against me; Thou deliverest me from the violent man.
hmr: A mi dotuhaia inthawka a mi la suoktu, Anih, nangin a mi thawtuhai chungtieng chun i mi dawm kâng a; Mi nunsiea inthawk chun i mi sanhim hlak.

en: Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the nations, And will sing praises unto thy name.
hmr: Chuleiin, aw LALPA, hnam tinhai lai chun lâwmthu hril ka ti cheh a, I hming inpâkin hla sak bawk ka tih.

en: Great deliverance giveth he to his king, And showeth lovingkindness to his anointed, To David and to his seed, for evermore.
hmr: Ama chun sandamna ropuitak a lal a pêk hlak a; A hrieknâl chungah, David le a thlahai chung ngeia chun, Kumkhuoin a zainêmzie inlangtir a tih,” a tih a.

en: Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse saith, And the man who was raised on high saith, The anointed of the God of Jacob, And the sweet psalmist of Israel:
hmr: Hieng hi David thuhril nuhnung tak a nih, Jesai naupa David chun a hril a; “Insângtaka dawm sânga, Jakob Pathien hrieknâl, Israelhai hla mawitak phuoktu chun a hril a;

en: The Spirit of Jehovah spake by me, And his word was upon my tongue.
hmr: LALPA thlarau chun keima mi hmangin a hril a, A thu chu ka leiah a um a.

en: The God of Israel said, The Rock of Israel spake to me: One that ruleth over men righteously, That ruleth in the fear of God,
hmr: Israelhai Pathien chun a hril a, Israelhai lungpui chun: ‘Mi chunga feltaka rorêl hlaka, Pathien ṭi puma rorêl hlak chu,

en: He shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, A morning without clouds, When the tender grass springeth out of the earth, Through clear shining after rain.
hmr: Nisa a hung suok a, sûm um dêr lo, Zîng khawvar ang hi nîng a ta; Raw sûr zoa khuo hung inthienga, Hnuoia hlohna inder no hlap ang hi nîng a tih.

en: Verily my house is not so with God; Yet he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, Ordered in all things, and sure: For it is all my salvation, and all my desire, Although he maketh it not to grow.
hmr: Ei sûngkuo chu Pathien kuoma inthawk a ni naw am a nih? Chatuon thuthlung ka kuomah a thlung a; Iengkim fel le suknghet tlatin; Ka sandamna kim le duthusâm kim, Ân der suoktir naw ding maw?

en: But the ungodly shall be all of them as thorns to be thrust away, Because they cannot be taken with the hand;
hmr: Mi rilohai chu an rênga a hnâwla hnâwlhmang mi, hling ang nîng an ta, Kuta lâk mi an ni si nawh.

en: But the man that toucheth them Must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear: And they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place.
hmr: A tâwktu ding chun thîr le fei ngul ruoi lem ding a na, Chuongchun, an hmuna raw- hmang vawng nîng an tih,’ tiin a mi biek a,” tiin.

en: These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite, against eight hundred slain at one time.
hmr: Hieng hi David sipai huoisenhai hming chu a nih; Takemon mi Joseb-bassebeth chu sipai hotuhai laia hotu tak a na, ama chu ṭum khata mi za riet thattu Aznit mi Adino an ti bawk kha a nih.

en: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodai the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away.
hmr: Chun, a dawttu chu Aho mi naupa Dodai naupa Eleazar a na, ama chu Philistin mihai indo dinga an pungkhâwm a, an cho a, Israel mihai an fe hmang vawng laia David kuoma sipai huoisen pathumhai laia pakhat kha a nih.

en: He arose, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand clave unto the sword; and Jehovah wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to take spoil.
hmr: Ama chu a tho a, Philistin mihai chu kut kham rak khawpin, a kâwlhnâm khawm inlet theilo rak khawpin a that a, chu ni chun LALPAIN nasatakin a ngampêk a; chun, mipuihai chu a hnungah râllâk thil la ding ngawtin an hung kîr nâwk a.

en: And after him was Shammah the son of Agee a Hararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the people fled from the Philistines.
