hmr: Chun, chu dawttu chu Hara mi, Agee naupa Samma a na. Dailuo umna hmunah Philistin mihai chu lâk tumin an inkhâwm a, chun, mipuihai chun Philistin mihai chu an tlânsiet san a.

en: But he stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and slew the Philistines; and Jehovah wrought a great victory.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chu chu hmuna chun a ngîr a, a vêng tlat a, Philistin mihai chu a that a, chun, LALPAIN nasatakin a ngampêk a.

en: And three of the thirty chief men went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
hmr: Chun, sipai huoi sâwmthum laia pathumhai chu an zu feh a; bu sîk lai takin David kuomah Adullam pûkah an feh a; chun, Philistin sipai- hai chun Rephaim kâwnah ṭhang- hmun an khuor a.

en: And David was then in the stronghold; and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.
hmr: Chuong lai chun David chu kulbîngah a um a, chuong lai bawk chun Philistin sipaihai chu Bethle- hemah an um a.

en: And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!
hmr: Chun, David chun tui a châk êm êm el a, “Bethlehema tuisunsuo tui, kul kawtkhâr kâwla mi kha dâwn dinga mi pe um ta ve hai sienla aw,” a ta.

en: And the three mighty men brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, sipai huoisen pathumhai chun, Philistin sipaihai chu an nêr thleng a, kul kawtkhâr kâwla mi, Bethlehema tuisunsuo chu an va thâl a; an chawi a, David kuomah an fepui a, nisienlakhawm, a lo dâwn nuom nawh a, LALPA ta dingin a bunthlâk ta lem a.

en: And he said, Be it far from me, O Jehovah, that I should do this: shall I drink the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men.
hmr: “Aw LALPA, hi hi ka thaw naw dingzie chu, thi huoma fehai thisen chu ka dâwn ding am a nih?” a ta; chuongchun, a dâwn nuom ta nawh a. Chuong thilhai chu sipai huoisen pathumhai chun an thaw a nih.

en: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them, and had a name among the three.
hmr: Zeruia naupa Joab unaupa Abisai chu sâwmthumhai laia hotu tak a na, ama chun za thumhai chunga chun a fei chu a phawi a, anni chu a that a, Pathumhai laia chun hming ṭhat a hlaw a.

en: Was he not most honorable of the three? therefore he was made their captain: howbeit he attained not unto the first three.
hmr: Sâwmthumhai laia chun chawimawi tlâk tak a ni naw am a nih? Chuleiin, an hotuah an siem a, nisienlakhawm, a chunghnung tak pathum laia tiemsa a kai nawh.

en: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he slew the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
hmr: Chun, Kabzeel mi huoi naupa Jehoiada naupa Benaia thil nasatak thawtu chun Moab mi Ariel naupasal pahnihai chu a that a; chun, a zu feh a, vûr tlâk hun laiin khursûngah sakeibaknei a zu that bawk a.

en: And he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mi, mi lientak a that a; Aigupta mi chun a fei a chawi a, nisienlakhawm, ama chun hmawl chawiin a zuk pan a, Aigupta mi fei chawi chu a lâkpêk a, ama fei ma chun a sun hlum tah a.

en: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.
hmr: Jehoiada naupa Benaia chun chuong ang thil chu a thaw leiin sipai huoisen pathumhai laia chun hming- ṭhat a hlawh a.

en: He was more honorable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.
hmr: Mi sâwmthumhai nêk chun chawimawi tlâk a ni hrim a, nisienla- khawm, achunghnung tak pathum- hai laia tiemsa a kai nawh. Chun, David chun ama vêngtu hotuah a sieh a.

en: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,
hmr: Joab unaupa Asahel chu sâwmthumhai laia pakhat chu a na; Bethlehem khuoa mi Dodo naupa Elhanan,

en: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
hmr: Harod mi Samma, Harod mi Elika,

en: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
hmr: Palti mi Helez, Teko a mi Ikkes naupa Ira,

en: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
hmr: Anathoth mi Abiezer, Husath mi Mebunnai,

en: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
hmr: Aho mi Zalmon, Netophath mi Maharai,

en: Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,
hmr: Netophath mi Baana naupa Heleb, Benjamin thla Gibea khuoa mi Ribai naupa Ittai,

en: Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash.
hmr: Pirathon mi Benaia, Gaas vadungtea mi Hiddai;

en: Abi-albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
hmr: Arbath mi Abi-albon, Barhum mi Azmaveth;

en: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
hmr: Saalbon mi Eliaba, Jasen nau- pahai laia Jonathan;

en: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Ararite,
hmr: Harar mi Samma, Arar mi Sarar naupa Ahiam;

en: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
hmr: Maakath mi Ahasbai naupa Eliphelet, Gilon mi Ahithophel naupa Eliam;

en: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
hmr: Karmel mi Hezro, Arba mi Paarai;

en: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
hmr: Zoba khuoa mi Nathan naupa Igal, Gad mi Bani;

en: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armorbearers to Joab the son of Zeruiah,
hmr: Zeruia naupa Joab râlthuom chawitu Ammon mi Zelek, Beeroth mi Naharai;

en: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
hmr: Ithra mi Ira, Ithra mi Gareb;

en: Uriah the Hittite: thirty and seven in all.
hmr: Hit mi Uria, an rêng chun sawmthum le pasari an nih.

en: And again the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them, saying, Go, number Israel and Judah.
hmr: Chun, LALPA lunginsenna chu Israelhai chungah a ṭuong nawk ta thut a, “Fe la, Israel mihai le Juda mihai tiem vawng rawh,” tiin David chun an pawi tâwk dingin a chawktho a.

en: And the king said to Joab the captain of the host, who was with him, Go now to and fro through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the sum of the people.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuoma um sipai hotu Joab kuoma chun, “Israel hnam po po lai hin Dana inthawka Beer- Seba chenin invâk vêl la mi ieng zât am an ni ka hriet theina dingin tiem vawng ro,” a ta.

en: And Joab said unto the king, Now Jehovah thy God add unto the people, how many soever they may be, a hundredfold; and may the eyes of my lord the king see it: but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing?
hmr: Chun, Joab chun lal kuomah, “LALPA i Pathien chun mipuihai sukpungin, ieng zâta tam khawm, a lêt za khawm, lalpa ka pu a hin hmu hman raw se; nisienlakhawm, lalpa ka pu chun chu chu iengdinga hriet ân hâwk am a ni leh?” a ta.

en: Notwithstanding, the king’s word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal thu chun Joab le a sipai hotuhai chu a hne tah a. Chuongchun, Joab le a sipai hotu- hai chu Israelhai tiem ding chun lal kuoma inthawk chu an suok tah a.

en: And they passed over the Jordan, and encamped in Aroer, on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad, and unto Jazer:
hmr: Chun, Jordan râl an va kai a, chun, Gad ruom laitak changtieng panga khaw um Aroera chun Jazer chenin umhmun an khuor a;

en: then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtim-hodshi; and they came to Dan-jaan, and round about to Sidon,
hmr: chun, Tahtim-hodsi le Gilead ram an tlung a; chun, Dan-jaan an tlung a, Zidon panin an fe pei a,

en: and came to the stronghold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites; and they went out to the south of Judah, at Beer-sheba.
hmr: chun, Tura kul dâm an va tlung a; chun, Hiv mihai le Kanaan mihai khuohai po po an tlung a, chun, Judai simtieng Beer-sebaah an feh a.

en: So when they had gone to and fro through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
hmr: Chuongchun, ram po po chu an fang suok hnung chun, thla kuo le ni sâwmhni zoah Jerusalemah an fe nâwk tah a.

en: And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun mihriem zât chin chu lal a pêk a; chun, Israel rama chun kâwlhnâm chawi mi, mi huoisen nuoi riet an um a; chun, Juda mi chu nuoi nga an um a.

en: And David’s heart smote him after that he had numbered the people. And David said unto Jehovah, I have sinned greatly in that which I have done: but now, O Jehovah, put away, I beseech thee, the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
hmr: Chun, mihriem an hang tiem zo chun David lungril chu a na ta hle el a. David chun LALPA kuomah, “Ka thilthawa hin nasatakin ka lo suol tah a nih; nisienlakhawm, tuhin aw LALPA, i siehlaw rîtlona hi sie hmang dingin ka ngên che, invêttakin ka lo thaw tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And when David rose up in the morning, the word of Jehovah came unto the prophet Gad, David’s seer, saying,
hmr: Chun, zîngkâra David a hang tho chun David zâwlnei, zâwlnei Gad kuomah LALPA thu a hung tlung a,

en: Go and speak unto David, Thus saith Jehovah, I offer thee three things: choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.
hmr: “Fe la, David kuomah, ‘LALPA- IN hieng ang hin a tih; thil kawng thum ka ruotpêk cheh a, i chunga ka thaw dingin pakhat thlang rawh,’ a tih a,” tiin.

en: So Gad came to David, and told him, and said unto him, Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thy foes while they pursue thee? or shall there be three days’ pestilence in thy land? now advise thee, and consider what answer I shall return to him that sent me.
hmr: Chuongchun, Gad chu David kuomah a feh a, a kuomah, “I rama hin kum sari ṭâm hung tlâk am, i hmêlma hmaa an hnawt sûng cheh a, thla thum lo tlân hmang hri am, i rama ni thum hri hung inlêng? a mi tirtu ieng angin am ka dawn ding a na, inngaituo la, mi hril raw khai,” a ta.

en: And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now into the hand of Jehovah; for his mercies are great; and let me not fall into the hand of man.
hmr: Chun, David chun Gad kuom- ah, “Ka lunginzîng hle el a, LALPA kutah tlulût phawt el lang; a zângaina chu a nasa hle sih a; mihriem kuta chen chu mîn tlûklûttir naw hram rawh,” a ta.

en: So Jehovah sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed; and there died of the people from Dan even to Beer-sheba seventy thousand men.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Israel mihai lai chun zîngkâra in- thawkin hun ruot ang chen chu hri ân lêngtir a, chuongchun, mipuihai laia mi chu Dana inthawka Beer-Seba chenah mi sîng sari an thih a.

en: And when the angel stretched out his hand toward Jerusalem to destroy it, Jehovah repented him of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed the people, It is enough; now stay thy hand. And the angel of Jehovah was by the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, vântirkoin sukse dinga Jerusalem tienga a kut a hang inlet chun LALPAIN thil ṭha naw thaw a tum chu ân lêt a, mihai sukbo- hmangtu vântirko kuoma chun, “A hun tah ie, i kut inlet ta naw rawh,” a ta. Chun, LALPA vântirko chu Jebus mi Arauna hrizâwl bula chun a um a.

en: And David spake unto Jehovah when he saw the angel that smote the people, and said, Lo, I have sinned, and I have done perversely; but these sheep, what have they done? let thy hand, I pray thee, be against me, and against my father’s house.
hmr: Chun, Davidin mi sukhlumtu vântirko a hmu chun LALPA a biek a, “Ngai ta, ka lo suol tah a, indik nawtakin thil ka lo thaw tah a nih; nisienlakhawm, hieng berâmhai hin ieng thil am an thawh a? I kut chun keima le ka pa sûnghai mi tâwk lem raw se aw,” a ta.

en: And Gad came that day to David, and said unto him, Go up, rear an altar unto Jehovah in the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun Gad chu David kuomah a feh a, a kuomah, “Hang fe la, Jebus mi Arauna hrizâwlah LALPA ta dingin mâichâm hang siem rawh,” a ta.

en: And David went up according to the saying of Gad, as Jehovah commanded.
hmr: Chun, David chu LALPAIN thu a pêk anga, Gadin a hril ang chun a hang fe tah a.

en: And Araunah looked forth, and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him: and Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
hmr: Chun, Arauna chu a hei ngha a, ama tieng pana lal le a rawihai hung chu a hmuh a, chuongchun, Arauna chu a suok a, a hmaia hnuoi sikin lal hmaa chun a bawkkhup a.

en: And Araunah said, Wherefore is my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To buy the threshing-floor of thee, to build an altar unto Jehovah, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
hmr: Chun, Arauna chun, “Iengdinga ka pu lal chu a siehlaw kuoma hi hung am a nih a?” a ta. Chun, David chun, “Mipuihai laia inthawka hri hi ân kieng theina dingin LALPA ta dinga mâichâm siemna dinga i hrizâwl hi inchaw dingin,” a ta.

en: And Araunah said unto David, Let my lord the king take and offer up what seemeth good unto him: behold, the oxen for the burnt-offering, and the threshing instruments and the yokes of the oxen for the wood:
hmr: Chun, Arauna chun David kuomah, “Lalpa ka pu chun âwm a ti chu la sienla, inhlân raw se, en ta, pumrawhmanga inhlân dingin bâwngchalhai chu an um a; chun, thing dingin hrizâwl hmangruohai le sebâwng thuomhnawhai chu a um bawk a.

en: all this, O king, doth Araunah give unto the king. And Araunah said unto the king, Jehovah thy God accept thee.
hmr: Aw, lalpa, hieng po po hi Arauna chun lal a pêk vawng a nih,” a ta. Chun, Arauna chun lal kuomah, “LALPA i Pathien chun hung dawn raw se che,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto Araunah, Nay; but I will verily buy it of thee at a price; neither will I offer burnt-offerings unto Jehovah my God which cost me nothing. So David bought the threshing-floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Arauna kuomah, “Ni lo e, a man neiin ân châwk ngeiin inchawpêk lem ka ti che, iengkhawm insêng loin LALPA ka Pathien kuom- ah pumrawhmang thilinhlân inhlân naw tawp ka tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, David chun hrizâwl le sebâwngchal- hai chu tangka shekel sâwmngain ân châwk tah a.

en: And David built there an altar unto Jehovah, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings. So Jehovah was entreated for the land, and the plague was stayed from Israel.
hmr: Chun, David chun chutaka chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm a siem a, pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai le inremna thilinhlânhai ân hlân a. Chuongchun, LALPA chu an ram chunga chun a lungâwi a, Israel rama inthawkin hri chu ân kieng tah a.24.24 1 Chr 21.34 24.25 Is 19.22

en: Now there was long war between the house of Saul and the house of David: and David waxed stronger and stronger, but the house of Saul waxed weaker and weaker.
hmr: Saula sûnghai le David sûnghai chu sâwttak an indo a, David chu a hung hrât tiel tiel a, Saula sûnghai ruok chu an hung hrât naw tiel tiel tah a.

en: And unto David were sons born in Hebron: and his first-born was Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess;
hmr: Chun, David chun Hebron khuoa chun naupasalhai a nei a, a naupa hmasa tak chu Ammon, Jezreel mi Ahinoam le an inkâra mi a nih;

en: and his second, Chileab, of Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite; and the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur;
hmr: a dawttu chu Kileab, Karmela mi Nabal nuhmei Abigail le an kâra mi a nih; chun, a pathumna chu Absalom, Gesur lal Talmai naunu Maaka naupa a na.

en: and the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith; and the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital;
hmr: Chun, a palina chu Adonija, Haggith naupa a nih, a pangana chu Sephatia, Abital naupa a nih;

en: and the sixth, Ithream, of Eglah, David’s wife. These were born to David in Hebron.
hmr: chun, a parukna chu Ithream, David nuhmei Egla le an kâra mi a nih. Hieng hai hi David nau Hebrona pienghai chu an nih.

en: And it came to pass, while there was war between the house of Saul and the house of David, that Abner made himself strong in the house of Saul.
hmr: Chun, Saula sûnghai le David sûnghai chu an indo lai chun, Abner chu Saula sûnghai laia chun ân sukhrât ta deu deu a.

en: Now Saul had a concubine, whose name was Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah: and Ish-bosheth said to Abner, Wherefore hast thou gone in unto my father’s concubine?
hmr: Saula chun hmei a nei a, a hming chu Rizpa, Aia naunu a nih. Chun, Is-boseth chun Abner kuomah, “Ieng- dinga ka pa hmeinu kuomah i fe am?” a ta.

en: Then was Abner very wroth for the words of Ish-bosheth, and said, Am I a dog’s head that belongeth to Judah? This day do I show kindness unto the house of Saul thy father, to his brethren, and to his friends, and have not delivered thee into the hand of David; and yet thou chargest me this day with a fault concerning this woman.
hmr: Chuongchun, Is-boseth thuhril chun Abner chu a suklungsen ta êm êm el a, “Judahai ui lu el am ka nih? Vawisûn chen hin i pa Saula sûnghai le a unauhai le a ruolhai chungah zainêmna ka suklang a, David kutah kân hlân naw cheh a, nisienlakhawm, nangin hi nuhmei chunga hin suolah i mîn tum el a.

en: God do so to Abner, and more also, if, as Jehovah hath sworn to David, I do not even so to him;
hmr: LALPAIN a kuoma ṭawng a lo inkhâm ta anga David ta dinga ka thaw naw chun Abner chu a law law law el sienla, chu nêka nasa khawmin.

en: to transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul, and to set up the throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan even to Beer-sheba.
hmr: Saula sûnghaia inthawka ram chu lâkpêk a, Israel le Judahai chungah Dana inthawka Beer-seba chena David lalṭhungpha tungding dinga ka va thaw naw chun,” a ta.

en: And he could not answer Abner another word, because he feared him.
hmr: Chuongchun, a ṭi êm leiin Abner chu a dawn khawm a dawn ngam ta nawh a.

en: And Abner sent messengers to David on his behalf, saying, Whose is the land? saying also, Make thy league with me, and, behold, my hand shall be with thee, to bring about all Israel unto thee.
hmr: Chun, Abner chun ama aiawin David kuoma chun, “Hi ram hi tu ta am a nih a?” tiin mitirhai a tir a; chun, “Ka kuomah thu thlung rawh, chuongchun, ngai ta, Israel mi po po i kuom tienga ṭhang dingin ka kut chu nangma tieng ṭhang a tih,” tiin a hril nâwk a.

en: And he said, Well; I will make a league with thee; but one thing I require of thee: that is, thou shalt not see my face, except thou first bring Michal, Saul’s daughter, when thou comest to see my face.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Aw le, i kuoma chun thu thlung ka tih, ami- ruokchu, nangma kuomah thil pakhat ka phût ding a nih, chu chu hi hi a nih; mi hmu dinga i hung phaleh Saula naunu Mikal kha i hung ṭhuoi phawt naw chun ka hmêl hmu thei naw ti nih,” a ta.

en: And David sent messengers to Ish-bosheth, Saul’s son, saying, Deliver me my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to me for a hundred foreskins of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, David chun Saula naupa Is-boseth kuoma chun, “Philistin mihai ser vun za khata kân châwk ka nuhmei Mikal chu mi hung pe rawh,” tiin mihai a tir a.

en: And Ish-bosheth sent, and took her from her husband, even from Paltiel the son of Laish.
hmr: Chun, Is-boseth chun mi a tir a, a pasal La-is naupa Paltiel kuom ngeia inthawk chun an ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And her husband went with her, weeping as he went, and followed her to Bahurim. Then said Abner unto him, Go, return: and he returned.
hmr: Chun, a pasal chu a kuoma chun a feh a, ṭap malam peiin a feh a, Bahurim chenin a zui a. Chuongchun, Abner chun a kuomah, “Fe rawh, kîr nâwk el rawh,” a tih a, chun, a kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And Abner had communication with the elders of Israel, saying, In times past ye sought for David to be king over you:
hmr: Chuongchun, Abner chun Israel mihai upahai chu a biek a, “Kha hma khan David chu in chunga lala um dingin in dit hlak a;

en: now then do it; for Jehovah hath spoken of David, saying, By the hand of my servant David I will save my people Israel out of the hand of the Philistines, and out of the hand of all their enemies.
hmr: tuhin siem ta ro khai LALPAIN David chungchâng thua chun, ‘Ka siehlaw David kutin ka mi Israelhai chu Philistin mihai kuta inthawk le, an hmêlmahai po po kuta inthawkin sansuok ka tih,’ tiin a hril a nih,” tiin.

en: And Abner also spake in the ears of Benjamin: and Abner went also to speak in the ears of David in Hebron all that seemed good to Israel, and to the whole house of Benjamin.
hmr: Chun, Abner chun Benjamin mihai na hrieta chun a hril bawk a; chun, Abner chu Israel mihai le Benjamin sûng po pohaiin ṭha an ti ang taphawt Hebrona David na hrieta hril dingin a fe bawk a.

en: So Abner came to David to Hebron, and twenty men with him. And David made Abner and the men that were with him a feast.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abner chu Hebrona David kuoma chun mi sâwmhni leh an feh a. Chun, David chun Abner le a kuoma mi sâwm- hnihai ta ding chun ruoi a ṭheh a.

en: And Abner said unto David, I will arise and go, and will gather all Israel unto my lord the king, that they may make a covenant with thee, and that thou mayest reign over all that thy soul desireth. And David sent Abner away; and he went in peace.
hmr: Abner chun David kuoma chun, “Tho ka ta, i kuoma thu an thlung theina ding le, i duthusâm angtaka ro i rêl theina dingin Israel mi po pohai ka lalpa kuoma hin hung kei khâwm dingin fêng ka tih,” a ta. Chun, David chun Abner chu ân fetir a, chuong- chun, lungmuongtak chun a fe tah a.

en: And, behold, the servants of David and Joab came from a foray, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, David mihai le Joab mihai rammu chu an hung a, râllâk tamtak an hung lâk a, nisienlakhawm, Abner chu Hebrona David kuoma chun a lo um ta nawh a; a lo infetir ta sih a, ama khawm chu lungmuongtakin a lo fe tah a nih.

en: When Joab and all the host that was with him were come, they told Joab, saying, Abner the son of Ner came to the king, and he hath sent him away, and he is gone in peace.
hmr: Joab le a kuoma mipui po po an hung tlung chun, “Nera naupa Abner chu lal kuomah a hung a, ama chun a lo infetir nâwk tah a, lungmuong- takin a fe nâwk tah,” tiin Joab chu an hril a.

en: Then Joab came to the king, and said, What hast thou done? behold, Abner came unto thee; why is it that thou hast sent him away, and he is quite gone?
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab chu lal kuoma chun a feh a, “I thil lo thaw hi iengtizie am a ni leh? Ngai ta, Abner chu i kuomah a hung a, iengdinga în fetir a, a fe dai el am a ni ta leh?

en: Thou knowest Abner the son of Ner, that he came to deceive thee, and to know thy going out and thy coming in, and to know all that thou doest.
hmr: Nera naupa Abner chu i hriet a, i suok i lût le i thilthaw iengkim hriet tuma hung a na,” a ta.

en: And when Joab was come out from David, he sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the well of Sirah: but David knew it not.
hmr: Chun, David kuoma inthawka Joab a hung suok chun Abner hnawt ding chun mi a tir a, Sira tuisunsuoa inthawkin an hung ṭhuoikîr a, nisien- lakhawm, David chun a hriet nawh.

en: And when Abner was returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside into the midst of the gate to speak with him quietly, and smote him there in the body, so that he died, for the blood of Asahel his brother.
hmr: Chun, Abner chun Hebron a hung tlung chun Joab chun kul kawt- khârah biekrûk dingin a ṭhuoi hran a, a unau Asahel thisen suok thungna dingin a phîngah a sun hlum tah a.

en: And afterward, when David heard it, he said, I and my kingdom are guiltless before Jehovah for ever of the blood of Abner the son of Ner:
hmr: Chun, a nakiea Davidin a hung hriet chun, “Nera naupa Abner thisen insuo thua hin kei le ka ram chu LALPA mithmuin inthieng kum- khuong kan ta,

en: let it fall upon the head of Joab, and upon all his father’s house; and let there not fail from the house of Joab one that hath an issue, or that is a leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that falleth by the sword, or that lacketh bread.
hmr: Joab lu chungah tla sienla, a pa sûnghai po po chunga leh; Joab sûng- haia inthawka thil pût amanih, phâr amanih, hmawl ringsana um mi amanih, kâwlhnâma thi amanih, ṭâm amanih hung um loin um naw raw se,” a ta.

en: So Joab and Abishai his brother slew Abner, because he had killed their brother Asahel at Gibeon in the battle.
hmr: Chuongchun, an unaupa Asahel chu Gibeona indonaa a that leiin Joab le a unau Abisai chun Abner chu an that tah a.

en: And David said to Joab, and to all the people that were with him, Rend your clothes, and gird you with sackcloth, and mourn before Abner. And king David followed the bier.
hmr: Chun, David chun Joab le a kuoma mipui po pohai kuoma chun, “In puonhai chu keithlêr unla, saiip puon sil unla, Abner chu sûn ro,” a ta. Chun, lal David chun hlâng chu a zui a.

en: And they buried Abner in Hebron: and the king lifted up his voice, and wept at the grave of Abner; and all the people wept.
hmr: Chun, Abner chu Hebrona chun an phûm a, lal chun a râwl ân suoh a. Abner thlâna chun a ṭap tah a; mipui po po khawm an ṭap a.

en: And the king lamented for Abner, and said, Should Abner die as a fool dieth?
hmr: Chun, lal chun Abner chu a ṭah a, “Abner chu invêt thiin a thi el ding a ni maw?

en: Thy hands were not bound, nor thy feet put into fetters: As a man falleth before the children of iniquity, so didst thou fall. And all the people wept again over him.
hmr: I kut hai chu khuop a ni nawh a, i ke hai chu kawl inbun a ni bawk nawh, Mi rilo nauhai hmaa mi a tlûk anga i tlûk el ta chu?” a ta. Chun, mi po po chun ama an ṭa nâwk a.

en: And all the people came to cause David to eat bread while it was yet day; but David sware, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if I taste bread, or aught else, till the sun be down.
hmr: Chuongchun, sûn a la ni laiin David chu bu infâktir dingin mi po po chu an hung a; nisienlakhawm, David chun, “Nisa tlâk hmaa bu amanih thil dang amani khawm a fâka ka fâk vai chun Pathien chun a law law mi law raw se, chu nêka nasa khawmin,” tiin ṭawng ân khâm a.

en: And all the people took notice of it, and it pleased them; as whatsoever the king did pleased all the people.
hmr: Chu chu mi po poin an hriet chun an lâwm êm êm a, lal thilthaw taphawthai chun mipuihai po po chu a suklâwm pei a.

en: So all the people and all Israel understood that day that it was not of the king to slay Abner the son of Ner.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui po po le Israel mi po pohai chun Nera naupa Abner thata um chu lal thu a ni nawh ti an hriet tah a.

en: And the king said unto his servants, Know ye not that there is a prince and a great man fallen this day in Israel?
hmr: Chun, lal chun a siehlawhai kuoma chun, “Vawisûn hin Israel mi lien, mi ropuitak a thi ti in hriet naw am a nih?

en: And I am this day weak, though anointed king; and these men the sons of Zeruiah are too hard for me: Jehovah reward the evil-doer according to his wickedness.
hmr: Lal dinga hrieknâl ni lang khawm, vawisûn hin ka hrât naw a nih; chun, hieng Zeruia nauhai hi ka ta dingin tuor hla an um taluo a nih; LALPAIN thil ṭha naw thawtu chu a suolzie ang peiin thung raw se,” a ta.

en: And when Ish-bosheth, Saul’s son, heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, his hands became feeble, and all the Israelites were troubled.
hmr: Saula naupa Is-boseth chun Hebronah Abner chu a thi ti a lo hriet chun a kuthai a hung hrât ta nawh a, chun, Israel mi po pohai chu an ṭi tah a.

en: And Ish-bosheth, Saul’s son, had two men that were captains of bands: the name of the one was Baanah, and the name of the other Rechab, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the children of Benjamin (for Beeroth also is reckoned to Benjamin:
hmr: Chun, Saula naupa Is-boseth chun sipai pâwl hotu pahni a nei a; pakhat hming chu Baanah a na, a dang hming chu Rekab a nih, Benjamin thla Beeroth mi Rimmon naupasalhai an nih; (Beeroth chu Benjamin rama ngai a ni sih a;

en: and the Beerothites fled to Gittaim, and have been sojourners there until this day).
hmr: Beeroth khuoa mihai chu Gittaim-ah an tlân a, tu chen hin chutaka chun an um tah a).

en: Now Jonathan, Saul’s son, had a son that was lame of his feet. He was five years old when the tidings came of Saul and Jonathan out of Jezreel; and his nurse took him up, and fled: and it came to pass, as she made haste to flee, that he fell, and became lame. And his name was Mephibosheth.
hmr: Saula naupa Jonathan chun naupa ke inbai a nei a, Jezreela inthawka Saula le Jonathan chan- chin an lo hriet chun kum nga mi a na; a dawntunu chun a pawm a, a tlânhmangpui tah a; chun, tlân- hmangpui dinga ân hmâwna kârah ân thlâk a, a ke a hung inbai tah a. A hming chu Mephiboseth a nih.

en: And the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, Rechab and Baanah, went, and came about the heat of the day to the house of Ish-bosheth, as he took his rest at noon.
hmr: Chun, Beeroth mi Rimmon nau- pahai Rekab le Baana chu an feh a; Is-boseth ina chun, nisa inding lai- takin, a sûn châwl lai takin an feh a.

en: And they came thither into the midst of the house, as though they would have fetched wheat; and they smote him in the body: and Rechab and Baanah his brother escaped.
hmr: Bu la ni âwmtakin insûng ril tieng chun an lût a, a phîngah an va sun a; chun, Rekab le a unaupa Baana chu an tlânhmang tah a.

en: Now when they came into the house, as he lay on his bed in his bedchamber, they smote him, and slew him, and beheaded him, and took his head, and went by the way of the Arabah all night.
hmr: Chun, inah an va lût a, a zâlna pindana khuma zâl chu an sun a, an that a, a lu an tan a, a lu chu an lâk a, Araba lampui tieng fe thlengin zânkhawvârin an feh a.

en: And they brought the head of Ish-bosheth unto David to Hebron, and said to the king, Behold, the head of Ish-bosheth, the son of Saul, thine enemy, who sought thy life; and Jehovah hath avenged my lord the king this day of Saul, and of his seed.
hmr: Chun, Is-boseth lu chu Hebrona chun David kuomah an hung lâk a, lal kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, hi nanga that tumtu, i hmêlma Saula naupa Is-boseth lu, LALPA chun kan lalpa phuba vawisûn hin Saula le a thlaa inthawkin a lâkpêk ta a ni hi,” an ta.

en: And David answered Rechab and Baanah his brother, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said unto them, As Jehovah liveth, who hath redeemed my soul out of all adversity,
hmr: Chun, David chun Beeroth mi Rimmon naupa Rekab le a unaupa chu a dawn a, an kuomah, “LALPA ka lunginzîngna po poa mi sandamtu hringna sâlin ka hril a nih;

en: when one told me, saying, Behold, Saul is dead, thinking to have brought good tidings, I took hold of him, and slew him in Ziklag, which was the reward I gave him for his tidings.
hmr: chanchin ṭha hung tluna inngaiin ‘Ngai ta, Saula chu a thi tah,’ tiin mi pakhatin a mi hung hril a, ama chu ka man a, Ziklaga chun ka that a; chu chu a chanchin ṭha hung intlun mana ka lo pêk chu a nih.

en: How much more, when wicked men have slain a righteous person in his own house upon his bed, shall I not now require his blood of your hand, and take you away from the earth?
hmr: Mi fel ama insûng luma, a khumlaizâwl ngeia mi, mi suolin an that a thisen man chu nangnia in- thawk hin ka phût nâwk zuolin, hnuoia inthawk hin ka va sukbo- hmang âwm ngei cheu deh aw,” a ta.

en: And David commanded his young men, and they slew them, and cut off their hands and their feet, and hanged them up beside the pool in Hebron. But they took the head of Ish-bosheth, and buried it in the grave of Abner in Hebron.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun a tlangvâlhai chu thu a pêk a, anni chun an that a, an kut le an kehai an tanpêk a, Hebrona dîl panga chun an khai a, Is-boseth lu ruok chu an lâk a, Hebrona Abner thlâna chun an phûm tah a.

en: Then came all the tribes of Israel to David unto Hebron, and spake, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel chihai po po chu Hebrona David kuomah an hung a, “Ngai ta, i ru le i tisahai kan na.

en: In times past, when Saul was king over us, it was thou that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and Jehovah said to thee, Thou shalt be shepherd of my people Israel, and thou shalt be prince over Israel.
hmr: Kha hmaa Saula kan chunga ân lal laia Israelhai ṭhuoi suok le ṭhuoi lûttu i ni hlak a; chun, LALPA chun i kuomah, ‘Ka mi Israelhai chu châwm i ta, Israelhai chungah hotuin um i tih,’ a tih a,” an ta.

en: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and king David made a covenant with them in Hebron before Jehovah: and they anointed David king over Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel upahai po po chu Hebrona chun lal kuomah an va feh a; chun, lal David chun Hebrona chun LALPA hmaah an kuomah thu a thlung a, chun, David chu Israelhai chunga lal dingin hriek an nâl a.

en: David was thirty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years.
hmr: David chu ân lal tîr lai chun kum sâwmthum mi a na, kum sâwmli sûng ân lal a.

en: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months; and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years over all Israel and Judah.
hmr: Hebrona chun Judahai chungah kum sari le thla ruk ân lal a; chun, Jerusalemah Israelhai le Judahai po po chungah kum sâwmthum le kum thum ân lal a.

en: And the king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, who spake unto David, saying, Except thou take away the blind and the lame, thou shalt not come in hither; thinking, David cannot come in hither.
hmr: Chun, lal le a mihai chu chu rama chêng Jebus mihai chu rûn dingin Jerusalemah an feh a; chuonghai chun David a hung lût thei naw ringin David kuomah, “Hitaka hin hung lût naw tawp i tih, mitdel le kebaihaiin lo dang an ti che,” an ta.

en: Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion; the same is the city of David.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, David chun Zion kul chu a lâk a, chu chu David khuo chu a nih.

en: And David said on that day, Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites, let him get up to the watercourse, and smite the lame and the blind, that are hated of David’s soul. Wherefore they say, There are the blind and the lame; he cannot come into the house.
hmr: Chun, David chun chu ni chun, “Jebus mihai thawtu taphawt chu tuiluongnaah hang fe hai sienla, David theidatu mitdel le kebai chu that raw hai se,” a ta. Chuongchun, “Mitdel le kebai chu ina chun lût naw nihai,” an ti hlak a.

en: And David dwelt in the stronghold, and called it the city of David. And David built round about from Millo and inward.
hmr: Chun, David chu kula chun a um a, David khuo tiin ân bûk tah a. Chun, David chun Milloa inthawkin a vêlin kul a siem a, a sûngtieng leh.

en: And David waxed greater and greater; for Jehovah, the God of hosts, was with him.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu a hung ropui ta deu deu a, LALPA, sipaihai Pathien chu a kuoma a um pei leiin.

en: And Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar-trees, and carpenters, and masons; and they built David a house.
hmr: Chun, Tura lal Hiram chun David kuomah mi a tir a, sidar thinghai a thawn a, themthiemhai le lung suttuhai a tir bawk a, David ta ding chun in an bâwlpêk a.

en: And David perceived that Jehovah had established him king over Israel, and that he had exalted his kingdom for his people Israel’s sake.
hmr: Chun, David chun LALPAIN Israelhai chungah lalah ama chu a sukdet a, a mi Israelhai leiin a ram chu a chawimawi a nih ti a hriet tah a.

en: And David took him more concubines and wives out of Jerusalem, after he was come from Hebron; and there were yet sons and daughters born to David.
hmr: Chun, David chun Hebron a suoksan hnungin Jerusalema chun thaikêm le nuhmei a nei belsah a; chuongchun, David chun naupasal- hai le naunuhmeihai a la nei sa ta rawp a.

en: And these are the names of those that were born unto him in Jerusalem: Shammua, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon,
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema a neihai hming chu hieng hi an nih; Sammua, Sobab, Nathan, Solomon,

en: and Ibhar, and Elishua, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
hmr: Ibhar, Elisua, Nepheg, Japhia,

en: and Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet.
hmr: Elisama, Eliada, le Eliphelet hai hi an nih.

en: And when the Philistines heard that they had anointed David king over Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David; and David heard of it, and went down to the stronghold.
hmr: Philistin mihai chun David chu Israelhaiin lala um dingin hriek an nâl ti an hrietin Philistin mihai po po chu David zawng ding chun an hang fe tah a; David chun chu chu a lo hrietin a kulbînga chun a feh a.

en: Now the Philistines had come and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chu an hung a, Rephaim ruoma chun an inzar a.

en: And David inquired of Jehovah, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into my hand? And Jehovah said unto David, Go up; for I will certainly deliver the Philistines into thy hand.
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Philistin mihai thaw dingin kan hang fe ding am a nih? ka kuta hin anni chu pêng i ti?” tiin LALPA a rawn a. LALPA chun David kuoma chun, “Hang fe rawh, Philistin mihai chu i kutah ka pêk ngei ngei ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And David came to Baal-perazim, and David smote them there; and he said, Jehovah hath broken mine enemies before me, like the breach of waters. Therefore he called the name of that place Baal-perazim.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu Baal- perazima chun a feh a, chutaka chun David chun anni chu a hneh a, “LALPAIN ka hmêlmahai chu tuiting inṭhe ang elin ka hmaah a mi sukdarpêk tah,” a ta. Chuleiin, chu hmun hming ding chun Baal-perazim ân bûk a.

en: And they left their images there; and David and his men took them away.
hmr: Chutaka chun Philistin mihai chun an milimhai an mâksan a, David le a mihai chun an lâk a.

en: And the Philistines came up yet again, and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chu an hang fe nâwk a, Rephaim ruoma chun an inzar nâwk a.

en: And when David inquired of Jehovah, he said, Thou shalt not go up: make a circuit behind them, and come upon them over against the mulberry-trees.
hmr: Chun, Davidin LALPA a hang rawn chun, ama chun, “Hang fe naw rawh, an hnungtieng fe huol la, thingtheihmi kûng zâwna khin hang thaw rawh.

en: And it shall be, when thou hearest the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry-trees, that then thou shalt bestir thyself; for then is Jehovah gone out before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, thingtheihmi kûng lêra fe ri ṭhup ṭhup ang i hriet pha chun châng rawh, Philistin sipaihai thaw dingin i hmaah LALPA a suok tah tina nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And David did so, as Jehovah commanded him, and smote the Philistines from Geba until thou come to Gezer.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPAIN thu a pêk angin David chun a thawh a, Philistin mihai chu Gebaa inthawka Gezer chenin a that a.

en: And David again gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.
hmr: David chun Israel mihai laia thlang ṭhieu mi sîng thum ân khâwm nâwk a.

en: And David arose, and went with all the people that were with him, from Baale-judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God, which is called by the Name, even the name of Jehovah of hosts that sitteth above the cherubim.
hmr: Chun, David chu a tho a, Juda rama Baala khuoa inthawkin cherub- hai chunga chuong sipaihai LALPA hming an inputtir Pathien bâwm chu zu la dingin a kuoma mi um po pohai le chun an inthawk tah a.

en: And they set the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab that was in the hill: and Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, drove the new cart.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bâwm chu taw- lailîr tharah an sieh a, tlânga um Abinadab ina inthawk chun an lâk suok a, Abinadab naupasalhai Uzza le Ahio chun tawlailîr thar chu an khal a.

en: And they brought it out of the house of Abinadab, which was in the hill, with the ark of God: and Ahio went before the ark.
hmr: Chun, tlânga Abinadab ina inthawk chun, Pathien bâwm pum chun an lâk suok a; Ahio chu Pathien bâwm hma tieng chun a feh a.

en: And David and all the house of Israel played before Jehovah with all manner of instruments made of fir-wood, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with castanets, and with cymbals.
hmr: Chun, David le Israel mi po pohai chun LALPA hmaah thil inri thei chi hran hran fâr thinga siem le, ṭing- ṭanghai dâm, perkhuonghai dâm, khuongtêhai dâm, tawtawrâwt bi neihai dâm, dârbenthekhai dâm an sut a.

en: And when they came to the threshing-floor of Nacon, Uzzah put forth his hand to the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the oxen stumbled.
hmr: Chun, Nakon hrizâwl an tlung chun Uzza chun Pathien bâwm chu a hei ban a, a chel a; sebâwng chu a pêm a pêm leiin.

en: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Uzzah; and God smote him there for his error; and there he died by the ark of God.
hmr: Chun, LALPA lung chu Uzza chunga chun a sen ta thut a, a thil- thaw indik naw lei chun Pathienin chutaka chun a sukhlum tah a; Pathien bâwm kâwla chun a thi tah a.

en: And David was displeased, because Jehovah had broken forth upon Uzzah; and he called that place Perez-uzzah, unto this day.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu Uzza chunga a hung ṭuong ta lei chun David chu a lunginsen a, chu hmun chu Perez- uzza ân bûk a; chu chu tu chen hin a la ni ta zing a.

en: And David was afraid of Jehovah that day; and he said, How shall the ark of Jehovah come unto me?
hmr: Chu ni chun David chun LALPA chu a ṭih a, “Iengtin am LALPA bâwm hi ka kuom hung tlung thei a ta aw?” a ta.

en: So David would not remove the ark of Jehovah unto him into the city of David; but David carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun David khuoa chun LALPA bâwm chu a kuomah a lâk nuom ta nawh a, David chun Git mi Obed-edom ina chun a sie ta lem a.

en: And the ark of Jehovah remained in the house of Obed-edom the Gittite three months: and Jehovah blessed Obed-edom, and all his house.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm chu Git mi Obed-edom ina chun thla thum a um a, chuongchun, Obed-edom le a sûng- hai po po chu LALPAIN mal a sâwm a.

en: And it was told king David, saying, Jehovah hath blessed the house of Obed-edom, and all that pertaineth unto him, because of the ark of God. And David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-edom into the city of David with joy.
hmr: Chun, lal David chu, “Pathien bâwm leiin Obed-edom sûngkuo le a in le lo po po LALPAIN mal a sâwm a nih,” ti an hril a. Chuongchun, David chun Pathien bâwm chu Obed-edom ina inthawk chun David khuoa chun lâwmtakin a zu lâk tah a.

en: And it was so, that, when they that bare the ark of Jehovah had gone six paces, he sacrificed an ox and a fatling.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm zâwntuhai chu pên ruk an fe phingleh se- bâwngchal le ran châwm thâuin an inthâwi a.

en: And David danced before Jehovah with all his might; and David was girded with a linen ephod.
hmr: Chun, David chu a theitâwpin LALPA hmaah a lâm a, David chun puonzaiinhmi thiempu zakawsîng a hâk a.

en: So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of Jehovah with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le Israel mi po pohai chun khêk dur dur pum le tawtawrâwt mût ruoi ruoi pumin LALPA bâwm chu an lâk tah a.

en: And it was so, as the ark of Jehovah came into the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David leaping and dancing before Jehovah; and she despised him in her heart.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm chu David khuoa a lût lai chun Saula naunu Mikal chun tukvera inthawk hin a lo thlîr a; LALPA hmaa David lâm le inchâwm chu a zuk hmuh a, a hmusit lungril tah a.

en: And they brought in the ark of Jehovah, and set it in its place, in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it; and David offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings before Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA bâwm chu an lâk lût a, a siena dinga Davidin a zar, puon in sûnga a hmun dinga chun an sie tah a; chun, David chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân le inremna thilinhlân chu LALPA hmaa chun ân hlân a.

en: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offering and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chun, Davidin pumrawhmang thilinhlân le inremna thil inhlânhai ân hlân zo chun, sipaihai LALPA hmingin mipuihai chu mal a sâwm a.

en: And he dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, both to men and women, to every one a cake of bread, and a portion of flesh, and a cake of raisins. So all the people departed every one to his house.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po, Israel mi pumpuihai chu a nuhmei a pasalin mi tin el chu bei hlawm khat le sa tlin khat le grêp ra emṭâwl bâwr khat a sem seng a. Chuongchun, mi po po chu mâni in tieng an fe ta seng a.

en: Then David returned to bless his household. And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, How glorious was the king of Israel to-day, who uncovered himself to-day in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself!
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu a sûnghai malsâwm dingin a fe tah a. Chun, Saula naunu Mikal chu David tuok ding chun a hung suok a, “Vawisûna Israel lal chu a va ropui de! Mi hotak inzakna châng hre lo, ruoka um ang elin vawisûn khan a siehlaw nunghâkhai mithmuah ruok- in a um kha teh!” a lo tih a.

en: And David said unto Michal, It was before Jehovah, who chose me above thy father, and above all his house, to appoint me prince over the people of Jehovah, over Israel: therefore will I play before Jehovah.
hmr: David chun Mikal kuoma chun, “I pa le a sûnghai po po aiah mi thlang a, LALPA mi Israelhai chunga lal dinga mi ruottu LALPA hmaah i sawnnaw, LALPA hmaa chu lâm âwm hrim ka nih.

en: And I will be yet more vile than this, and will be base in mine own sight: but of the handmaids of whom thou hast spoken, of them shall I be had in honor.
hmr: Hieng nêk hmanin inzapui la um ka tih, kei le kei khawm lân sit pei bawk ka ta; amiruokchu, chuong sie- hlaw nunghâkhai i hrilhai chawi- mawi chun um ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula naunu Mikal chun a thi chenin nau a nei ta nawh a.

en: And it came to pass, when the king dwelt in his house, and Jehovah had given him rest from all his enemies round about,
hmr: Chun, lal chu a inah a um a, LALPAIN an vêla a hmêlmahai po poa inthawka râlmuonga ân umtir hnung chun,

en: that the king said unto Nathan the prophet, See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of God dwelleth within curtains.
hmr: lal chun zâwlnei Nathan kuom- ah, “Hi, kei chu sidar thing inah ka um a, Pathien bâwm ruok chu puon in elah a um a,” a tih a.

en: And Nathan said to the king, Go, do all that is in thy heart; for Jehovah is with thee.
hmr: Chun, Nathan chun lal kuomah, “I lungrila a um ang tak chun va thaw rawh, LALPA i kuomah a um annâwm,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass the same night, that the word of Jehovah came unto Nathan, saying,
hmr: Chun, chu zân vêk chun Nathan kuomah LALPA thu a hung tlung a,

en: Go and tell my servant David, Thus saith Jehovah, Shalt thou build me a house for me to dwell in?
hmr: “Fe la, ka siehlaw David chu va hril rawh, ‘LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih; Ka umna dingin nangin in i mi bâwlpêk ding am a nih?

en: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but have walked in a tent and in a tabernacle.
hmr: Israel thlahai Aigupta rama inthawka ka ṭhuoi suoka inthawkin tu chen hin inah ka um ngai nawh a, puon ina le biekbûkah ka um pei lem hlak a.

en: In all places wherein I have walked with all the children of Israel, spake I a word with any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people Israel, saying, Why have ye not built me a house of cedar?
hmr: Israel thlahai lai po poah, ka fena taphawtahai khawm, ka mi Israelhai châwm dinga thu ka ipêk rorêltuhai kuomah, Iengdinga sidar thinga in i mi bâwlpêk naw am a na,’ tiin ka hril hlak am a nih?

en: Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be prince over my people, over Israel;
hmr: Chuleiin, ka siehlaw David kuomah, Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng ang hin a ti a nih, ‘berâm tlatna hmuna inthawka i berâm vêng lai chun ka mi Israelhai chunga hotu dingin ka lâk cheh a;

en: and I have been with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee; and I will make thee a great name, like unto the name of the great ones that are in the earth.
hmr: chun, i fena taphawtah i kuomah ka um pei a, i hmaa chun i hmêlmahai ka sukbo pei a, hnuoia mi ropuitakhai hming ang hming ropuitak siempêk ka ti che.

en: And I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as at the first,
hmr: Chun, ka mi Israelhai ta dingin hmun ruot ka ta, anni ngei puol hmuna an um a, an insawn ta nawna dingin anni chu phun ka ta, kha hma ang khan mi rilohaiin sukrimsi ta naw ni hai a;

en: and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel; and I will cause thee to rest from all thine enemies. Moreover Jehovah telleth thee that Jehovah will make thee a house.
hmr: ka mi Israelhai chunga rorêl- tuhai ka ruot lai ang kha ni bawk ta naw nih; chun, i hmêlmahai po poa inthawk hin inchâwltir ka ti che. Chun, chu naw hrima khawm, LALPAIN, LALPA chun sûngkuo indinpêk a ti che ti a hril a nih.

en: When thy days are fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, that shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom.
hmr: I nihai a kina, i puhai kuoma i zâl pha chun, i hnunga i thla, i rîla ra ding chu tungding ka ta, a ram chu sukdet ka tih.

en: He shall build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom for ever.
hmr: Ama chun ka hming dingin in bâwl a ta; chun, a ram lalṭhungpha chu kumkhuoa dingin suknghet ka tih.

en: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: if he commit iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men;
hmr: A pa nîng ka ta, ama chu ka naupa nîng a ta, thil a suksuol chun mihriem nauhai hmawl le mihriem nauhai vuoknain thunun ka ta;

en: but my lovingkindness shall not depart from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I put away before thee.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, i hmaa ka sawnhmang Saula kuoma inthawka ka lâk hmang ang khan ka zangaina chun ama chu mâksan naw nih.

en: And thy house and thy kingdom shall be made sure for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.
hmr: Chun, i sûngkuo le i ram chu chatuona suknghet tlat nîng a ta, i lalṭhungpha chu chatuona suknghet nîng a tih,’ a tih,” tiin LALPA thu a hung tlung a.

en: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
hmr: Chuong thu po po ang le, chu inlârna ang chie chun Nathanin David kuoma chun a hril a.

en: Then David the king went in, and sat before Jehovah; and he said, Who am I, O Lord Jehovah, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me thus far?
hmr: Chuongchun, lal David chu a lût a, LALPA hmaa chun a ṭhung a, “Aw Lalpa PATHIEN, tu am ka na, ka sûnghai tu am an na, hi chen chen hi i mi ṭhuoi?

en: And this was yet a small thing in thine eyes, O Lord Jehovah; but thou hast spoken also of thy servant’s house for a great while to come; and this too after the manner of men, O Lord Jehovah!
hmr: Aw Lalpa PATHIEN, chuong khawm chu nanga mithmua chun thil chîn tham el chu a na, nisienlakhawm, i siehlaw sûngkuo hung umdân ding chu kum tamtak sûnga khan i lo hril ta bawk a, Aw Lalpa PATHIEN, hienghai khawm hi mihriemhai thaw dân ang bawk a na.

en: And what can David say more unto thee? for thou knowest thy servant, O Lord Jehovah.
hmr: David hin i kuomah ieng am hril nâwk chuong tâng a ta? I siehlaw hi i hriet vawng si, Aw Lalpa PATHIEN.

en: For thy word’s sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou wrought all this greatness, to make thy servant know it.
hmr: I siehlaw hriet dingin i thu lei le nangma lungril ang peiin hieng thil ropuitak hi i thaw tah a.

en: Wherefore thou art great, O Jehovah God: for there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
hmr: Chuleichun, Aw LALPA Pa- thien, nang chu i ropui a nih, kan naa kan hriet angin nanga ang hrim hrim an um nawh a, nangma naw chu Pathien hrim hrim an um bawk nawh.

en: And what one nation in the earth is like thy people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem unto himself for a people, and to make him a name, and to do great things for you, and terrible things for thy land, before thy people, whom thou redeemedst to thee out of Egypt, from the nations and their gods?
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawk le hnam tin le an pathienhaia inthawka i ta dinga în tlansuok, i mihai hmaa i ta dinga thil ropuitak le i ram ta dinga thil ṭiumtak thaw ding le ama hming ropuitak siem dinga Pathienin ama mihai ni dinga a hung intlansuok i mi Israelhai ang hrim hrim hi khawvêla hin hnam dang tu am an um a?

en: And thou didst establish to thyself thy people Israel to be a people unto thee for ever; and thou, Jehovah, becamest their God.
hmr: Chuongchun, i mi Israelhai chu chatuona i mihai an ni theina dingin i ta dingin i suknghet tah a; chun, LALPA, nang chu an Pathien i hung ni tah a.

en: And now, O Jehovah God, the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, confirm thou it for ever, and do as thou hast spoken.
hmr: Chuongchun, Aw LALPA Pa- thien, i siehlaw chungchâng thu le a sûnghai chungchâng thu i hril chu chatuona dingin suknghet la, i hril ta ang khan thaw rawh.

en: And let thy name be magnified for ever, saying, Jehovah of hosts is God over Israel; and the house of thy servant David shall be established before thee.
hmr: Chun, ‘Sipaihai LALPA chu Israelhai Pathien a nih,’ tiin, i hming chu chatuona chawimawiin um raw se; chuongchun, i siehlaw David sûng- hai hi i hmaa suknghetin um an tih.

en: For thou, O Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, hast revealed to thy servant, saying, I will build thee a house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer unto thee.
hmr: Aw Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien, i siehlaw kuomah, ‘Sûngkuo chu inngîrpêk ka ti che,’ tiin i phuong ta sih a, chuleiin, i siehlaw hin hi ṭawngṭaina hi i kuomah ân tlun ngam a nih.

en: And now, O Lord Jehovah, thou art God, and thy words are truth, and thou hast promised this good thing unto thy servant:
hmr: Aw LALPA Pathien, Nang chu Pathien i na, i thu chu thutak a na; chun, hi thilṭha hi i siehlaw kuoma chun i tiem tah a;

en: now therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee; for thou, O Lord Jehovah, hast spoken it: and with thy blessing let the house of thy servant be blessed for ever.
hmr: chuleiin, i siehlaw sûnghai chu i hmaa chatuona an um zing theina dingin malsâwm la, aw LALPA Pathien, nang chun i hril ta sih a; chun, i malsâwmnain i siehlaw sûng- hai chu chatuona malsâwmin um raw se,” a ta.

en: And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them: and David took the bridle of the mother city out of the hand of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun David chun Philistin mihai chu a thawh a, a hne tah a; chuongchun, David chun Philistin mihai thuneina khaw- pui chu a lâkpêk tah a.

en: And he smote Moab, and measured them with the line, making them to lie down on the ground; and he measured two lines to put to death, and one full line to keep alive. And the Moabites became servants to David, and brought tribute.
hmr: Chun, Moab mihai a thaw nâwk a, a hnuoiah ân zâltir a, inkhina hruiin ân khih a; tlar hni chu suk- hlum dingin ân khih a, tlar khat chu a tluona hring dingin ân khih a. Chuongchun, Moab mihai chu David siehlawhai an hung ni tah a, thil- pêkhai dâm an hung pêk hlak a.

en: David smote also Hadadezer the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as he went to recover his dominion at the River.
hmr: David chun Euphrates vadunga a ram la dinga a fe malamin Zoba leh Rehob naupa Hadadezer chu a thawh a.

en: And David took from him a thousand and seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David hocked all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for a hundred chariots.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun a sakawr chung chuong mi sâng khat le za sari le sipai sîng hni a manpêk a; chun, David chun tawlailîr kei mi sakawrhai po po chu an thahrui a satpêk a, tawlailîr za hnûktu ding ruok chu a hlah a.

en: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succor Hadadezer king of Zobah, David smote of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
hmr: Chun, Damaskaa Suria mihai Zoba lal Hadadezer san dinga fehai chu David chun Suria mihai laia mi chu sîng hni le sâng hni a that a.

en: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute. And Jehovah gave victory to David whithersoever he went.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Suria rama Damaskaa chun sipaihai a sieh a; chuongchun, Suria mihai chu David siehlawhai an hung ni tah a, thilpêkhai an hung pêk hlak a. Chun, LALPAIN David chu a fena tieng ta- phawta chun ân hnetir pei a.

en: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, David chun Hadadezer rawihai rângkachak phawhai chu a lâkpêk a, Jerusalem tieng a phur a.

en: And from Betah and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, king David took exceeding much brass.
hmr: Chun, Hadadezer khuo Betaa inthawk dâm, Berothaia inthawk dâmin dâr tamtak a lâk a.

en: And when Toi king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer,
hmr: Chun, Hamath lal Toi chun Hadadezer sipaihai po po David chun a hne ti a lo hriet a.

en: then Toi sent Joram his son unto king David, to salute him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and smitten him: for Hadadezer had wars with Toi. And Joram brought with him vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass:
hmr: Hadadezer chu a thawh a, a hne leiin chibai bûk dingin le lâwmpui dingin Toi chun a naupa Joram chu David kuomah a tir a, Hadadezer chun Toi hi a lo do hlak hrim a na. Chun, Joram chun tang- karaw bêlhai dâm, rângkachak bêlhai dâm, dâr bêlhai dâm a hung chawi a;

en: these also did king David dedicate unto Jehovah, with the silver and gold that he dedicated of all the nations which he subdued;
hmr: chuong chu ram a hne ta po poa mi tangkaruo le rângkachak ân hlânhai le chun lal David chun LALPA ân hlân bawk a.

en: of Syria, and of Moab, and of the children of Ammon, and of the Philistines, and of Amalek, and of the spoil of Hadadezer, son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
hmr: Suria mihai ta dâm, Moab mi- hai ta dâm, Ammon thlahai ta dâm, Philistin mihai ta dâm, Amalek mihai ta dâm, Zoba lal Rehob naupa Hada- dezera inthawka a râllâkhai dâm an nih.

en: And David gat him a name when he returned from smiting the Syrians in the Valley of Salt, even eighteen thousand men.
hmr: Chun, David chu Chi Ruoma, Suria mi sîng khat le sâng riet a thaw hung tieng chun a hming ân thang tah a.

en: And he put garrisons in Edom; throughout all Edom put he garrisons, and all the Edomites became servants to David. And Jehovah gave victory to David whithersoever he went.
hmr: Chun, Edoma chun râl vêng sipai a sieh a, Edom ram hmun tinah sipai a sie nghuon el a; chuongchun, Edom mihai po po chu David sie- hlawhai an hung ni tah a; chuong- chun, LALPAIN David chu a fena tieng taphawtah ân hnetir ta pei a.

en: And David reigned over all Israel; and David executed justice and righteousness unto all his people.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Israel mi po pohai chungah ro a rêl a; chun, David chun a mihai po po chunga chun feltakin ro a rêl a.

en: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
hmr: Chun, Zeruia naupa Joab chu sipai hotu tak a na; chun, Ahilud naupa Jehosaphat chu chanchin ziektu a nih;

en: and Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, were priests; and Seraiah was scribe;
hmr: chun, Ahitub naupa Zadok le Abiathar naupa Ahimelek chu thiempu an nih; chun, Seraia chu ziektu a nih;

en: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief ministers.
hmr: chun, Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu Kereth mi le Peleth mihai hotu a nih; chun, David naupasalhai chu thiempu an nih.

en: And David said, Is there yet any that is left of the house of Saul, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Jonathan leia lunginsietna kân langtir theina dingin Saula sûnghai laia mi um an la um am aw?” a ta.

en: And there was of the house of Saul a servant whose name was Ziba, and they called him unto David; and the king said unto him, Art thou Ziba? And he said, Thy servant is he.
hmr: Chun, Saula sûnghai siehlaw pakhat a hming Ziba a um a, David kuoma fe dingin an ko a; chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Ziba i ni maw?” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Ni e, kei i sie- hlawpa hi,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Is there not yet any of the house of Saul, that I may show the kindness of God unto him? And Ziba said unto the king, Jonathan hath yet a son, who is lame of his feet.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Pathien lungin- sietna ka suklang theina dingin Saula sûnghai laia mi an la um naw am a nih?” a ta. Chun, Ziba chun, “Jonathan chun naupasal pakhat a la nei a, a kehai khawm ân bai nghe ngheh a,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto him, Where is he? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, in Lo-debar.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Ama chu khaw lai am a um a?” a ta. Chun, Ziba chun lal kuomah, “Lo-debarah, Ammiel naupa Makir inah a um,” a ta.

en: Then king David sent, and fetched him out of the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, from Lo-debar.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal David chun mi a tir a, Lo-debara inthawk, Ammiel naupa Makir ina mi chu an va ṭhuoi a.

en: And Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, came unto David, and fell on his face, and did obeisance. And David said, Mephibosheth. And he answered, Behold, thy servant!
hmr: Chun, Saula nau Jonathan nau- pa Mephiboseth chu David kuoma chun a hung a, a hmaia hnuoi sikin chibai a bûk a. Chun, David chun, “Mephiboseth,” a ta. Ama chun, “En ta, i siehlaw hi,” a tih a, a dawn a.

en: And David said unto him, Fear not; for I will surely show thee kindness for Jonathan thy father’s sake, and will restore thee all the land of Saul thy father; and thou shalt eat bread at my table continually.
hmr: Chun, David chun a kuomah, “Ṭi naw rawh, i pa Jonathan zârah lunginsiet ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, i pu Saula ram po po inneitir nâwk ka ti cheh a; chun, ka dawkânah buthlêng awt ve rawp ta hlak i tih,” a ta.

en: And he did obeisance, and said, What is thy servant, that thou shouldest look upon such a dead dog as I am?
hmr: Chun, chibai a bûk a, “Kei, ui thitlaw ang el, i siehlaw hi ieng am a nia i ngaisak a ni leh?” a ta.

en: Then the king called to Ziba, Saul’s servant, and said unto him, All that pertained to Saul and to all his house have I given unto thy master’s son.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun Saula siehlaw Ziba chu a ko a, a kuomah, “Saula thil po po le, a sûnghai thilhai po po chu i pu naupa hi ka pêk vawng a nih.

en: And thou shalt till the land for him, thou, and thy sons, and thy servants; and thou shalt bring in the fruits, that thy master’s son may have bread to eat: but Mephibosheth thy master’s son shall eat bread alway at my table. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
hmr: Chun, a ta dingin hnuoi inlet- pêk i ta, nang le i naupasalhai le i siehlawhai leh; chun, i pu naupa chun fâk dinghai a nei theina dingin i thawsuokhai chu hung lâng i ta, i pu naupa Mephiboseth ruok hin chu ka dawkânah buthlêng awt rawp a tih,” a ta. Ziba chun naupasal sâwmpanga le siehlaw sâwmhni a nei a.

en: Then said Ziba unto the king, According to all that my lord the king commandeth his servant, so shall thy servant do. As for Mephibosheth, said the king, he shall eat at my table, as one of the king’s sons.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ziba chun lal kuomah, “Lal ka puin a siehlaw kuoma thu a pêk ang po po hin i siehlaw hin thâwng a tih,” a ta. Lal chun, “Mephiboseth chun chu ka dawkânah lal naupa ang bawkin buthlêng awt vêng a tih,” a ta.

en: And Mephibosheth had a young son, whose name was Mica. And all that dwelt in the house of Ziba were servants unto Mephibosheth.
hmr: Mephiboseth chun naupasal naupang hi a nei a, a hming chu Mika a nih. Chun, Ziba ina um po pohai chu Mephiboseth siehlawhai an na.

en: So Mephibosheth dwelt in Jerusalem; for he did eat continually at the king’s table. And he was lame in both his feet.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mephiboseth chu Jerusalema chun a um tah a, lal dawkâna chun buthlêng a awt ve rawp ta sih a; a ke chu khinghnia inbai a nih.
